russia launched a major missile barrage on ukraine early thursday morning striking dozen of residential building leaving at least six people dead and compromising a major nuclear plant ukrainian official said the attack included more than missile and eight drone striking target across ukraine including the capital city of kyiv it wa the largest of the attack in recent week last night russia attacked ukraine with missile and shahed drone thirty four cruise missile and drone were shot down by ukraine s air defense eight russian missile missed their target the ukrainian defense department said a a result of the attack the zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant previously conquered by russian troop lost power according to nuclear state operator energoatom according to energoatom the nuclear plant relies on diesel generator which can run the station for day this is the sixth time the plant ha suffered a blackout after it became occupied by russian troop month ago the zaporizhzhia plant ha been subject to international concern a a potential explosion or meltdown could result in unprecedented destruction to the surrounding area the countdown ha begun energoatom said lviv gov maksym kozytskyi said five people were killed in the lviv region and three building were destroyed the number of fatality could climb a rescue worker are continuing to comb through the rubble he said dnipropetrovsk gov serhii lysak said a sixth person wa killed and two others were wounded in multiple strike across the region odesa gov maksym marchenko also said residential building were hit and several power line were damaged in addition at least six missile and one drone were shot down three power station owned by private electricity operator dtek were also reportedly struck during the attack there were no casualty but the equipment wa severely damaged the company said kyiv mayor vitali klitschko said three people were wounded in the city s sviatoshynskyi district and infrastructure and vehicle in the city were also destroyed we woke up from the explosion it wa very loud and we saw the car burning said maryna kuryluk a year old resident an alarm remained in kyiv overnight and into the early morning hour it wa lifted just before a m russia s missile barrage came a it force advanced into ukraine s bakhmut where the two side have fought for six month much of the city ha been destroyed or reduced to ash the attack also came after u n secretary general antonio guterres visited kyiv for talk with ukranian president volodymyr zelenskyy on keeping ukrainian shipping port open to ship grain from it black sea port ukrainian energy minister herman halushchenko condemned the missile strike a another barbaric massive attack on the energy infrastructure of ukraine mentioning on will fall ukrainian tank soldier to afp the battle for artyomovsk a major stronghold and logistics hub for kiev s force in the donetsk people s republic dpr ha been underway for month being described by some a the fiercest in the conflict between moscow and kiev earlier this week russian official said the encirclement of the city had almost been completed and reported heavy street battle inside it speaking about artyomovsk earlier this week u secretary of defense lloyd austin suggested that the city wa more of symbolic than operational importance the fall of artyomovsk won t necessarily mean that the russian have changed the tide of this fight the pentagon chief said however austin wa contradicted by russian defense minister sergey shoigu who explained that taking artyomovsk under control on tuesday he denied claim that his top general had urged him to withdraw troop from the area the fight for artyomovsk known in ukraine a bakhmut ha been raging since august the stronghold is a further they could go to kramatorsk they could go to slavyansk it would be an open road for the russian after bakhmut to other town in ukraine in the donetsk direction zelensky suggested that if the ukraine ukraine s top general want to bolster the defense of the embattled eastern city of bakhmut the government said monday signaling that rather than retreat from the city they will pursue a strategy of bleeding the russian army in a battle of attrition before a planned ukrainian counterattack ukraine ha calculated that the brutal siege is weakening and tying down russia s military even a kyiv awaits a new arsenal of weaponry from the west including tank and long range precision rocket to enable an expected drive to retake occupied territory elsewhere this achievement ukrainian official say justifies their own high casualty toll though soldier in the field and some military analyst have questioned the wisdom of defending a mostly abandoned ruined city in seesaw fighting on the city s artillery blasted street and nearby village and farm field the loss on both side have been staggering in the longest sustained russian assault since the invasion last year gradual russian advance have led some ukrainian official in recent week to hint at the possibility of a retreat to avoid encirclement but ukrainian assault brigade went on the attack over the weekend and appeared to push back russian force yevgeny v prigozhin the leader of the wagner mercenary group which ha led russian assault on bakhmut said on monday that russia wa at risk of losing the battle just day after he had claimed to have the ukrainian on the brink of defeat after meeting with top general on monday president volodymyr zelensky said that both the commander in chief of ukraine s military valeriy zaluzhnyi and the commander of ground force oleksandr syrsky supported reinforcing bakhmut s defense both general replied do not withdraw and reinforce mr zelensky said later in his nightly video address he added i told the commander in chief to find the appropriate force to help the guy in bakhmut neither in his address nor in a statement issued earlier by his office wa any mention made of a possibility some independent analyst have described a quiet gradual ukrainian pullback into smaller easier to defend pocket within the city rather than a broad sudden retreat in attacking bakhmut since last summer russia s signature tactic ha been to send wave of assault by small unit that suffer fearful loss probing defense and forcing the ukrainian who gun them down to reveal their position to follow up attacker in particular fighter recruited from among prison inmate by the wagner mercenary group have been used this way asked on monday about the fighting in bakhmut lloyd j austin iii the u s defense secretary said what i do see on a daily basis is the russian continuing to pour in a lot of ill trained and ill equipped troop and those troop are very quickly meeting their demise no independent count of the dead and wounded ha been possible and each side is seen a inflating the other s loss while concealing it own over the weekend the secretary of ukraine s national security council oleksiy danilev asserted that russia s loses in attacking entrenched position were seven time ukraine s but ukraine with a population one third of russia s is le able to absorb the loss and is trading the life of experienced soldier for those of russian ex convict whose wagner commander often treat a expendable the fighting in bakhmut ha taken a central place in a power struggle between the russian armed force and wagner s ambitious self promoting leader mr prigozhin who ha repeatedly accused the military leader of incompetence and of depriving him of needed ammunition on monday he wrote on social medium that wagner s representative to the regional military command had his pa canceled and wa denied access to the group s headquarters later in the day in an audio message on social medium mr prigozhin claimed that it wa his force that were in danger of being trapped in a coming ukrainian counteroffensive and said that wagner unit needed more men and munition his bureaucratic rival defense minister sergei k shoigu made a rare visit on monday to russian occupied ukrainian territory including the city of mariupol the defense ministry said video montage released by the ministry showed a stony faced mr shoigu looking over map and talking to subordinate a muted contrast to mr prigozhin s hyperbolic video dispatch often claiming to be on the front line and making unverified claim about wagner s advance western official say russian force have suffered around killed or wounded a devastating toll in a little over a year of war in addition to the loss of thousand of tank and armored vehicle to make up for those loss they have poured into ukraine inexperienced conscript called up last fall recent russian attack along the front line in eastern ukraine were at first regarded a exploratory stage of russia s long anticipated spring offensive but are increasingly being seen by military analyst a the best that exhausted russian force can manage some ukrainian unit inside bakhmut are expected to deploy to southern ukraine for a counteroffensive aimed at the occupied city of melitopol possibly in the spring in a bid to split russian occupied land in two and even threaten moscow s hold on the crimean peninsula that would require crossing with little cover dozen of mile of flat farmland which is heavily mined and defended by the russian capturing bakhmut would hand russia it first significant battlefield victory in month while for ukraine the city ha become an emblem of resistance but withdrawing from bakhmut would not alter the strategic picture andriy zagorodnyuk a former ukrainian minister of defense said in an interview on monday if we walked out of bakhmut they would just move to the next city using exactly with the same tactic mr zagorodnyuk said this tactic ha been working he said of the russian human wave attack but it ha been confined mostly to bakhmut it cannot be replicated widely because of a shortage of recruited prisoner russian force are now attacking the city from three direction and fighting for control of access road to the west needed by ukraine for resupplying troop evacuating the wounded and for an exit if the decision come to withdraw on monday morning ukraine s military said that russian force continue attempt to storm the city of bakhmut and neighboring settlement mr zelensky who last month called bakhmut our fortress and vowed not to give up the city used his nightly address on sunday to praise ukrainian soldier defending it for their bravery the city s defense ha become a symbol of defiance in ukraine even a the ukrainian military which had been praised for it adroitness in previous battle ha become enmeshed in a grinding clash in bakhmut that ha persisted for month a casualty mounted a song lauding the defender of fortress bakhmut ha played on ukrainian radio and there is no sign so far that mr zelensky is losing popular support for the city s defense it is one of the toughest battle he said of fighting in eastern ukraine painful and challenging but if the ukrainian were to pull back to some very defensible terrain near the city i would not view that a an operational or a strategic setback mr austin the u s defense secretary told reporter while traveling in jordan i certainly don t want to discount the tremendous work that the ukrainian soldier and leader have put into defending bakhmut but i think it s more of a symbolic value than it is a strategic and operational value ukrainian special force signaled another act of defiance against russia on monday by openly announcing a drone strike inside russian territory which destroyed an unmanned observation tower in the bryansk region that wa a break from ukraine s policy of deliberate ambiguity over such strike inside russia russia and ukraine share a land border extending more than mile including several hundred mile in the eastern donbas region part of which are controlled by moscow russia ha used territory close to ukraine including bryansk along ukraine s northeastern border to stage ground air and artillery assault on ukraine throughout the war the timing of the attack on the observation tower wa not clear but the kraken unit which report to ukrainian military intelligence released a video that it said showed the assault on it telegram channel on monday it came day after a brief armed incursion into russia also in the bryansk region by a group of russian volunteer claiming to fight for ukraine official in kyiv have said they reserve the right to strike target within russia that they say are used to attack ukrainian town and city but have promised not to use weapon supplied by western ally who fear moscow could view that a a provocation chasiv yar ukraine lined up in the dark in civilian vehicle light dimmed a company of soldier waited silently at the side of a road farther behind a second company wa parked an occasional light inside a car revealing the face of a soldier still farther back a third company wa moving into place after month of epic struggle the fight over the ukrainian city of bakhmut had seemed in recent day to be reaching a climax with russian force close to encircling the city and some ukrainian unit pulling out then early saturday ukrainian assault brigade went on the attack over the weekend hundred of troop joined the counteroffensive mounting assault from the ground and pounding russian position with artillery from the surrounding hill ukrainian commander acknowledged that their force in bakhmut still faced the risk of encirclement but the fighting over the weekend showed that a military that ha surprised the world with it doggedness wa not yet ready to give up on bakhmut how holding the city might fit in with it broader plan wa le clear even before ukraine stepped up it attack on russian in bakhmut on the weekend it force had moved to beat russian troop back from the last main highway into the city that preserved both a supply line that ha helped ukrainian soldier tie down the russian offensive for month and an exit route for them should they decide to retreat i m confident bakhmut will hold said col yevhen mezhevikin commander of a combined tactical group fighting in bakhmut we have enough force to throw the enemy back from this city but it depends on the task the command ha be it holding the city or inflicting maximum loss on the enemy soldier on the ground expressed weariness but they did not seem ready to give up bakhmut itself a city with a prewar population of inhabitant ha little strategic value it wa simply the next in the line of fire of a russian offensive to seize the eastern province of donetsk but the battle for the city ha created a defining moment of the war for both the russian and the ukrainian army no longer is the fight about bakhmut it is a marathon contest to see which army can break the other russia ha thrown ten of thousand of newly mobilized troop into a huge ground assault to take the city by sheer force of fire and manpower ukraine ha used every hard learned tactic from a year of war to hold ground and inflict maximum casualty on the invader often battling from house to house in neighborhood of smashed house and stunted tree ukrainian troop have steadily lost ground ceding outlying village and suburb in recent week and late winter ha been particularly punishing week of freezing temperature and now the onset of the mud season have sapped their strength soldier said the fog is constant every night we see almost nothing the commander of a combat drone unit attached to the th brigade who go by the code name madyar said in a video message from the front the temperature is above zero for a third day he added everything melted mud up to the knee rain time a day make it difficult to perform tactical task late last week madyar said his unit wa pulling out other unit have a well it remains unclear if the movement were part of a rotation or of a controlled withdrawal in one nearby town chasiv yar the terrifying power of the russian assault is unmistakable shop and home are boarded up and the street are deserted save for a few civilian carrying plastic shopping bag earsplitting explosion sounded almost constantly on recent visit a ukrainian artillery fired on russian position in and around bakhmut and russian gun returned fire one woman lena walking home with her shopping on saturday afternoon ignored the explosion and barely glanced at unexploded rocket sticking out of the asphalt my daughter left but i stayed she said it s home she said in explanation others are getting out early one morning last week rescue worker from the charity save ukraine raced in to evacuate some of the last resident in a particularly exposed neighborhood near the canal they brought out one couple viktor and lyudmila who had fled their home after the neighbor s house wa hit by a shell a second couple declined to go his wife wa ailing with stomach pain the husband said ukrainian army unit are spread out across the undulating hill that stretch for mile around chasiv yar and bakhmut artillery gun and tank are ranged in the tree line and soldier are dispersed in private house their vehicle hidden under camouflage net or behind building overhead ukrainian jet fly occasionally often heading in the morning on sortie toward the front line but this is predominantly an artillery war we repel to attack a day said vladyslav commander of a self propelled artillery battery positioned four or five mile from the outskirt of bakhmut today it is going more or le fine he said cheerfully the tempo of artillery fire ha been extraordinary on average we fire to shell a day vladyslav said in one and a half month we fired more than shell but artillery ammunition is running low a problem senior commander say help explain their steady loss of ground there is a shortage colonel mezhevikin said i would like more people more vehicle more ammunition to destroy the enemy on the approach and his reserve so our people would have fewer loss and not have such intense fighting unit have had to learn to be judicious with their ammunition said maj oleksandr pantsyrny commander of the aidar assault battalion a renowned fighting unit it s constant planning calculation of ammunition consumption those restriction have ukrainian combat unit struggling to stem the advance of the wagner group the private military company that ha been leading the russian offensive to take bakhmut wagner ha bolstered it number with thousand of convict but it core professional have proved able fighter several ukrainian commander who fought them said we realized they were a worthy adversary major pantsyrny said they have pretty good combat experience they have motivated personnel his battalion wa sent to storm wagner position at the village of kodema south of bakhmut the enemy would send guy into attack six to seven time a day said oleksandr a company commander who took part in the assault he did not give his surname in accordance with military protocol imagine twenty guy come we kill them in five minute more guy come we kill them in an hour more they don t care about men then after three week the russian surprised the battalion with a flanking movement breaking through a weaker unit from the side the aidar battalion wa forced to retreat a commander from another battalion dnipro which spent month pitted against wagner unit said he found them more agile and enterprising than most russian army unit the commander who u the code name duke said wagner used untrained prisoner in the first line of attack and then after one or two hour a the ukrainian troop were tiring sent special force into the fray attacking from the flank it wa very good tactic duke said but ukraine ha been able to use bakhmut a a kill box to grind down the vast number of newly mobilized russian soldier who were introduced to the battlefield late last year he said even wagner s force are said to have been worn down since the summer we broke their backbone we killed all their military staff major pantsyrny said he said that only a few professional soldier seemed to be left to direct thousand of convict who had been recruited to fill the rank and that the loss showed they try something but the result are not the same anymore russian troop have nevertheless been advancing thanks to their greater number bolstered by ten of thousand of raw recruit and through sheer brute force they sometimes demolish whole residential block to defeat a single sniper according to one unit of soldier but russian casualty especially among wagner have been enormous and the more confident ukrainian commander insist that the russian have little fight left russia is attacking on it last leg said oleksandr the company commander ukrainian casualty have been relentless too and there is a shortage of volunteer in place on the front line duke said in november he wa given an urgent order to gather all the people of our unit cook driver press officer photographer all staff take rifle and go to the bakhmut area by the end of february they had rotated out with percent of the men wounded he said some depressed and apathetic ukrainian casualty number are not publicly available but there are growing sign of strain from loss and exhaustion among many unit we are tired exclaimed an army mechanic yaroslav a he exited a bar in a small town one evening last week you need to know the truth they are killing u the office of ukrainian president that the ukrainian leader attache symbolic importance to the city and fear a setback to morale if it s captured by russian force soon after he deployed to ukraine last fall pvt ivan a ovlashenko filmed a short video of himself wearing camouflage fatigue and an olive green fleece hat sitting in a wood flecked with yellowing leaf while fellow soldier nearby readied an artillery round to fire toward the ukrainian line i am recording everything right he said grinning before shouting a warning mortar the clip wa meant to reassure relative back in russia that his sudden transition to frontline artilleryman wa coming along just fine until it wasn t last september president vladimir v putin ordered the mobilization of men to bolster sagging russian defense in ukraine at the time the horde of men who fled russia to avoid conscription attracted the most attention yet hundred of thousand of russian like private ovlashenko factory laborer and electrician medical orderly and basketball player tractor driver and school worker went off to war the promise of payouts of or a month proved a huge incentive along with appeal to machismo and the defense of the motherland what am i not a man mr ovlashenko told two woman his sister and his former wife i need to protect my country my daughter in lengthy interview the woman said they were surprised how mr ovlashenko largely apolitical to this point suddenly began parroting the government s far fetched talking point about the west planning to use ukraine a a staging ground to attack russia if he did not fight in ukraine he said he would have to battle the enemy on the street of bataysk his hometown a railroad hub just outside the southwestern city of rostov on don the mobilization shifted the calculus of the war it wa no longer some distant military operation a the kremlin still call it fought by contract soldier mercenary and ukrainian separatist press ganged into service suddenly ordinary russian were thrust into the trench now more than five month later the tempo of dead and wounded returning to russia is picking up with zinc coffin arriving in place like bataysk it is a pattern repeating itself across russia even if the dead remain largely hidden the number are secret said max trudolyubov a russian political analyst and newspaper columnist based in vilnius lithuania the mobilized are from small town faraway place the strategy is to spread the loss a thinly a possible across the country western intelligence official estimate that soldier on the russian side have been killed or wounded in the war of those more than have been confirmed dead in public source according to a project conducted jointly by mediazona an independent russian news outlet the bbc news russian service and volunteer researcher while the true number is undoubtedly far higher even that figure already exceeds the official death toll during the soviet union s nine year war in afghanistan the dead include more than new recruit according to the project private ovlashenko wa one of them he grew up in bataysk a descendant of a long line of railroad worker and wa just month younger than his sister valentina with whom he wa very close valentina strelkova her married name remembers her brother a a skinny agile fearless child a potential circus acrobat he remained devoted to his sister throughout his life she said dropping whatever he wa doing whenever she needed him after he completed his compulsory military service he went to work for pepsi in merchandising valeria ovlashenka worked for pepsi too in sale when she spurned his advance he gave a party for the entire staff greeting her with a bouquet he soon proposed and the next day she discovered that she wa pregnant they married in march and their daughter polina wa born later that summer they quarreled frequently not least over how to raise their daughter m ovlashenka sought to replicate her own strict upbringing while her husband made polina the center of his life he ironed her diaper and put her to sleep he bought her toy and candy took her to see the sea and taught her to pick mushroom in the deep northern forest it wa always a holiday for the child she said they divorced after two year but neither dated anybody else and m ovlashenka always hoped that they would reunite the mobilization summons on sept came a a shock to his ex wife and his sister especially since mr ovlashenko signed it immediately he wa never interested or involved in political news said his sister he told his ex wife of his decision to enlist when he wa bringing their daughter back after a weekend saying that he wa leaving the next day he said it with such a smirk a if he wa leaving for a sanitarium she said i tried to talk him out of it she called the whole situation meaningless arguing that he should stay home to raise polina i didn t see my husband a a patriot she said i think that he just wanted a change of scenery mr ovlashenko s father and sister drove to the training camp more than an hour away every day they were given a list of necessity to rustle up basically everything except his flak jacket and helmet they bought him warmer clothes kneepads a sleeping bag a backpack and two balaclava among other equipment spending more than he wa embarrassed but grateful and eventually the local regional government reimbursed them mr ovlashenko wa unexpectedly dispatched to donetsk after just a week at the camp his family said during his earlier military service he had been a driver this time he wa assigned to an artillery unit the newly mobilized soldier received no training at the training center he told them everything i learned i learned at the front he never shared exactly where he wa but with each call the sound of big gun rumbled ever louder for the most part he said thing were fine although he let the mask slip once you cannot imagine what i am doing here he told his sister sounding terrified then he clammed up outwardly his face became more masculine sterner his former wife said while his eye often got a frantic look that she recognized from their marital spat he did not talk about the dead much once when his ex wife asked about the commotion she could hear in the background he said that the soldier were drinking to commemorate fallen comrade another time he allowed that he had seen a lot of cold corp but few recently killed in december after he suffered a light shrapnel wound in the shoulder his call became more frequent and more emotional it wa like he burst said m ovlashenka he sent money constantly for polina for clothes a tree for the holiday the circus and a ski trip when his ex wife broached the topic of their reuniting however he backed off and they postponed the discussion until he returned new year s eve wa the last time his sister spoke to him he wa very cheerful upbeat positive she said on jan he called his former wife to ask if polina liked her present the last sign of life came on jan when he could not talk he would text an emoji like a smiley face starting jan there wa a troubling silence his sister dialed all the number he had called from but nobody knew anything private ovlashenko hugged her in a dream so vivid that she felt he had come to say goodbye on jan the family learned from the bataysk military recruitment office that he had been killed when a tank shell exploded in his trench near makiivka ukraine they were told that his corpse had been shipped to nearby rostov to the main military morgue but the military told them not to visit the explosion had ripped his body apart and they were having trouble identifying him the family hoped that they had the wrong guy but a fingerprint soon confirmed that it wa him there wa no open coffin at the funeral on jan an honor guard fired off a salute in the muddy cemetery and his father emitted a strangled cry vanyuk his son s nickname a they buried him according to ru a regional online newspaper polina wa not at the funeral but she knew about the war her mother initially told her that her father wa on a long business trip but polina figured out from the call that he wa at the front at school they took up a small collection and they always mentioned her father when they talked about war hero polina miss him terribly and often encourages her mother to find her a new daddy i tell her daughter we don t have a store where we can get a new daddy she said there will always be one daddy he s in heaven in late february the family held the traditional ceremony marking day since his death they skipped the normal ritual of leaving food on his grave a the local priest said it would be better to donate it to needy family he had chosen a peaceful life a peaceful profession a nonmilitary specialty his sister said but his life completely disintegrated in a different way russian force are attacking bakhmut from three direction in a persistent attempt to encircle ukrainian troop the ukrainian military said on sunday maintaining pressure on the battered city that ha become the focal point of moscow s wide ranging offensive in eastern ukraine the battle for bakhmut in ukraine s donbas region began last summer and ukrainian soldier have held out there even a russian force have gradually captured surrounding territory nearly cutting off the city in recent week moscow ha ramped up an offensive to seize the whole of donbas sending troop that it mobilized last fall into the fight in an indication of the severity of the fighting in the east of the country and it broad geographical reach the ukrainian military s general staff said on sunday that it force had repelled russian attack on saturday the adversary continues it attempt to encircle the town of bakhmut it said listing attack on a string of small town and settlement near bakhmut the fighting on saturday killed two civilian in bakhmut the head of the regional ukrainian military administration pavlo kyrylenko said on sunday in a post on the telegram social messaging app seven civilian were wounded in the region he added before the war bakhmut had a population of about but the ukrainian authority say that only a few thousand civilian remain they have been working to evacuate those who have stayed but the task ha become harder a the road out of the city have increasingly come under threat moscow ha been advancing on bakhmut from territory it already hold to the east of the city taking town and village that have more recently enabled it to attack the city from the north and south russia ha rushed large number of troop to the area around bakhmut including many newly mobilized recruit ukraine ha also sent reinforcement to the battle both side have sustained heavy casualty military expert say that russia s offensive is being fought at five or six point along a front line that stretch about mile from the town of kreminna in luhansk to vuhledar in donetsk where moscow suffered heavy loss in a tank battle in recent week while russian force have not made significant territorial gain in their renewed offensive they have been tightening the claw around bakhmut last month president volodymyr zelensky of ukraine vowed that ukraine would not give up on bakhmut calling it our fortress but in recent day ukrainian official have been preparing the public for the possibility of a retreat mick ryan a military analyst and retired australian army major general who is a fellow at the lowy institute a think tank based in sydney wrote on sunday that russian force despite heavy loss had slowly but surely begun to take ground in and around bakhmut he said in a post on substack that russia is strangling but not yet stopping the ukrainian capacity to defend the city that sentiment wa echoed by the institute for the study of war a u s based research group it said that russian force will not likely be able to encircle the city soon but that by closing in on the road that are the vital lifeline of supply for ukrainian fighter they could force kyiv s force to abandon their defensive position and withdraw if russia doe eventually capture bakhmut it would be the culmination of one of the longest running and bloodiest battle of the war but question would remain about russia s ability to sustain it offensive and gain further ground in eastern ukraine the reality is that if the russian do capture bakhmut they are seizing rubble mr ryan said it is a town with minimal strategic importance with almost no remaining infrastructure to support an occupying force that the russian have invested so much in it capture speaks volume about their poor strategy in this war elsewhere on the long front line moscow ha continued to shell civilian area in ukraine over the past few week a it offensive ha ramped up often with devastating consequence russian shelling killed a woman and two child on sunday in the village of poniativka in the kherson region of southern ukraine according to the regional authority and andriy yermak head of the president s office in ukraine the prosecutor s office in the kharkiv region said a husband and wife were killed when their vehicle wa struck by artillery fire and the death toll from a missile strike on an apartment building on thursday in the city of zaporizhzhia in southern ukraine rose to ukraine s state emergency service said sunday on telegram ukraine is expected to launch it own offensive in the coming week aiming to expand the territorial gain it made last fall in the northeast and in the south the ultimate goal of ukraine s spring push according to a senior ukrainian official and military expert could be to sever the land bridge in the south of the country between moscow s force in russian occupied crimea and other territory that russia ha seized but expert also caution that it is difficult to predict the precise location of kyiv s next drive russian and ukrainian force have spent month preparing for their renewed offensive a ukraine awaits the arrival of new sophisticated weapon from western ally the government in kyiv could gain an advantage because russia ha effectively launched it offensive first according to michael kofman the director of russia study at cna a research institute focused on national security ukraine is much better off receiving this russian offensive having the russian military exhaust itself then launching their major operation later in the spring perhaps very likely in the south in zaporizhzhia he said last month on the war on the rock podcast the russian force were so close that xa boghdan a ukrainian soldier with the th air assault brigade could see them digging digging is what to do in this forlorn xa stretch of scorched earth in eastern ukraine xa to avoid dying boghdan xa want the russian to die so he xa lifted a shoulder fired rocket propelled grenade launcher peered over the sandbag mounted on the edge of his trench and blasted away the digging stopped moment later russian soldier let loose a volley of automatic gunfire then thing went silent we made them quiet boghdan said with satisfaction a he made his way to a bunker deeper underground i just need to have my coffee this is life at what the ukrainian military call the zero line position the farthest edge of the front line with the russian just yard away in the mud and muck with frozen patch of earth giving way to sloppy thick clay there are many way to kill and be killed russian helicopter regularly strafe ukrainian trench the russian bombard ukrainian position with heavy artillery from mile away and send small band of soldier to try to infiltrate ukrainian trench in the dark of night powerful drone circle high overhead doing surveillance and smaller off the shelf quadcopters drop improvised explosive into the trench russian assault can include armored vehicle xa and tank or they xa can come in wave of infantry xa soldier trying to storm a trench the ukrainian hit back hard and xa in this pocket of the front near the destroyed town of marinka in the donetsk region they xa have largely xa thwarted every russian attempt to take new ground for a year the new york time wa granted rare access to join soldier from the th brigade at the farthest edge of the front line to better understand how the war feel for the soldier who are close enough to see the russian across the torn ukrainian land they are determined to defend the full name of the soldier are being withheld for security reason despite intense fighting throughout the winter russia ha captured only about square mile across the entire eastern front since september according to a report released in february by the center for strategic and international study a research organization in washington visiting the trench it is apparent why breaking through the dug in and fortified line is deadly work but holding ground also come at a tremendous cost two day before the time visited the th xa brigade had suffered heavy loss the toll of unrelenting combat evident in their bleary and bloodshot eye the troop said they were ready to die this is a war of survival they said not just for them but for their nation the th is one of ukraine s elite unit and it force have battled russian on the steppe through forest and in ruined city now the soldier are charged with holding a position about mile from the city of donetsk a stronghold of russia and it proxy force since the town of marinka doe not really exist anymore beyond a point on a map abandoned by the roughly prewar resident long ago it joined the list of place devastated by russian force it building flattened or reduced to charred hollowed out shell but for ukrainian the defense of marinka ha persisted having failed to break through ukrainian line there for almost a year the russian xa recently xa revised their tactic turning to small assault group trying to rip hole through ukrainian defense that they can try to exploit according to a russian xa manual captured by the ukrainian the manual detail how assault platoon of to member can be divided into tactical group of a few a three people supported by additional firepower to infiltrate a ukrainian trench ukrainian soldier have taken to calling these group meat because of the high rate at which they are killed ukrainian fighter who have witnessed the attack up close say the russian often send xa a first wave of infantry xa to storm a trench knowing they are likely to be killed russian spotter take note of ukrainian firing position and unleash a barrage of mortar and artillery fire xa aimed at xa those location then a second wave xa of russian xa infantry xa race xa in trying to infiltrate the trench it is a brutal tactic that would have been recognized by million of soldier huddled in trench more than a century ago during world war i a a french officer capt andr laffargue noted at the time in a pamphlet called the attack in trench warfare breaching well defended trench come at staggering cost infantry unit disappear in the furnace of fire like handful of straw he wrote to reach the zero line xa outside marinka ukrainian xa soldier must traverse a network of trench to the rear and cross open gap left for tank and through smashed xa village the trench are xa constructed with xa bend to contain a blast should a mortar or grenade land inside netting xa and bramble are laid over the top in place to obscure the contour the ukrainian soldier intimately familiar with the geography have spotter on constant lookout for threat in quiet moment and even in the most embattled corner of ukraine a lot of time is spent waiting for the next paroxysm of violence soldier eat meal from tin can and care for what they call the ukrainian war cat that patrol the trench for rat while the front line stretch over mile both army have dug thousand of mile of trench arrayed in echelon so that should one network fall soldier can retreat to safer position in addition to the small scale assault russia ha been trying xa for week to break through the ukrainian line with more comprehensive attack including armored column shortly after the time visited reconnaissance unit xa for the th brigade xa detected a movement of russian tank and armored vehicle nearby the russian tried to skirt the trench around the flank xa to launch a massive assault according to a statement from the brigade but they were caught out and paratrooper using javelin anti tank missile damaged several russian tank and infantry fighting vehicle the demolition captured in video released by the brigade back in the trench the soldier xa know xa the russian will keep coming and they say they are ready for the day when they will go on the attack themselves on a snowbound field three soviet era helicopter were being readied for battle pilot and crew checked the flight plan for their next target while technician loaded slim gray rocket into launcher pod and stacked flare into rack behind the exhaust one year into the war against all the odds ukraine s helicopter brigade are still operational every day of the week multiple time a day they go into battle against enemy force launching rocket attack along the front line in support of ground troop and occasionally slipping under russian air defense to fly covert mission into enemy territory far from being knocked out in the first day of the invasion xa ukraine s helicopter and jet have kept flying remaining an inspiring and useful element of the war effort in a rare opportunity the th sikorsky brigade the foremost of ukraine s four helicopter brigade gave reporter access to a xa combat unit for two day recently officer and pilot described xa how the ukrainian xa brigade moved their aircraft xa at the onset of the war to evade russian strike xa and xa how they xa adapted their tactic xa to fighting a much more powerful and better equipped adversary we go where we should not go said oleksiy a colonel and deputy commander of the brigade he gave only his first name in keeping with military protocol the main task is to destroy the enemy by fire compared with the well documented ground war in ukraine where destroyed tank and armor have been so visible much le is known about the aerial war partly because there is le photographic and video evidence but russian jet attacked target intensively in the first week of the war and ukrainian and russian jet battled each other numerous time in the sky above both side also used helicopter for critical task because of their mobility russia landed troop in the first day in at least two location and ukraine flew rescue mission into the besieged xa azovstal plant in mariupol yet helicopter have also proved vulnerable a the fighting primarily turned into an artillery war on the open plain of eastern ukraine and task were limited to firing rocket from ukrainian line the ukrainian fly aging russian made helicopter mainly the mi and the mi both used a attack helicopter that were designed in the soviet union in the s and s these are helicopter from the last century said oleksiy who ha eight year of combat experience five of those spent on peacekeeping mission in africa holding off guerrilla group their weapon unguided soviet era rocket are very outdated and don t meet the requirement of modern combat we do not have long range precision weapon he added in modern combat any aircraft a helicopter a plane should be viewed a a high precision weapon carrier like many in the ukrainian military he and his men sense they could push the russian out of ukraine with smarter weapon we must move away from russian helicopter he said ukraine ha not publicly requested western helicopter instead emphasizing it need for sophisticated artillery and tank the united state sent about a dozen russian made transport helicopter xa in june that it had originally purchased for afghanistan before the taliban took over in november britain said it wa sending three sea king helicopter and promised to train ukrainian military crew to use them one consolation for the ukrainian is that their russian adversary are flying similar machine whose design ha not advanced much in recent decade but russia ha a big advantage in the volume of helicopter xa and ammunition most of their weapon are also from soviet time oleksiy said but you can t underestimate the fact they have a lot of this soviet metal russia s overwhelming firepower ha forced the ukrainian to find other way to fight we are smaller so we should use a smart approach said roman one of the most experienced pilot from the th brigade who ha been seconded to the th in an interview between combat flight we do the best we can that ha entailed retraining constantly adapting to condition and also some daring in their operation the brigade keep it helicopter in plain sight on the wide snow swept steppe of eastern ukraine using temporary airfield moving frequently for security they have developed a method of attack flying below the tree line le than foot from the ground hugging the contour of the land at up to mile per hour the low altitude is treacherous but avoids radar detection then right at the front line they make a sudden ascent to fire a burst of to rocket before veering away back the way they came they attack in pair sometimes in a pack of four they can fire on russian position without flying too close to them xa but it test pilot and machine to their limit and for dangerous second on the ascent expose them to russian anti air defense system approaching enemy line ukrainian jet and helicopter run the gamut of russian attack from radio electronic interference to antiaircraft missile fired from jet and from the ground every operation every sortie is a heroic flight oleksiy said xa many of the military of other country would not undertake these flight in the face of such countermeasure a pilot from the th brigade ivan wa hit by russian air defense just a he unleashed his payload of rocket in june last year he recall everything turning black but managed to turn the helicopter you have thought but you feel nothing and see nothing he said a he recounted his ordeal in an interview you understand that something is happening i realized that most likely i wa hit he crashed in a forest that wa pockmarked with crater and smoking from shell fire his co pilot wa killed but ivan and the engineer were thrown through the front of the cockpit a the machine burst into flame he said badly concussed with his head sliced open a fractured spine and a broken leg he managed to crawl to check on his engineer who complained of broken collarbone swimming in and out of consciousness he sent their coordinate to his brigade under shellfire just yard from russian position they lay motionless when a reconnaissance drone passed overhead unsure whose it wa until ukrainian medic rescued them the ukrainian helicopter brigade have all lost men and machine although how many remains a military secret but their survival and continued operation a year into the war is a major success military analyst said when the invasion came the aviation brigade were prepared they had heeded western warning of the pending russian invasion and were ready xa to evacuate their main base and disperse their helicopter and engineering crew for safety the deputy commander oleksiy said we had a defined plan of action in case of a missile strike a ground offensive where to go which site where our logistics unit would meet u he said there wa no panic everything wa rehearsed nevertheless pilot recalled the first day of the war a chaotic and dangerous plagued by case of friendly fire civilian were calling in sighting of russian troop and helicopter were sent to attack multiple location one of the biggest battle wa for the hostomel airport just north of kyiv the capital where ukrainian force aided by attack helicopter repulsed a russian attempt to seize the airfield critically for ukrainian aviation the russian never secured air superiority over ukraine thanks to it effective air defense system both side have continued to fly jet and helicopter xa although they have come to avoid venturing deep xa into each other s territory for fear of being shot down one of the striking exception wa a run of daring flight that ukrainian helicopter made into the azovstal steel plant a last holdout of ukrainian troop in the besieged city of mariupol it s impossible oleksiy said recalling his first reaction to the azovstal plan but pilot volunteered and they succeeded in flying undetected across mile of russian held territory into the steel plant ferrying in ammunition and evacuating the wounded the first mission were successful because the enemy couldn t imagine that the ukrainian would dare oleksiy said after they realized we were doing it how we were getting there the mission started taking loss the flight ended after the loss of three helicopter only day before the ukrainian surrendered by chance part of ukraine s helicopter force wa on a united nation peacekeeping mission in the democratic republic of congo when russia began it invasion last year it wa unable to return for several month but when it did it added experienced pilot and more helicopter to the depleted force these day the sikorsky xa brigade ha settled into a practiced routine pilot are up before dawn although some later than others one pilot joked most pilot declined to be interviewed or asked that their name and photograph not be published for security reason they are often in the sky on the day s first combat mission at first light weather permitting and can make up to flight a day returning to refuel rearm and wait for the next task drinking instant coffee in their canteen last week they rose in unison when the order came we are always near our iron horse said ivan the pilot who is back on duty but not flying until he fully heals they tell you the location and what to do western training ha allowed for more initiative xa by crew to choose their route and tactic he added the xa pilot xa remain confident about their ability but are acutely aware of their limitation one pilot said he wanted to ask nato pilot if they pushed their helicopter to such extreme they covet western flying machine black hawk said one apache said another a lot of them russian defense minister sergey shoigu ha inspected one of the command center coordinating the military operation in ukraine the ministry said on saturday the minister flew by helicopter to meet with service member from the vostok east combat group at an undisclosed location in the south donetsk direction shoigu discussed the work of medical unit and broader supply issue he emphasized the need to house troop in secure quarter according to a statement from the defense ministry the minister handed out medal thanking soldier and officer for fighting admirably the decoration are well deserved well earned shoigu said there is still a lot of work ahead of u read more rt meet wagner fighter encircling key donbas city russia sent troop to the neighboring state a year ago citing the need to protect the people of donbas and kiev s failure to implement the minsk peace accord shoigu s visit took place a russian force are fighting to seize the key donbas city of artyomovsk referred to a bakhmut in ukraine the city which had a pre conflict population of over is a logistical hub that could enable further russian advance on friday yevgeny prigozhin the leader of the private military company wagner group said his force had almost surrounded the city with only one road left available to ukrainian soldier ukrainian president vladimir zelensky said last month that kiev wa determined to defend the city but not at any cost aleksandr rodnyansky zelensky s adviser told cnn this week that ukrainian troop could strategically pull back if necessary more than year after the world s worst nuclear accident the dog of chernobyl roam among decaying abandoned building in and around the closed plant somehow still able to find food breed and survive scientist hope that studying these dog can teach human new trick about how to live in the harshest most degraded environment too they published the first of what they hope will be many genetics study on friday in the journal science advance focusing on free roaming dog living in an officially designated exclusion zone around the disaster site they identified population whose differing level of radiation exposure may have made them genetically distinct from one another and other dog worldwide we ve had this golden opportunity to lay the groundwork for answering a crucial question how do you survive in a hostile environment like this for generation said geneticist elaine ostrander of the national human genome research institute one of the study s many author fellow author tim mousseau professor of biological science at the university of south carolina said the dog provide an incredible tool to look at the impact of this kind of a setting on mammal overall chernobyl s environment is singularly brutal on april an explosion and fire at the ukraine power plant caused radioactive fallout to spew into the atmosphere thirty worker were killed in the immediate aftermath while the long term death toll from radiation poisoning is estimated to eventually number in the thousand researcher say most of the dog they are studying appear to be descendant of pet that resident were forced to leave behind when they evacuated the area mousseau ha been working in the chernobyl region since the late s and began collecting blood from the dog around some of the dog live in the power plant a dystopian industrial setting others are about mile or mile away at first ostrander said they thought the dog might have intermingled so much over time that they d be much the same but through dna they could readily identify dog living in area of high low and medium level of radiation exposure that wa a huge milestone for u said ostrander and what s surprising is we can even identify family about different one now researcher can begin to look for alteration in the dna we can compare them and we can say ok what s different what s changed what s mutated what s evolved what help you what hurt you at the dna level ostrander said this will involve separating non consequential dna change from purposeful one scientist said the research could have wide application providing insight about how animal and human can live now and in the future in region of the world under continuous environmental assault and in the high radiation environment of space researcher have already started on the follow up research which will mean more time with the dog at the site about mile from kyiv mousseau said he and his colleague were there most recently last october and didn t see any war related activity mousseau said the team ha grown close to some dog naming one prancer because she excitedly prance around when she see people warning you may find the following image disturbing russia s federal security service fsb ha released a video taken following thursday s deadly ukrainian cross border saboteur attack on two village in bryansk region that claimed at least two life and injured a ten year old boy russian president vladimir putin described the raid on the village of lyubechane and sushany located right on the russian ukrainian border a a terrorist attack while labeling the ukrainian saboteur neo nazi he also noted that the gunman opened fire despite seeing that they were attacking civilian var rt rt rt player rt player rt player time date parse tuesday may gmt mediaplayer min who wa killed in the attack wa working a an engineer at a nearby school he is said to have been driving back from his shift to visit his mother at the time of the incident the video also show a second car that wa attacked by the ukrainian saboteur it driver is said to have used the vehicle to take local child to school at the request of his neighbor one boy and two girl were in the car at the time of the attack after the raider killed the man and injured the boy the latter helped the two girl escape an act that kremlin press secretary dmitry peskov described a heroic courtesy fsb the fsb also released photo of what appear to be several mine left by the ukrainian operative a well a a portable hand grenade launcher lying on the ground earlier the agency said that numerous explosive device of various kind had been found around the area adding that bomb squad were working at the scene to disarm them courtesy fsb according to the fsb the saboteur group wa pushed back to ukrainian territory where they were hit with a massive artillery strike read more putin condemns terrorist attack in recent month russia s territory bordering ukraine have come under recurring attack on thursday local authority in bryansk and kursk region reported that local village had been shelled by ukrainian troop according to kursk governor roman starovoyt the attack killed one man with another one injured rt s igor zhdanov ha spoken to fighter from the wagner group who are encircling the donbas city of artyomovsk referred to a bakhmut in ukraine the founder of the private military company yevgeny prigozhin claimed on friday that the city wa practically surrounded a he urged ukrainian force to flee while they still can the number of experienced enemy soldier ha already dwindled in the area the wagner fighter said a battered unit are apparently being quietly withdrawn by kiev they added that foreign mercenary have likely disappeared from the front line in the city a well having previously been active in artyomovsk we used to see mercenary from various country including georgian and abkhazian they were better equipped than the ukrainian soldier now we haven t seen them for a month already they were surprised when we faced them the last time we ve made an advance and now they re gone a wagner fighter said var rt rt rt player rt player rt player time date parse tuesday may gmt more key donbas city surrounded wagner chief not only do they lack combat experience but some have no previous military service whatsoever paper recovered from fallen ukrainian combatant suggest footage shared online that ha slipped through tight censorship introduced by kiev show ukrainian force sustaining heavy casualty in grueling combat around the city commonly referred to a the bakhmut meat grinder artyomovsk ha been the scene of some of the most intense fighting during russia s military operation and the city ha remained a major stronghold for the ukrainian military since kiev initiated the fighting in donbas in in recent month russian force primarily wagner group unit have systematically captured settlement around artyomovsk closing in from the north south and east ukrainian president vladimir zelensky long insisted that the strategically vital city would not be surrendered under any circumstance but ha recently changed his tune stating that it would be held only a long a it remains reasonable to do so a russian troop pushed into ukraine child who were fleeing newly occupied territory were swept up many became part of a russian effort to portray itself a a charitable savior the child were placed in russian family and paraded on television the time interviewed one child who wa taken from ukraine a girl named anya who said she ached to return the freshly exhumed remains of three men lie in black body bag on the edge of the small cemetery in a town not far from ukraine s capital waiting to be taken to a morgue none ha yet been identified ukrainian authority are still unearthing people who were hastily buried in makeshift graf during russia s brief but brutal occupation of village and town near kyiv almost body remain unidentified while people are listed a missing oleksander pinchuk s mother halyna is among them they never found her body in the wreckage of her apartment building which took a direct hit from an airstrike a year ago pinchuk had walked out of the building just eight hour earlier and ha not seen his mother since he said on thursday pinchuk stood in the winter chill grim faced among a small group of mourner who gathered for a religious service to commemorate the anniversary of the strike in the town of borodyanka nothing remains of the structure except the outline of where it once stood behind it is another apartment building blackened and empty but still standing pinchuk said rescue crew only managed to get to the building last april after ukrainian force retook control of borodyanka the crew dug through the rubble for about two week and located the remains of people but they found no trace of dozen more believed to have been inside the apartment building we still have hope for at least some of them but the rest they just burned alive pinchuk said his gaze fixed the pain of loss visible in his eye without a body to mourn over and bury the year old hope against hope that his mother is still alive he heard rumor that russian troop took more than people from borodyanka to belarus perhaps she wa among them until the last moment i will think of her a alive he said the exhumation of the three body thursday from two makeshift graf on the edge of borodyanka s cemetery meant that some family may have a chance to learn what became of their loved one a passer by found the three in early march when russia force still occupied the town and he buried the body with the help of another man according to andrii nebytov the head of the kyiv region s police department the passer by then fled the region he only just recently returned and told authority about the burial the police chief said one of the dead is believed to be a year old local man who wa shot and partially burned in his car but dna test are needed to confirm that nobody know who the other two are there s not much to go on to identify them a green pencil is all that wa found on one packet of cigarette and key fob on another the remains are so decomposed that identification and determining exactly how they died will require forensic test the exhumation bring the number of civilian body found in previously russian occupied area of the kyiv region to nebytov said of that number have yet to be identified russian serviceman used the volga armored train to clear mine and restore the railway in the zone of special military operation svo military and humanitarian supply are increasingly being delivered through them but before that the road is checked by the armored train volga the crew of the armored train conduct technical reconnaissance and demining of area of the terrain a well a restores the destroyed road during the movement if minor damage to the track is detected the personnel of the special train are able to eliminate the identified destruction on their own and continue to move the head of the special train said ahead of the armored train reconnaissance can be conducted by a drone if the operator see a suspicious situation he report to the commander if necessary the armored train stop and a group of sapper conduct mine clearance on armored platform with an armor thickness of to millimeter in armored cabin there are large caliber machine gun automatic grenade launcher from open platform zu anti aircraft gun protected by sandbag look which effectively destroy most ground target a well a other advanced equipment for firing an armored train can take with it on the platform bmp or a t tank the weapon complex allows personnel to act effectively in the most difficult condition on the volga there is equipment with which you can reproduce a thorough engineering reconnaissance of the track after all landmines can be located at a great depth under the embankment and intended for a freight train it should be noted that armored train were used in the extermination of terrorism in the north caucasus both in the chechen republic and to control the railway section in abkhazia in but they played a special role in the middle of the last century in western ukraine there they made it possible to safely transfer large unit while surrounding and clearing forest from bandera s gang armored train successfully participated in raid on forest brother on the railway of galicia until volga is not the only armored train that is in service the russian troop also have armored train amur baikal and kozma minin listen a well russia is attacked by drone more the group of troop center in the krasno limansky direction leveled more than ukrainian serviceman four armored vehicle and howitzer msta b and d the western grouping of troop in the kupyansk direction destroyed three ukrainian sabotage and reconnaissance group total enemy loss per day a company three pickup a d howitzer the southern grouping of troop in the donetsk direction disabled up to warrior of light two armored vehicle car howitzer d and d in the ocheretino area an ammunition depot of the th the kiev region reported that air object were recorded in the sky over the region and air defense system worked the air raid alert in the ukrainian capital on march sounded at moscow time and in the region the alarm wa announced at moscow time three hour earlier an air raid alert wa announced in the dnipropetrovsk sumy poltava kharkiv region and in the kiev controlled part of the zaporizhia
