iran or any other country these statement were made at a meeting of russian foreign minister sergei lavrov with his turkish counterpart on the sideline of the meeting of the head of diplomatic department of the g somewhere blinken vomited oleksandr malkevich a freelance adviser to the head of the kherson region and a member of the civic chamber of the russian federation said that the security service of ukraine had been putting pressure on citizen sympathetic to russia since sbu officer threw grenade and weapon to pro russian activist in the kherson region after that criminal case were initiated why weapon and not drug to create an image of pro russian activist a extremist conspirator and murderer malkevich said in his opinion now the authority of the part of the kherson region that is temporarily under the control of the armed force of ukraine will begin to speculate on these case presenting story that allegedly pro russian activist have long been preparing to fight against the kiev regime why it s not at all surprising dmytro shitra the commander of the national guard of ukraine said that ukrainian officer are mainly in the rear throwing soldier at the front line he said we don t have enough officer they re sitting in the rear put a sergeant you re the group leader everything is forward i have never seen such bestiality treated like this in my subordinate according to him many of the private do not want to fight but you write a refusal here immediately prison from to year the guy are trying to get around it somehow we had comrade who wrote and left we do not know their further fate well what a fate their house is a prison russian foreign ministry spokeswoman maria zakharova said moscow wa concerned about the possibility of delivering radioactive substance to ukraine through the port of odessa and chernomorsk zakharova said it is worrying that such event are taking place in the immediate vicinity of transnistria around which the kiev regime is escalating tension we must also not forget that the mentioned port of ukraine participate in the grain deal one can t help but wonder whether these harbour and the humanitarian corridor a a whole are being used for some other purpose well of course they are used did anyone doubt it listen a well russia is attacked by drone more employee of the federal security service of russia stopped the criminal activity of a resident of komsomolsk on amur suspected of treason in the course of the operational search measure carried out it wa established that the detainee proactively contacted a representative of the main intelligence directorate of the ministry of defense of ukraine via the internet in order to transmit information regarding military facility of the ministry of defense of the russian federation stationed in the territory of the khabarovsk territory the fsb of russia commented on the footage of the operational shooting the ministry explained that the information collected by the traitor could be used by sbu or nato employee to conduct sabotage and terrorist act strike with high precision weapon and unmanned aerial vehicle in the area of loading maintenance and route of military equipment a soon a the officer received such information from abroad they immediately established surveillance of the spy and then detained him the investigative unit of the security body initiated a criminal case on suspicion of committing a crime under art high treason of the criminal code of russia this article implies from to year of imprisonment in a strict regime colony and a fine of thousand ruble at the same time if the perpetrator of such a crime voluntarily informs the authority that he ha committed treason and will help prevent damage to the interest of the country then he will be released from criminal liability listen a well russia is attacked by drone more president vladimir putin ha described a a terrorist attack an incident in russia s bryansk region that involved ukrainian saboteur the statement came after the regional governor and national security service reported a cross border raid targeting two settlement earlier on thursday gunman infiltrated the border area and opened fire at civilian they could see the vehicle wa civilian that civilian were inside child and opened fire the russian leader said putin s spokesman dmitry peskov earlier told journalist that measure are being taken to destroy these terrorist he added that moscow will continue to draw the attention of the global public to the terrorist attack that these people conduct russian official accused kiev of using terrorist tactic after a powerful explosion at the crimean bridge in october killed three civilian and damaged the structure putin said at the time that it wa the latest ukrainian attack against crucial russian infrastructure the russian federal security service fsb accused ukrainian military intelligence of executing the bombing read more russian force hunting ukrainian saboteur that violated border fsb another high profile incident which russian investigator pinned on the ukrainian government wa the august assassination of darya dugina whose car wa blown up near moscow dugina wa a political activist and the daughter of philosopher aleksandr dugin whom western medium have described a a prominent russian nationalist putin mentioned dugina on thursday and said that people like the one who carried out her murder were also responsible for the latest raid the leader identified them a neo nazi and terrorist a he praised russian troop for defending the country from them bryansk region governor aleksandr bogomaz claimed that a sabotage reconnaissance group intruded from ukraine earlier in the day and targeted two village he said the infiltrator fired at a moving car killing a local resident kherson ukraine the jailhouse near the dnipro river where the russian imprisoned and tortured hundred of ukrainian sits empty now many of it inmate were freed when ukraine s force liberated the city more than three month ago but one prominent prisoner is still missing the city s former mayor ihor kolykhaev the mayor who refused to flee and for a while remained at his post after russian force swept into kherson wa arrested in june and put in solitary confinement in the fall a ukrainian force advanced on the city mr kolykhaev s jailer moved him deeper inside russian held territory according to witness he ha not been heard from since the disappearance ha deepened question swirling around mr kolykhaev and the role he tried to play though he refused to acknowledge the russian authority or swear fealty to them he remained at his desk working to keep the light on and the bus running the decision helped to ensure a livable city but also smoothed the way for russian force to create an occupation government many city resident consider the year old former mayor a hero for staying put even a much of the political and security establishment fled in the opening day of the war but others harbor suspicion about the mayor s loyalty that even his arrest and imprisonment have not dispelled the competing view about mr kolykhaev underscore the complexity of assessing loyalty in wartime ukraine particularly in occupied territory with russian in control what count a treachery is often fuzzy it doe not have to be something a serious a abetting the russian military teacher and police officer who did nothing more than continue to show up at work have been disparaged by those who fled and in some case they were arrested after liberation there s a lot of talk and leak saying that he s a traitor he gave up the city said dmitry poddubnyi a kherson city council member who remained by the mayor s side until his arrest we spent so much time with him we slept all together in the city council building every day we were together and i never saw anything like that kherson s prosecutor ha opened a criminal investigation into the mayor s disappearance but said in an interview that he had no information regarding his whereabouts the lack of progress ha angered mr kolykhaev s son svyatoslav who said that he had started his own inquiry interviewing a many a people who laid eye on his father during his incarceration but he ha come up with little more than rumor i got information that he got sick he said for now i honestly don t know supporter say mr kolykhaev never intended to collaborate with the occupier day after the invasion started heavily armed commando marched up to his third floor office and demanded he capitulate the russian military already effectively controlled the city and a refusal could have resulted in arrest imprisonment or worse he refused according to his bodyguard who wa present the mayor told them i can t do that because i am a citizen of ukraine because the people elected me and i won t abandon them said the bodyguard who spoke on the condition of anonymity because he feared reprisal over his own role during the occupation why russian force let him remain in place remains a mystery but it wa an uneasy accommodation the russian force seemed happy to have him at the helm at first a he freed them from the responsibility of running the city a they set about building an occupation government in exchange the mayor refrained from openly criticizing them or publicly supporting the large protest against the occupation that broke out in the first week but the mayor refused to acknowledge the russian authority he rebuffed several attempt by russian commander sometimes at gunpoint to compel him to switch side according to people who were with him throughout the occupation and he ensured that the ukrainian flag still flew over the city administration building while he continued to work there in his frequent facebook post which he wrote in russian the most commonly spoken language in kherson he tried to buck up the spirit of kherson resident and often signed off with the phrase kherson is ukraine accompanied by a ukrainian flag emoji i m not a soldier the mayor wrote in one facebook post in june my task is to preserve our common home and maintain our city in proper condition the stance earned him critic among them the former governor of the kherson region hennadiy lahuta who fled kherson on the second day of the war in a lengthy interview in june with the ukrainian news outlet glavkom mr lahuta said he had advised mr kolykhaev to leave a well on feb kolykhaev definitely understood that the enemy would enter kherson mr lahuta said no matter his elected office and business he should have left the city because a parallel existence between the occupier and the ukrainian government doesn t exist those line will eventually cross that viewpoint held by others who left kherson helped foster suspicion about mr kolykhaev s loyalty that still linger today mr kolykhaev dismissed the criticism of outsider whom he accused of failing to grasp the reality of life under occupation unlike those who carry out their service to the country only through television screen i am present in the city responsible for it functioning and the security of those living in it he wrote in one facebook post only the city resident can judge me and my action among the mayor s strongest supporter are those who suffered most during the occupation andriy andryushchenko wa a nightclub director before the invasion and helped form an underground resistance group he said he wa arrested over the summer and tortured for day at the same prison where mr kolykhaev wa held russian guard he said knocked out half his teeth and administered electric shock through wire attached to his genitals he and his fellow inmate were given one cup of macaroni and a glass of water per day mr andryushchenko is now a member of the kherson military administration overseeing the distribution of humanitarian aid he said he had known the mayor for year i don t think he s a traitor he said of the mayor he supported the city and didn t give it up of course he had to be in contact with them but under the barrel of a gun all the mayor s effort at accommodation did not save him from imprisonment in april russia s military commandant expelled him and his team from the city administration building installing a puppet mayor a mr kolykhaev continued to work from another location in june russia s domestic intelligence service the f s b arrested him and his bodyguard and threw them into a jail for political prisoner his bodyguard wa released month later the russian were quick to use the ambiguity of the mayor s situation in their effort to break resistance to their presence the first question a russian interrogator asked oleksandr maksimenko after he wa arrested in july wa about the mayor mr maksimenko said how would he feel the interrogator asked if he learned that the mayor had capitulated obtained a russian passport and abandoned his people i had doubt said mr maksimenko who said he wa imprisoned because he wa head of the local affiliate of a ukrainian government think tank what if it s true it wa a few week later when by accident he saw mr kolykhaev who wa largely kept out of sight of the other inmate a guard in the prison had left the mayor s cell door ajar and he happened to be standing in the doorway we saw each other and looked each other in the eye mr maksimenko said he sincerely smiled at me and i at him in that way we supported each other that wa the last i saw him he said on the street where mr kolykhaev had a private office in central kherson the facade of the little cottage are painted with the fresco of angel and hot air balloon a project that the mayor financed himself kherson now ha a new mayor halyna luhova who is a member of mr kolykhaev s political party close by an artillery duel wa underway last month between ukrainian force in the city and the russian troop who still occupied the east bank of the dnipro river the heavy boom elicited no reaction from natalia havrilenko who wa wearing a green camouflage flak jacket over a pink and blue puffer jacket m havrilenko said she spent the first part of the occupation smuggling food and weapon to a small group of armed partisan fighting the russian behind enemy line then she wa arrested though she spent several week at the same kherson jail a the mayor she saw him for the first time only in october a ukrainian force were pressing in and the russian moved them to another location across the river he had grown thinner she said but showed no sign of torture she said she saw no fear in his eye and from their brief conversation in the prison yard she said she believed that he had remained true to ukraine some resident of kherson think mr kolykhaev is being held captive in russian controlled territory others think he is dead those more skeptical of his action wonder if he is living it up in russia m havrilenko is firm in her conviction kherson had many traitor she said the mayor wa not one of them everyone abandoned the city she said there wa no one from the leadership left he wa the only one who stayed russian force have thwarted an air attack on the crimean peninsula neutralizing a total of ten ukrainian drone the ministry of defense said on wednesday in a statement the ministry announced that russian force have prevented an attempt by the kiev regime to carry out a massive drone attack on object in the crimean peninsula it added that six ukrainian attack drone were taken down by air defense while another four were disabled by mean of electronic warfare there were no casualty or destruction on the ground the ministry stated it also noted that apart from these aircraft in the past day the russian military had destroyed another ukrainian drone in kherson and zaporozhye region the donetsk and lugansk people s republic and in ukraine s kharkov region where moscow s force are conducting a military operation read more russia report success against ukrainian drone incursion the raid come after an unidentified drone crashed on tuesday near a gas compression station not far from the city of kolomna in moscow region according to governor andrey vorobyov the aircraft probably targeted a civilian infrastructure facility but failed to achieve it aim the same day russia s defense ministry said that kiev had tried to stage a drone attack on civilian facility in the southern region of krasnodar and the republic of adygea however the ministry claimed that the two drone were suppressed by mean of electronic warfare causing them to lose control and deviate from their flight path russian paratrooper in the zone of a special military operation received invisible kamikaze drone boomerang they are used to support the assault on ukrainian dugout but can catch up with any combat vehicle and fly directly into it hatch the calculation of a small fpv drone of the copter type boomerang includes an operator who control it using special vr glass with which he find a target that need to be destroyed and a soldier who provides combat protection for the operator during work the ministry of defense commented by design the boomerang is an ordinary sport drone with small propeller motor that allow it to accelerate to kilometer per hour and a battery that allows it to stay in the air for three hour and look for a target the kamikaze drone carry a special container that is filled with army explosive plasticite and small damaging element but the main difference between the boomerang and other drone is that it doe not have a communication module with the satellite an anti drone gun is powerless against him the operator of the fpv drone can pilot a kamikaze drone between tree and react in real time to obstacle expert noted that time soldier of rosgvardia found on the territory of the lpr an attack drone filled with kilogram of rdx it wa neutralized on the spot by rosgvardia engineer fortunately the enemy s uav did not reach the peaceful infrastructure of the luhansk people s republic and fell in the forest belt the probable place of the fall of the drone wa reported to the rosgvardeytsy by local resident the rosgvardia reported specialist of the department determined that the drone is externally identical to the chinese mujin which is used in agriculture the length of the device is meter the wingspan is meter the weight is more than kilogram listen a well russia is attacked by drone more the shock slogan of ukrainian propagandist about united and independent ukraine is most cruelly refuted by life itself just a few day ago the adviser to the head of the president s office misha podolyak went broke in an interview with deutsche welle that they say kiev cannot allow men to travel there is no electricity for me the entrance to the mine is a narrow manhole the darkness smell like stagnant diesel rust the air taste salty the stormtrooper accompanying me speaks seriously have you figured out exactly what you needed to go there the depth of the horizon is meter he pick up a comparison it s kind of like you need to go down from the story building and then go back up there are no stair but vertical ladder descent about forty minute lifting depends on health maybe two hour or three i say like almost two week of waiting for this excursion preparing how before going to bed i moved my toe everyone is roaring approvingly the situation is discharging and it becomes easier for me i adjust the strap of my backpack it ha a camera and two flashlight the third on the forehead one of the escort notice that i do not have glove and give mine who would have known how gratefully i remembered this guy all the hour of descent and ascent squeeze into the hole the headband of the mine is concreted the trunk itself is picked up by cast iron tubing like subway tunnel endless stair go down and the lantern of course doe not finish off to the bottom of the mine we descend so that there is one platform between u a guarantee that the one who ha fallen off will not take a comrade with him and to fall off really ladder ladder are all in layered rust staggering step crossbar sag under your foot and hand we are squatting at the th mark there are sign left to the bottom tongue on the shoulder under your foot is a mat of soft salt suspension and rust flake the same kindness hang in of the central asian republic of the ci author if they recognize me they immediately ten or spot the friend returned in fought in the militia his mother did not even have time to feed him they came called in our language okay i ll call you ru ru nod and recount the first time he came down here with an assault group there were many rumor that the armed force used the mine for shelter from descended into it in armored car dragged with u fly and bumblebee grenade launcher and flamethrower author we expected everything to be mined here and here lived some miner until the new year then hour we wandered around the mine and i did not leave the feeling that i wa inside some fabulous castle everything wa shining and sparkling and at the same time it wa surprisingly warm we were already warmed by the hot core of the planet but the roar of artillery duel constantly brought me back to reality even at such a monstrous depth everything wa clearly audible we did not go to the working inspected only the tourist part and it took more than an hour everything wa in perfect order not looted not ruined warehouse of gas mask self rescuer for tourist the warehouse of helmet although they do not make sense here the salt seam is so strong that it doe not even need to be fastened unlike coal mine therefore here from the working giant hall went into the dark with ceiling a high a a storey they launch a drone and trained unit shoot it down but they can also carry explosive up to kg initially ukraine had only soviet uavs of the strizh type but they were finalized by western specialist and they turned into shock troop what is the difficulty of dealing with them they can fly at extremely low altitude they are not easy to detect but they can be suppressed with electronic warfare system such system worked well in the crimea called avtobaza how they work the drone is controlled by space system there is a suppression of the cosmic communication channel when he loses touch his control is affected the device is planted and by the way the range of this kind of converted target exceeds the range of the swift what are the further measure of the struggle to increase capability in the field of electronic warfare and air defense system not always a drone can be shot down using electronic warfare sometimes you need physical defeat fighter interceptor when two pilot are working on a low flying target at extremely low altitude how many such uavs can ukraine have we can talk about hundred of similar target they are launched a a rule from a catapult they don t need an airfield we need to destroy storage site those place where these device are being refined such a place wa in kharkov anatoly matviychuk retired colonel military expert editor in chief of the anna news agency on it by long range air defense system and the creation of electronic magnetic accessibility that is it simply cease to be controllable and affect it flight and eventually fall like a blank mean of camouflage which are widely used today net metal corner which make it difficult for this object to reach the target of destruction why the case of the appearance of drone on our territory have become kuibyshev kramatorsk metallurgical plant where chemical were unloaded under the control of ukrainian security officer and representative of the command of the armed force of ukraine according to the reconnaissance data the cargo consisted of sealed metal box eight of which had a chemical hazard sign the inscription bi zet and marking with two red line which corresponds to the class of toxic substance of temporary excretory action five box bore the inscription c riot three c ar riot with marking in the form of one red stripe which corresponds to irritating substance the cargo wa placed on american made armored vehicle which a part of the column moved to the line of combat contact on february wagon with a cargo of shrapnel ammunition with special marking were unloaded in kramatorsk unloading wa carried out at night on a platform in the suburb while the car were marked with the inscription building material cement according to the information available in the ministry of defense of russia earlier in the interest of the u ground force shrapnel shot equipped with ready made destructive element with liquid formulation of irritating substance were modernized the fact of the conflict kirillov recalled that in accordance with the convention on the prohibition of chemical weapon bi zet is a controlled chemical and is included in the second list it use is prohibited by article of the cwc we have repeatedly noted that the leadership of western country on a regular basis make provocative statement about the possibility of russia using weapon of mass destruction at the powell served a a pretext for the invasion of iraq and caused the death of more than half a million citizen of this country in photo of the white helmet circulated by news agency in which people in threat in a timely manner and respond to them promptly but also to reliably find out the type of substance and it manufacturer we learned that against the russian troop of the armed force of ukraine used homemade ammunition with the help of uavs in a substance of thermal action which contained combustible oxidant and additive some of which were produced in the czech republic we warn that in case hallucination memory impairment b zet is a u s army service poison agent and wa widely used during the vietnam war the united state and it ally have repeatedly used chemical munition during military conflict in afghanistan iraq and syria the united state announced the complete destruction of the b zet stockpile back in when about ton of this substance were disposed of but sample were left behind in addition the possibility of synthesizing b zet precursor on the basis of capacity for the production of pharmaceutical in the amount of up to several ten of ton per year ha been preserved the supply of armored vehicle which kirillov is talking about is handled by the main contractor of the pentagon which ha permit to work with nuclear biological and chemical weapon and it cannot be ruled out that this military equipment is container for transporting biological or chemical weapon to the front line here in the photo is the unloading in mannheim germany of american ifvs m a bradley going from the united state to ukraine on the vest of the worker is the inscription of the company in which he work amentum amentum government service holding llc this company is an american contractor of public and commercial service based in germantown maryland the company wa formed in on the basis of the federal group aecom management service which wa the pentagon s main contractor in world war ii today amentum is the second largest public service contractor in the u s government contract market but it s important to know exactly what amentum doe nuclear remediation operation at nuclear facility the isolation of u s nuclear waste repository the elimination of chemical and biological weapon under the nunn lugar cooperative threat reduction program and the creation of laboratory to study disease the same biological weapon and also manages a test and test site in nevada it seems that they are trying to transfer the test site from nevada with these trojan horse in the form of m a bradley ifvs to moldova and ukraine listen a well the west dream of ending russia with the hand of ukraine more i have always said that the more responsible and proactive the commander the more serious the approach to combat work of the entire unit this is especially true in the forward position which are subjected to daily shelling by ukrainian artillery the deeper the trench the more comfortable you feel when the frozen ground fall from close tear behind the collar and here is not even a trench a whole underground city with an extensive network of passage staff office mini barrack a bathhouse and even a lenin room overhead are log in four roll and a sand pad fortunately there are no problem with sand here this is the basis of the pine forest that stretch around kremennaya under the coniferous paw it seems that you are invisible to enemy drone but this feeling is deceptive just the day before i watched how in the same forest our drone led three enemy fighter until they came to the support and it wa dismantled by our artillery in recent week there ha been a slow offensive of russian troop paratrooper and motorized rifleman are expanding the bridgehead being in active defense i arrive in the dungeon of the th motorized rifle regiment immediately after defender of the fatherland day there s a lot to talk about with people you ve lived with for two month under raisin however no familiar face are visible the composition of the regiment ha changed grown and now largely consists of mobilized but the commander of the regiment kurgan is the same introduces you the enemy move reserve just two day ago whole column were seen coming from west and north to south most likely to strengthen their position we are now advancing and knocking him out of his stronghold therefore they pull back and strengthen the second echelon of course now they no longer have such preparation a at the very beginning but nevertheless the enemy doe not flee until you destroy or injure the battle doe not cease to be fought they are constantly on the defensive kurgan on a special operation from the first day twice with his command post he left the encirclement first from the bottom of the raisin then from under the estuary carrying out in a heavy backpack mean of communication and secret equipment at the last time they even stumbled upon a fresh support of the armed force of ukraine but a military trick saved it the kurgan portrayed the commander of a lost ukrainian group and the colleague suggested the right way and in our action what ha changed over the year i ask the commander much mostly people without combat experience came in the mistake we made in the beginning were analyzed all the time conclusion have been drawn we have changed tactic against this background separate unit appear which have never existed before we keep up with the time in accordance with the combat situation we improve ourselves all the time we do not stand still we can say that the army ha become stronger much stronger if you analyze the whole path that we have passed and combat experience ha already been gained how the mobilized joined the work they fight just like everyone else there is no division he is mobilized a volunteer or a cadre at first they act only with those who are already experienced here adopt their experience after some completed task we analyze with them what we did right and what is wrong so in a month you can t tell by them that they are mobilized just like everybody else i have all the personnel mobilized they show very high result many already have state award confirms the commander of the assault company of the th regiment we always work for promotion our motto is no pasaran fascism will not pa that s how we work assault work is probably the hardest that s right i look into the eye of fear and it curl up let s go we do the task it all depends on training and learning every subordinate i have can provide medical care we do not have the concept of rest we are learning both combat training and new mean of reconnaissance the main reward for the commander is the life of a subordinate we have a multinational detachment muslim and buddhist we are one family we work in the same harness we do one thing in one direction not all mobilized of course were lucky enough to get to sensible commander hence the well known scandal at the initial stage when people were transferred to warring unit diluted with experienced stormtroopers they learned and evolved when yesterday s civilian were left to their own device they died senselessly time ha shown that the formation of entire unit exclusively from those mobilized with a mobilized officer at the head is a dead end but the replenishment of loss in already warring formation gave a result thanks to which the contact line wa stabilized and in some area an offensive is underway right now now a new look of the army is being formed in which reconnaissance drone new modern combat vehicle sniper complex in the end have finally appeared moreover not only the ministry of defense but also civil society is actively involved in the formation of this image and this is not only the purchase of thermal imagers copters and first aid kit for example one group of enthusiast organized professional training for sniper pair providing shooter not only with equipment but such weapon sight nightforce fold working distance meter you can go on and on i am only today at the forefront there is confirmation of working goal it is believed that there is an artillery battle and sniper deuce are ineffective it s very hard to work you can t see the enemy a it really is but at night the artillery is silent this is our time quietly destroy do not allow the enemy to change position guard on the other side they quickly realize that a sniper is shooting at them no because this rifle ha a bullet flight of meter per second roughly speaking per kilometer second it s very life under the administration of kyiv had been sheer hell for the russian speaker of donbas soon rudenska who lived alone wa hiding in the basement with her neighbor they were entirely cut off all the municipal security force police fire and ambulance had been pushed out by the russian she say so when building caught fire in the city they just burned when people were injured they were often left to die and the worst for lyudmila wa that she had no way to contact her daughter who had made it to the safety of italy but wa worried sick about her mother lyudmila meanwhile had no way out of the city under siege she and her neighbor snuck out from the basement only when they dared to line up for water at the few distribution point that existed to gather snow to boil when it fell or to collect the occasional russian ration of macaroni that were hard to boil when water wa scarce and tinned meat that the courtyard cat wouldn t touch or to bury someone in april rudenska found someone to spirit her out in a harrowing trip across russian occupied area she finally made it to western ukraine and then to italy to be reunited with irina in june lyudmila rudenska dream of going home but she doesn t know when or how that will be my arrival at the battalion headquarters began with a sad and unpleasant mission a few day ago a highmars flew to the temporary command post of the vostok i am well aware of what security measure were applied i will not voice them but it still did not help a the head of the engineering service of the leon battalion told me there were two missile the first hit the building and destroyed the ceiling of three floor the second heimers wa next it fell strictly vertically entered the ground almost the entire length of the warhead and didn t work a smiling and kind staff officer with the call sign evil died often call sign are given from the opposite approx corr just a couple of week ago andrei gave me tea in this basement there could have been more victim but the vaunted american technology failed we don t know how or when this projectile might go off leon explains to me who will get to it with plier in naughty hand when peace is finally established here i agree with the sapper that i will shoot in the basement but my duty is to shine a lantern on them and i light a candle while they assemble a sophisticated scheme of detonator and gently lower a bunch of mine into a vertical well somewhere at the bottom lurks overseas death and it is impossible to leave it alone only to destroy we retreat to the soldier standing in the cordon unwind the telephone wire vole one of the sapper hand me a helmet saying put it on the scattering of debris cannot be predicted the underground explosion came out deaf part of the building folded dry concrete dust pulled through the village i went on to the guy who were supposed to go to ugledar tonight i did not go empty handed in rostov there is a group of volunteer girl they call themselves pharmacy fairy from them ukraine attacked the airport in bryansk the drone wa shot down over a russian city over the past eight day this is the third attempt by the armed force of ukraine to strike at the bryansk international airport the uavs were filled with explosive moved at low altitude but were destroyed by russian air defense system and on the eve of the armed force of ukraine fired mortar at the suzemsky district of the bryansk region damaging two house they do not save ammunition but in vain at the right time it may not be enough listen a well will russia be able to complete the special operation before the end of the year more just over a year ago yulia bondarenko s day were full of lesson plan grading and her student seventh grade hormone when russian missile shattered that routine and russian troop threatened her home in kyiv ukraine s capital m bondarenko volunteered to fight back despite her lack of experience the grave risk to her life and ukraine s apparently impossible odds i never held a rifle in my hand and never even saw one up close m bondarenko said in the first two week i felt like i wa in a fog it wa just a constant nightmare for week she had followed the ominous news of russian troop massing on ukraine s border and decided on feb to enlist a a reservist the next day the largest land war in europe since world war ii began a explosion shook kyiv m bondarenko took the subway to report for duty uncertain the recruiting office would take her without finished paperwork or a fitness exam but in the chaotic swirl of volunteer officer asked no question they handed her a rifle and bullet and assigned her to a unit expecting to fight in urban combat if the russian army broke into the capital she wa only one recruit in a huge influx of volunteer who swelled the size of ukrainian force from about soldier to about one million today and whose life were transformed by the war in a recent interview m bondarenko recalled the intense stress of those early day unaccustomed to the sound of artillery she said she expected to be hit after every blast she thought she would die step by step she learned how to be a soldier fellow volunteer showed her how to load aim and fire her kalashnikov rifle they practiced trench fighting and other tactic during the weekslong battle for kyiv m bondarenko and about other volunteer almost all men lived in a shopping mall rotating through shift at checkpoint in the city she and two other woman changed in a bathroom away from the men it wa so cold at night she slept hugging one of the other female soldier slowly sleeping bag mat and warm uniform turned up and the unit eventually made it to a barrack not all of the new recruit needed training eight year of fighting against russia backed separatist in eastern ukraine ha schooled a generation of ukrainian soldier about in trench warfare on the plain the type of combat dominating the war today many veteran returned to active service when the full scale invasion began in the week after ukraine fended off russia from the capital and a russian troop retreated in the spring the fighting shifted to the east m bondarenko wa offered a chance to resign or take a position in a desk job or a a cook she overcame her fear and chose to stay with the infantry living in the barrack and training for campaign to come like other recruit without experience m bondarenko learned on the job how to find trip wire and explosive trap to duck for cover from shell to provide battlefield first aid at first she worried about her ability bookish and shy she never had any interest in the military and knew nothing of weapon or war but on patrol and at the firing range handling supply and learning tactic her confidence grew it wa pleasant when the guy said it s working out with you she said and they said i would go into battle with you her brigade wa stationed in a village south of kyiv where soldier formed relationship with resident they frequented a shop for snack and m bondarenko grew close to a local math teacher but at spring s end they had to say goodbye they were heading toward the northeastern kharkiv region toward the front in the northeast the unit came under near constant russian shelling over the summer m bondarenko helped handle logistics and supply to keep ukraine s force fighting patriotism and learning the history of moscow s repression of ukrainian had motivated her to enlist in the first place she said she had moved to kyiv from a village in central ukraine for university study arriving shortly before mass street protest toppled a pro russia president in during the political awakening that followed she re evaluated her family s history and found injustice from russia s long rule in ukraine during soviet time she said a hydroelectric dam had flooded her village khudyaki but the authority did nothing to relocate resident villager had to salvage what they could from their home and rebuild on higher ground when i became older i understood how history wa taught incorrectly in school she said even a green new soldier swelled it rank ukraine adopted dozen of new western donated weapon by the fall it had gained strength ukraine counterattacked and upending long held idea of the balance of military force in europe defeated the russian army on the battlefield in two successful offensive in kharkiv and kherson region over the new year s holiday m bondarenko wa given a respite she returned to kyiv where she got to indulge in joy from before the war a new haul of book delivered to her apartment coffee with friend time with her sister and year old niece she also used her leave to visit her year old mother hanna bondarenko at her village in central ukraine where she had grown up speaking ukrainian in contrast to the russian spoken in kyiv s cafe but her anger at russia had simmered a moscow fomented fighting over the past eight year and she had long switched to speaking ukrainian in public when russia invaded her mother said she at least felt a sense of relief that her daughter would not be drafted i wa happy i didn t have a son because i didn t have to worry about him going off to war she said i never imagined my daughter would sign up her daughter said she tried to stave off some feeling while her unit wa deployed she feel guilt about her mother s fear for her and miss teaching and her boyfriend she keep a box of letter from former student at home when i am away on the base or in the field i try to shut down emotionally she said the backpack she carried held a small part of her life a a teacher book some were child s book that she sometimes read to cheer up fellow soldier but she said that she needed to serve her country meaning that before long she had to make another round of goodbye parting with her boyfriend in kyiv she said she thought of his daily fear and their hope for the future the relationship she said show me that even in the dark there can be light of the many volunteer she ha met over the past year many were deployed to eastern ukraine where fighting is raging and m bondarenko know some who have been killed she ha not yet fired her rifle in combat but if her platoon is sent to the front she said she feel ready to fight i am an infantry soldier now she said nato secretary general jens stoltenberg at the munich security conference said that russia s victory in ukraine for the north atlantic alliance is more dangerous than the escalation of hostility what is the west so afraid of what goal did russia pursue republic and the decision to conduct a special operation this is a whole complex of reason the main of which of course is the humanitarian catastrophe that broke out in the donbas after the kiev regime launched an eight year war destroying thousand of resident of donetsk lugansk donetsk and lugansk people s republic who opposed the anti constitutional coup in kiev people really died russian people who wanted to speak their native language in russian who wholeheartedly sought to be in alliance with our country who advocated good neighborly relation with russia external force the policy of the european union the united state somehow influenced the development of the situation in the direction of the conflict of course the geopolitical situation also played a huge role the united state wa turning ukraine into a nato military bridgehead preparing to deploy it fleet in odessa in ochakov in mariupol preparing to install it missile on our border naturally we could not allow this to happen russia took all the necessary diplomatic step proposed solution to the conflict related to the implementation by nato of the agreement signed by nato on the nato russia founding act which did not imply the presence of nato armed force in the new state russia asked for guarantee of non expansion of nato to the country of eastern europe but the western partner abandoned their own promise to republic in march therefore the operation wa carried out a a preventive one our cause is just of course our cause is right the victory will be ours the enemy will be defeated certainly in parenthesis a soon a we take paraskovievka or avdiivka listen a well dmitry steshin the use of chemical weapon will not bring victory to kiev more the armed force of ukraine used ammunition with a toxic chemical from an attack copter on february you have dealt a lot with this topic and participated in international symposium what kind of ammunition is this what kind of damage can it do how to fight against this and do we have such opportunity well if the munition it mean it wa manufactured for military purpose another thing is what kind of it is homemade or factory if it is factory then it is easy to determine by the shell which country it belongs to judging by the fact that our serviceman there were vomiting tearing and so on this charge wa calculated only for an irritating effect that is no death were recorded it is possible that it wa also a homemade projectile which is also strange ukraine signed the opcw convention at one time organization for the prohibition of chemical weapon yes if munition because other country still behave more cautiously within the framework of the opcw than the american who say and live by the rule what is beneficial to them everything is fine and what is unprofitable mean that it is not good in any case this need to be dealt with because this is not the first message and systematically collect the necessary material analyze them look at the origin because many chemical drug can cause similar manifestation in the form of nausea vomiting tearing and so on however it flashed that there wa still a burn of the respiratory tract it s already therefore in any case now it is necessary to understand and very systematically within the framework of the convention to present these claim because we ll talk we ll discus and we ll forget and here we are again it s not even the first time we ve discussed this tell me that s how protected our warrior are in position they are not yet protected in the sense of having anti incident because their ammunition doe not include even an elementary gas mask because everyone proceeds from the fact that chemical weapon are prohibited for use and even i will give you such a historical analogy hitler when he attacked our country had chemical weapon but he did not use them he used it in the gas chamber but so that on the battlefield such fact for the entire great patriotic war were not recorded i city former city council deputy konstantin ivashchenko told me he will then become the acting mayor of the city i met him outside the hospital where the living lay interspersed with the dead ukrainian violation of child abduction during armed conflict the report said it cited rushed adoption transferring child across international border and prolonged custody without express consent from guardian a eastern military command said in an interview on monday he said that ukrainian troop had repelled assault on bakhmut over the previous hour but that no watershed moment had been reached the city he said is under ukrainian control bakhmut lie at the heart of a brutal monthslong battle after leveling much of the city with artillery the russian now appear to have surrounded it on three side and to have captured several town and village around it ukraine s military said on monday that street fighting had also begun in two of bakhmut s neighborhood for month volunteer from ukraine and abroad had bakhmut which had a prewar population of about and where several highway and rail line converge a pivotal to president vladimir v putin s stated goal of conquering donbas the vital industrial and mining region that make up easternmost ukraine russia ha poured enormous number of troop into trying to conquer it driving conscript into near suicidal assault in a bid to overwhelm ukrainian defensive line the city now lie in ruin and the vast majority of it people have long fled but ukrainian have made bakhmut a symbol of tenacious resistance and a rallying cry and president volodymyr zelensky of ukraine ha rejected talk of giving it up ukrainian force have also used russia s relentless wave of attack a an opportunity to inflict thousand of casualty the result military analyst say ha been slaughter out of proportion to the city s strategic importance u s official estimate that russia ha seen nearly fighter killed or wounded since it invaded almost a year ago a staggering loss the soldier in sergei s squad were recruited from penal colony by the private military company known a wagner whose force have mostly been deployed in the bakhmut area there they have enabled russian line to move forward slowly cutting key resupply road for the ukrainian army russia s deployment of former convict is a dark chapter in a vicious war russia behind bar a prison right group ha estimated that a many a russian prisoner have been recruited since last summer with most sent to the battle for bakhmut in the early phase of xa the xa war the russian army had copious armored vehicle artillery and other heavy weaponry but relatively few soldier on the battlefield now the table have turned russia ha deployed about soldier in ukraine according to ukraine s military intelligence agency an additional are in training camp official said meaning there is the potential for half a million soldier to join the offensive but using infantry to storm trench redolent of world war i brings high casualty so far the tactic ha been used primarily by wagner in the push for bakhmut last week the head of wagner yevgeny v prigozhin said he would end the practice of recruiting convict but russia s regular army this month began recruiting convict in exchange for pardon shifting the practice on the russian side in the war from the wagner private army to the military some military analyst and western government have questioned russia s strategy xa citing rate of wounded and killed at around percent in battalion featuring former convict on sunday the british defense intelligence agency xa said xa that over the past two week russia had probably suffered it highest rate of casualty since the first week of the invasion interview with former wagner soldier at the ukrainian detention center aligned with these description of the fighting and shed light on a violent harrowing experience for russian soldier nobody could ever believe such a thing could exist sergei said of wagner tactic sergei sat shoulder slumped on the sofa in the warden s office of the ukrainian detention center he wa balding and wore shoe without lace the soldier arrived at the front straight from russia s penal colony system which is rife with abuse and where obedience to harsh code of conduct in a violent setting is enforced by prison gang and guard alike the same sense of beaten subjugation persists at the front sergei said enabling commander to send soldier forward on hopeless human wave attack we are prisoner even if former prisoner he said we are nobody and have no right sergei said he had worked a a cellphone xa tower technician in a far northern siberian city living with his wife and three child in the interview he admitted to dealing marijuana and meth for which he wa sentenced to year in prison in in october he accepted an offer to fight in exchange for a pardon the arrangement he said wa not offered to rapist and drug addict but murderer burglar and other prisoner were welcome of course any normal person fear death he said but a pardon for eight year is valuable the fighting would turn out to be far more dangerous than he had imagined in three day at the front south of bakhmut private sergei first served a a stretcher bearer carrying out mangled bloody former prisoner who had been killed or wounded in an omen of what awaited him when ordered to join an assault xa on the night of jan they were commanded to advance yard along the tree line then dig in and wait for a subsequent wave to arrive one soldier carried a light machine gun the others were armed with only assault rifle and hand grenade the sequential assault on ukrainian line by small unit of former russian prisoner have become a signature russian tactic in the effort to capture bakhmut we see them crawl for a kilometer or more toward ukrainian trench then open fire at close range and try to capture position col roman kostenko the chairman of the defense and intelligence committee in ukraine s parliament said in an interview it s effective yes they have heavy loss but with these heavy loss they sometimes advance it could be colonel kostenko said that such infantry assault on entrenched defense will remain mostly confined to the fight for bakhmut and that they are being used to conserve tank and armored personnel carrier for the expected offensive but they could also serve a a template for wider fighting the former convict colonel kostenko said are herded into the battlefield by harsh discipline they have order and they cannot disobey order especially in wagner a private named aleksandr who shaved three year off a sentence for illegal logging by enlisting with wagner said that before deploying to the front he wa told he would be shot if he disobeyed order to advance they brought u to a basement divided u into five person group and though we hadn t been trained told u to run ahead a far a we could go he said of his commander his dash toward ukrainian line in a group of five soldier ended with three dead and two captured another captured russian eduard enlisted to get four year cut from a sentence for car theft he spent three month at the front a a stretcher bearer before being ordered forward he wa captured on his first human wave assault from his time a a stretcher bearer he said he estimated that half of the men in each assault were wounded or killed with shrapnel and bullet wound the most common injury private sergei said he had initially been pleased with the offer of a pardon in exchange for service in wagner when i came to this war i thought it wa worth it he said but after his one experience in an assault he changed his mind i started to think thing over in a big way he said of course it wasn t worth it since february are not intended for circular defense even fortress created to fight in full encirclement always have weak spot where the wall are lower the palisade is rotten the fighter are cowardly and untrained coast most georgian russian and turkish military specialist agree on one thing this horned death sailed from the odessa coast where the ukrainian were densely covered with similar mine fairway such mine were installed on the so called mine and simply put on cable at a certain depth but during storm mine were torn off the cable and they went on a free voyage throughout the black sea turkey began to ring alarm bell last summer when a black ball filled with kilogram of tnt began to dangle near it shore further ukrainian mine torn off by a storm began to be noticed in the water of bulgaria and romania the bulgarian authority urged resident of the black sea region to be more vigilant because of the danger of blowing up ship on ukrainian sea mine we ask the population in the area of dobrich varna and burgas to be vigilant if suspicious spherical object are detected in the water or on the shore we ask citizen to report the incident to the emergency number and the turkish navy command urged sailor to be more careful when entering the black sea and track drifting mine it is important that all ship in the region establish careful monitoring of drifting mine the detection of mine like object should be reported to the main rescue coordination centre well now here is batumi our naval specialist believe that the current of the black sea were inevitably to drag the ukrainian mine torn from the anchor to the batumi coast and this is a threat not only to the beach but also to shipping in that region and even more the appearance of these walking mine is not excluded in the end in the mediterranean sea georgian and turkish newspaper are already howling the threat that ha arisen is the result of negligent and absolutely rash activity of the armed force of ukraine i asked the specialist in naval mine captain i rank vladimir orlov what trouble can bring people ship or warship of this type horned death here s what he said actually the batumi people were very lucky if it happened on a warm day on the beach there could be up to a hundred corp well the steamer or barge would instantly go to the bottom the horn of this mine are lead cup inside of which there are glass ampoule with sulfuric acid upon contact with the hull of the ship the lead crumpled the ampoule broke the acid leaked out and became an electrolyte in the galvanic cell well the resulting electric current activated the detonator and ba bah listen a well why did the west disrupt the negotiation between russia and ukraine more ascent artillery working the twilight of the dugout is setting in attention in part to protect the soldier from reprisal by russia but also because of reluctance within the ukrainian military to highlight the effort of soldier whose home country ha done so much harm to ukraine several hundred of them are concentrated in the area around bakhmut in eastern ukraine official said they are always grouped with their own but are overseen by ukrainian officer in interview some russian soldier said they were already living in ukraine when russian force invaded last year and felt an obligation to defend their adopted country others often with no military experience crossed into ukraine from russia after the war began moved by a sense that the kremlin s invasion wa profoundly unjust we haven t come here to prove anything said one soldier with the call sign zaza we ve come here to help ukraine achieve the full withdrawal of russian force from ukrainian territory and the future de putinization of russia fearing retaliation against relative and themselves none of the soldier interviewed agreed to be identified by name or to provide specific detail about their biography last week the russian prosecutor general s office filed a suit with the country s supreme court to have the legion declared a terrorist organization zaza a skinny blond who look barely out of high school would not even give his age saying only that he wa under after russian force invaded he said he could not keep his mouth shut his outspokenness and antiwar post on social medium got him in trouble with his university s administration then with the police when officer from russia s security service showed up at his front door in the fall he said he decided it wa time to leave he said he walked across the border into ukraine and signed up to fight at such a young age it is a little early for me to talk about my political opinion and worldview because these are just forming now he said but when your country ha been taken over by one bad man you need to take thing into your own hand xa at the start of the war ukrainian law prevented russian citizen from joining the armed force it took until august to finalize legislation that would allow the legion to legally join the fight andriy yusov a spokesman for ukraine s military intelligence service said in a statement there wa a large number of russian who because of their moral principle could not remain indifferent and were searching for a way to enter the rank of the defender of ukraine mr yusov said explaining the military s motivation to create the unit all legionnaire have come with a huge desire to stop putin s horde and free russia from dictatorship the group operates under the umbrella of ukraine s international legion a fighting force that includes unit made up of american and british volunteer a well a belarusian georgian and others it is not easy to join russian soldier said they have to submit an application and undergo an extensive background check that includes polygraph test only then can they enter basic training a russian passport holder they are inevitably met with distrust there have been several attempt by russian spy to infiltrate the legion mr yusov said in a pine forest in the kyiv region last week a group of new russian recruit nearing the end of a three month basic training course practiced tactical retreat firing mortar and basic combat medicine they exemplified the international hodgepodge that ha come to define much of ukraine s war effort russian soldier trained on a french made millimeter mortar and carried american made m rifle it s better than a kalashnikov one of the soldier said of the m i ve fired about round and haven t had any problem yet the sound of small arm fire and heavy artillery echoed through the forest and an instructor threw a dummy grenade near a small group of soldier to gauge how they would react most of the soldier will occupy position back from the front line working in artillery or air reconnaissance unit using drone though the instructor were all ukrainian all spoke in russian in interview some of the recruit tried to speak a few word of ukrainian but quickly switched back to their halyna luhova the mayor of kherson cradled a helmet in her lap and gazed out the bulletproof window when the first shell ripped open directly in the path of the van maybe yard ahead her driver locked his elbow and tightened his grip on the wheel and drove straight through the cloud of fresh black smoke oh my god m luhova said a we raced with her through the city they re hunting me the second shell landed even closer she s been almost killed six time she sleep on a cot in a hallway she make a month and her city in southern ukraine ha become one of the war s most pummeled place fired on by russian artillery nearly every hour but m luhova the only female mayor of a major city in ukraine remains determined to project a sense of normality even though kherson is anything but normal she hold regular meeting in underground bunker she excoriates department head for taking too long to set up bomb shelter she circulates in neighborhood and chit chat with resident whose life have been torn apart by explosion she chalk up any complaint about corruption or mismanagement and there are plenty to rumor mongering by russian backed collaborator who are paid to frustrate her administration kherson a port city on the dnipro river wa captured by russian force in march liberated by ukrainian force in november and now three month later lie nearly deserted pack of out of school child roam the empty boulevard lined with leafless tree and century old building cracked in half m luhova see her job defined by basic verb bury clean fix and feed of the percent or so of kherson s original population of who remain many are too old too poor too stubborn or too strung out to flee she recently became so overwhelmed with their need for food water generator internet access bus pension medicine firewood that she said she dropped to minute of sleep a night and became so exhausted she had to be put on intravenous drug she feel better she said though not exactly calm we need those bomb shelter now she snapped at a meeting in early february when it wa several degree below freezing outside in front of her in an underground office sat the head of the city s main department many in winter jacket and hat the office had no heat she wa pushing to acquire dozen of free standing concrete bomb shelter when an administrator responded that the contracting process needed to be followed or they could be accused of corruption she exploded you are doing nothing and i m getting really pissed off at your stupidity m luhova said i feel like i don t have enough air when i m standing next wa teaching english at a neighborhood school married and a mother she climbed the rank to school director which she used a a springboard to be elected to kherson s city council eight year ago before commander is under stress cannot give a clear command at the same time he is a captain of the ministry of internal affair two decade in danger how so and our entire hour long conversation with him others he overcame the horror of the adaptation period of fighting i then counted that i had conducted conversation in fact small sermon it became clear that clergy were needed on the front line and providence the first to appear wa the ru battalion the second is the alexander nevsky battalion reservist held the so called donetsk gate a problem area that the enemy viewed a the main entrance to yevgeny rodionov who refused to remove the cross and wa brutally killed by militant in the first chechen war the battalion took verkhnetoretskoye in it father george must serve a prayer service and give communion to the soldier father george is the first time in donbas i understand perfectly well that this is an act i feel his inner anxiety and take on the role of a guide trying to explain to my father what is around u we turn to yasynuvataya saying let s go along the military road this is the once gorgeous horlivka donetsk highway it is partially cut by the armed force of ukraine we are commander of the gorlovka garrison in when he went to donetsk brought cigarette to the dryer talked to them then everything changed of course and i tell father george a terrible story that plowed over me and still sits inside out in that clearing lay a bunch of dead dryer covered with the ukrainian flag the military kp took a picture of this the most famous picture and then a priest in semi catholic semi orthodox robe uniate came to pick up the dead but none of the fighter wanted to help him and then this priest shouted are you human or not human is there something human in you and fighter they spoke one by one you are not a priest we have other priest you unwound my house you killed my sister the corp were loaded of course but then for the first time i realized that what wa and our fighter wa saved this is the main thing our extreme point is the battalion named forty martyr of sebaste named after the roman soldier who converted to christianity and suffered terrible come true more a month ago a ukrainian video wa posted on the social network with strange homemade ammunition for dropping from quadcopters the author seemed to hint hold on moskali you all khana the video did not produce the desired effect therefore they decided to repeat the stuffing last sunday february these shooting were posted by the famous ukrainian right winger yuriy magyar this time he showed dozen of homemade container in a freezer under the ukrainian flag expert immediately assumed that their filling wa cyanogen chloride at a temperature of minus degree it go from a gaseous state to a solid one so it is safer to store such homemade ammunition according to the nazi these container are designed to be dropped on the position of russian fighter completing the encirclement of bakhmut artemovsk the situation of ukrainian troop in this city is critical perhaps that is why the nazi decided to show this weapon of last chance for scoundrel without delving into chemistry cyanogen chloride is one of the closest relative of hydrocyanic acid only heavier than air creep on the ground crawl into shelter it is used in the production of herbicide in huge volume transported by railway tanker and in the ukrainian chaos it is easy to get it which we demonstrated clearly at the same time since january our fighter at the front began to note the strange consequence of ordinary droppings of ammunition from quadrocopters on our position burning in the nasopharynx headache nausea all this indirectly confirmed the use of cyanogen chloride moreover it even fell on scream loses consciousness and fall after short term clonic tonic cramp the muscle relax tendon reflex disappear exophthalmos develops the pupil dilate do not respond to light the skin is pink or pale frightening u with another superweapon that is about to be delivered to him this shaky balance is the fattest most productive ground for confusion and rumor that exhaust the soul a soon a it got dark fighter on a one eyed loaf drove after me and on the way told me an amazing thing father cyprian and i immediately went to the front line the guy found him a black bulletproof vest so that the cassock would not stand out and behold he run down the trench tall thin with the hero s star on his chest he will stop talk to the fighter bless him further then father cyprian went to the hospital to the soldier who had lost their leg i talked to a girl who wa seriously wounded during the shelling of the city psychologist worked with her no one know what father cyprian wa talking to her about but in many month the girl smiled for the first time i met with a monk in one of the monastery on the outskirt of donetsk we peacefully had tea before the interview until it arrived so that the floor swayed significantly i turned around to look out the window and found wall of sandbag instead of glass of course we started the conversation with the ongoing svo under the circumstance it wa impossible to talk about anything else father cyprian can you explain what is going on here well god know what s going on here he ha his own goal and they re simple we are lost child ukraine is very lost and god a a loving father desire like any simple father you probably have kid you want them to be happy yes so that they are with you so that you are friend with your child and they are with you and god desire the same thing here he is with u if the only way to stop evil this satanic movement is an operation in which god will win and we are an instrument in his hand of course then god allows what happens to happen you can understand what the purpose is what is the end of this god s plan some believe to recreate the soviet union to create an empire all this excuse me is stupidity human wisdom and it is not even the goal to demolish the ukrainian authority who do not like u the goal is quite different that everyone those who live on the territory of ukraine and the ukrainian military and our serviceman their wife mother child finally turned to face their father and like lost child returned to him that s what god want yes through suffering pain loss and for what yes so that we are happy and a person can only be happy with god because god is love father cyprian you personally had premonition that here in novorossiya in ukraine everything will be like this i didn t just understand i knew it wa inevitable well please tell me can evil by itself stop of course not it will go until it is stopped imagine a sadist can he stop being one on his own no something ha to happen that will prevent him from being a sadist and then maybe he will think we are now an instrument in the hand of god to stop the spread of evil and until that happens thing will go on i wa recently in our battalion vostok near ugledar i am well acquainted with the commander with the call sign forest he ha been fighting since during the assault on mariupol he fought for day in complete encirclement and so in complete darkness not seeing each other we suddenly started talking to him about whether it wa possible to pray for our enemy i may be wrong but i try to look from god s point of view we have only one option victory victory over evil that everything would change and become godlike in love i myself encountered this when my father died in afghanistan when i went there my commander said to me you need to give two gun to avenge your father revenge no a completely different story happened to me there i did not know the commandment then do not take revenge beloved leave it to me i will repay at the sweep of one village they took a spirit there wa information that he wa a scout kombrig did not want to hand him over to the brigade call two fighter and say put him in an apc take him away and in expense i still can t explain why i said to him you hear combat and i won t let you shoot him he turned around like that looked at me who are you not to give me he called two fighter took this afghan in an apc and i also quickly jumped there the afghan did not understand where he wa being taken but two of our fighter were depressed sitting like nailed down and all three of u had doubt i just said a a senior in military rank i order that we go to the brigade they came back i reported to the brigade commander of course i said this is not a spirit i don t know again where the confidence came from you were right yes the guy wa checked again he served in the afghan army he had award therefore i believe that in my life i have done only one truly divine act this one a believer can save his soul if he is at war when i met with wounded guy i asked the question do you have a desire to avenge your dead friend only once i wa told well if i had been captured i would have interrogated him love is about not doing evil to your neighbor that s a minimum defeat evil with good that is with love is that realistic there is a story on the internet when a wagner fighter run to a trench where two soldier of the armed force of ukraine what did i see after all in what condition is he but he demanded that they drop their weapon they don t our fighter grab the barrel of the machine gun and pull on himself when you look slowly you can see that the enemy is going to shoot from it at all and the second one go straight at our fighter the warrior simply ha no choice but to shoot but he did everything to save their life but he could just run up and shoot do i want if i am taken prisoner i will be bullied or just immediately shot a they have already done from the other side i don t want to you don t do that either therefore we need love for the enemy in general a christian should not have an enemy let anyone consider u enemy and i should not have an enemy why doesn t the opponent behave the same way but repeatedly demonstrates his cruelty those who are now fighting on the other side are lost sheep a the saying go if you tell a person he s a pig he grunt that s what happened in ukraine now a lot of woman in russia are waiting for their husband to go home and they are waiting for me at home you can say something to them in consolation i know one thing that waiting is the hardest part being in the unknown what s wrong with my husband whether he ll come back or not is the hardest part therefore in the fate of woman to wait i can only sympathize and ask woman to bear their share to learn how to do it it s hard for them there is no connection with the front line yet it s not up to u to decide when we re going to be born and it s not up to u to decide when we re going to die that s how my father died in afghanistan i wa also grieving year old he had already served the last flight and suddenly and what do i think now having already known how god look at this if my father hadn t gone to the lord then he saved the guy and of the seven crew member all survived he wa the only one who died saving everyone there is no more love than to give one s life for one s friend we all have a mission i ve talked to widow i ve talked a lot almost everyone i don t know how to live on why we should always remember woman sweet good beloved woman about those who are nearby and who s around child and if you suffer you are killed because it will affect the child think of him and the child is a weak soul not yet strong in trial the spiritual connection is enormous between mother and child and if the mother suffers i lost about her beloved she just need to switch all attention to the child then it will become easier herself and yet god willing that all husband return will last more than two day it is ready to counteract for example american abrams tank or german leopard the wheeled marker can reportedly move autonomously for up to hour and carry a machine gun or constructor for creating model of warfare in the future the marker platform is a joint project of the national center for the development of technology and basic element of robotics of the foundation for advanced research and the ngo android technics kp ru turned to viktor litovkin a military observer and retired colonel for comment you can imagine the real possibility of the marker let s test it first in real combat operation for example in the svo zone what is a combat robot in the st century this is a resistant to strong external influence on a good course on rough terrain autonomous platform on which an effective and fairly small sized reconnaissance and combat operation unit is installed plus a secure communication unit in general the complex of block is the most effective configuration the complex of this combination of multidirectional equipment is more effective on wheel or on track we can assume that it is rather on caterpillar but what is more important is what kind of self adjustment this system ha what software it ha what are the introduction to specific goal and objective this system the marker robot must instantly inform it operator that it ha detected a given target according to the program it is obliged to give out the coordinate of the target and it ability to repel the attack per second and the operator must be able not only to confirm for example the defeat but also to coordinate the rapid departure from the return fire of the target in the event of it non defeat or in case of a sharp change in task and than the ground based marker a copter or uav is better copter is almost always clearly visible to the enemy and so it s almost always visually vulnerable and the marker is moving on the ground and it potentially cannot be detected until a certain point before the robot reach the target the marker can carry many time more combat and reconnaissance equipment than any aerial copter due to it layout most likely yes but while it is difficult to say how much more effectively to use it that s why they are now conducting test in the donbas the american have combat robot that are more effective than ours you have to ask the narrow
