real homeland a country that no longer exists today the gdr that wa the beginning of our conversation for me personally the gdr is first of all the cool action film of the defa film studio with gojko miti a the most fearless indian and of course scarce shoe and household appliance and for you wonderful childhood and youth full accessibility of all type of education from the age of i wa engaged in figure skating then i wa cycling my brother went to music school and played a lot of instrument we tried ourselves in different field science language museum club they visited concentration camp to remember the horror of fascism they were friend with all people first of all with the ussr and how is it now in a united germany i m a mom myself and i know what my kid are getting now from school program removed the reading of book and poem the study of many science even child s singing an uneducated society is formed like biomass which is easy to manage even the history of the gdr must disappear it must be erased from memory the same brecht heinrich heine tucholsky when i quoted these classic then imagine fell under sanction because of this you got involved in politics no it s probably education my father and grandfather were member of the government my grandmother owned the largest library in berlin she opened it up to everyone and it wa forced to close when the gdr wa annexed do you think that the gdr wa annexed in sport school we were instilled with a sense of partnership and a sense of justice with the annexation of my homeland not only sport ended my section wa closed the coach wa fired why i started thinking about it and then i just started hating the system after all the gdr underwent a tough denazification and germany together with the nazi and nato invader it built it statehood in such a way that all those who served in the wehrmacht were not only rehabilitated but also given privilege so no one fought fascism here it wa simply hidden under the mantle of democracy and by the way during the annexation of the gdr there wa no referendum everything wa decided for u they took away our land and industry and annexed it to the federal republic of germany they made u second class german a former citizen of the gdr we receive pension and salary a third lower than german citizen our diploma despite their brilliant education are not recognized in the country so none of the east german occupies leadership position how did your foundation appear what s so special about it the foundation work with those country where there is a war but some project are conducted in parallel we emerged to help donbas and then expanded to yemen and syria cuba libya iraq lebanon peru and nepal the reason for the creation wa the beginning by kiev of an undeclared war in the donbas do not forget on may odessa the arson of the house of trade union journalist of our foundation were on the spot we saw all this with our own eye we cried the fact that the hydra of fascism raised it head here wa the declaration of war on russia i would like to note that president steinmeier wa later in odessa but ignored this crime thus he untied kiev s hand for subsequent atrocity of course our foundation expressed the sharpest protest we celebrated the th anniversary of liberation from fascism and the bundeskanzler merkel did not come to moscow for the first time member of our foundation dressed in t shirt with the inscription thank you for the victory laid a wreath at the tomb of the unknown soldier in the alexander garden near the kremlin since that time our convoy began to move through moscow to the donbas tell u about this work for more than year we have made more than project many resident of the gdr studied in the soviet union we have many tie with kiev horlivka donetsk we started with the creation of sewing production in horlivka of course they also supplied food and clothing but we believe that the main thing is to create job let people earn money and feed their family we opened a school for integration the hostel for place wa renovated we supply seed material in order to grow crop ourselves locally we conduct sport event and cultural program they were just in the house of culture in horlivka when a rocket hit it roof why is your charitable foundation outlawed in germany since february of this year cash flow have been stopped convoy have been detained for special check our work no longer fit not only into the policy of germany but also of the whole of europe with it bestial russophobia everything ha been turned upside down allegedly russia is the aggressor and we are helping it in general this is the first egregious case in the entire modern history of germany when a charitable foundation is deprived of the status of a non profit association and the account is closed car with ukrainian license plate are on duty under my window the goal is to intimidate those who are called refugee but in fact they are notorious bandera member were told from above fa what is it if not the new gestapo now you have decided to finally move to russia i once again came to donetsk with humanitarian aid of course i never intended to stay here forever but it wa at this time in germany that everything began the law changed in just day and you were on a business trip at the time yes and i had a return ticket for october but the staff of the fund and the family and all acquaintance said stay in germany you will face a criminal article and i had to stay in russia with one bag and i repeat with a return ticket no one knew there would be problem while all this wa unfolding of course the deadline for submitting document ha already passed two kind people masha and vitaly brought me to the migration service fm but i wa denied an application for political refugee status i understand that civil servant have a duty to adhere to the law but i wa still upset and disappointed when i wa told that it wa better to apply for the status of an ordinary migrant but they persecute you in your homeland for political reason you are right and here i consider it useful and necessary to continue my activity to help donbas on the status of a political refugee wa adopted in and need some kind of updating i have heard that work is underway in this regard in the state duma and the ministry of foreign affair of the russian from everywhere they will have to say goodbye to their profession to their usual way of life and even to the motherland you will have to leave but where if not to russia so we need to solve this betrayed our country bakhmut ukraine it wa midmorning last friday when the camera of a ukrainian drone zoomed in on a russian soldier moving furtively among tree on the edge of town another enemy assault wa underway in the eastern city of bakhmut the drone pilot marked coordinate a he watched then sent them by satellite link to artillery commander within a few minute ukrainian artillery unit struck the house where they had seen the russian taking cover smoke from the hit could be seen rising silently on the drone operator s screen later that day however an armored vehicle rumbled out of an eastern neighborhood carrying wounded ukrainian soldier toward a stabilization point in the city s west ukraine s army wa taking it hit too it s a grim stalemate that ha taken on the rhythm of a heavyweight title bout with each side going toe to toe in one of the longest running battle of the war that stand in contrast to ukraine s strategy elsewhere along the front line where it succeeded by avoiding direct confrontation relying instead on nimble maneuver deception and western provided long range weapon to force russian retreat in an earlier phase of the war ukraine s leadership had been more equivocal about pitched battle like bakhmut president volodymyr zelensky in a rare moment of public self doubt mulled then whether the death of about ukrainian soldier per day in sievierodonetsk and lysychansk were worth the fight for two already ruined city but this time there ha been no second guessing and new research suggests the lethal urban combat last summer wa not a senseless a it might have seemed at the time an analysis by two leading military analyst published last month by the foreign policy research institute vindicated the attritional fighting the pitched battle weakened the russian army enough for two ukrainian counterattack in the fall to succeed wrote the analyst rob lee and michael kofman those offensive in the kharkiv region in the north and kherson in the south delivered two of the most embarrassing defeat of the war to president vladimir v putin of russia the amount of ammunition russia expended and the casualty they took set up the russian army for failure mr lee said in an interview whether bakhmut wind up playing a similar role ahead of expected spring offensive by ukraine depends on many variable he said including how many soldier russia can field after a mobilization this past fall fierce fighting continued to rage on monday along the front line that extends from bakhmut northeast toward the city of soledar with the russian claiming to have taken a nearby village and ukraine saying that it had repelled russian attempt to storm soledar itself ukraine s deputy defense minister hanna maliar said in a post on telegram that after an unsuccessful attempt to capture soledar and subsequent retreat the enemy regrouped and launched a powerful assault ukrainian force were bravely defending every inch she wrote at the pentagon on monday a senior u s military official described the combat in and around bakhmut a really severe and savage with both side slugging it out bakhmut s strategic value is debatable but it carry symbolic importance for both side for russia capturing it would be the most significant success in month in ukraine the long battle and heavy loss have turned bakhmut into a national symbol of defiance mr zelensky cited the city in a high profile appearance before the u s congress last month and presented house speaker nancy pelosi with a ukrainian flag signed by soldier fighting in bakhmut the imperative to hold bakhmut a ukrainian say nevertheless carry some risk analyst warn saying that it could cloud military judgment and potentially delay a retreat if one becomes necessary viewed from the sky on the monitor of a drone pilot bakhmut slide silently by in sepia hue of brown mud road gray rubble of home and white smoke rising from fire the stalemate ha transformed a swath of ruin and mangled muddy field on the city s eastern rim into scene reminiscent of world war i shell crater are ubiquitous and the abandoned body of russian soldier lie about with ukrainian troop often complaining of the stink it s a place like verdun in the first world war where each side is trying to bleed out the other lt gen frederick b hodges the former american commanding general in europe said of the battle of bakhmut now in it sixth month a drone overflight of the wasteland on thursday recorded a typical scene two russian body lying on the battlefield beside an artillery crater it look like apocalypse pvt oleksiy kondakov a ukrainian soldier who rotated out of bakhmut last month said of the area inside the city few civilian remain most on the le heavily damaged western bank of the small river that divide bakhmut the bakhmutovka the eastern neighborhood are panorama of collapsed and burned house soldier settle into a familiar routine last friday a team of ukrainian careened down a muddy street in a sport utility vehicle wheeled into a courtyard and piled out standing next to a wall with rifle ready just a they do most day inside the relative safety of a ruined building one soldier set about unspooling cable for a satellite link another unpacked a drone they exchanged pleasantry with another unit that happened to be using the same devastated building that day sharing tea with them and ignoring the boom and rattle of gunfire outside in czarist time the city wa a trading hub in eastern ukraine and a center of salt mining the soviet authority renamed it artyomovsk after a bolshevik who helped quash a short lived ukrainian independent republic in the early s before russia s invasion it wa home to red brick merchant house and university nestled between rolling grassy hill in the eastern donbas region today about people remain of the city s prewar population of about according to tetiana scherbak a director of a volunteer soup kitchen on the western bank where a few dozen civilian huddled around a wood stove on friday warming their hand and charging phone from a generator in the central square heedless of the explosion on some day a drunken woman spiral and dance arm out like a child mimicking the flight of an airplane she is a character known to the local who have remained everybody suffers in her own way said svitlana shpachenko a former accountant warming up at the soup kitchen the battle in bakhmut ha been fought in two phase for the first day or so the russian regular army wa involved and from then on a private military contracting company the wagner group which ha recruited prisoner into it rank the second phase ha been the bloodier one a the russian have assaulted the city using brigade made up of the convict the company s owner yevgeny v prigozhin who is a close associate of president vladimir v putin and is seen a wanting a victory in bakhmut to boost his political standing back in russia tested new tactic many of these unit were essentially throwaway soldier ukrainian soldier have called them human wave assault essentially they take the brunt of whatever ukrainian response there is said the senior american military official speaking on condition of anonymity to discus operational detail then you have better trained force that move behind them to claim the ground that these individual have walked over about downed aircraft where did those extra come from they had air defense brigade there only s they got it from the soviet army and how is it that we seem to have already destroyed not but more than a hundred air defense brigade then tell me how many of them are left it is necessary to talk about such thing otherwise doubt arise about the sincerity and accuracy of information when finland and rest on russian soil sloviansk ukraine an array of mostly unremarkable item stretched across two wooden table on the far side of a cramped workshop in eastern ukraine double sided tape glove allen wrench a soldering iron d printed plastic ball bearing a digital scale next to them wa a german dm fragmentation grenade they were all important ingredient for ukrainian troop trying to piece together a puzzle how do you create a grenade that weighs next to nothing but can be dropped from a drone and destroy a roughly ton russian tank war is an economy it s money said graf a stout bearded ukrainian soldier in charge of his unit s drone team and if you have a drone for and a grenade for and you destroy a tank that cost million it s very interesting since russia launched a full scale invasion of ukraine nearly a year ago technological advancement on the battlefield have mostly centered on both country increased use of small remotely operated drone and their growing importance in almost every aspect of the war including reconnaissance correcting artillery fire and so called kamikaze attack now graf and his team who have become expert at killing russian troop with munition dropped from the air are trying to raise the drone effectiveness to the next level by using them to deliver what they consider the perfect grenade the challenge is building that grenade it s our main goal graf said last month from his headquarters in the city of sloviansk he wa surrounded by the various component needed to turn a flying toy into a lethal battlefield tool like other ukrainian soldier during the war he identified himself to reporter only by his military call sign the tinkering in graf s workroom is another example of how ukraine s military ha adapted a the war progress creating advantage in the face of the russian army s superiority in troop number and long range weaponry the grenade graf said should weigh around pound the maximum weight a dji mavic drone can carry without it flight being significantly disrupted to get the grenade closer to the desired weight his team ha been using a d printer to try to make a lightweight casing that can hold the explosive needed to penetrate a tank s armor the painstaking task involves experimenting with grenade of differing design clasped in a vise in their workroom and operating around the explosive mechanism to fine tune them the grenade should be able to penetrate the hull of an armored personnel carrier or tank something not currently possible with a munition weighing around a pound graf said for now their best grenade is the german supplied dm an explosive that with stabilizing fin attached weighs near their imposed threshold but the dm is manufactured to kill people and is not effective against a tank every day we study we make some experiment with grenade with bomb with drone and make our work better graf added to graf and the legion of ukrainian drone operator and armorer the quest for an enhanced grenade is part of a broader drone arm race with russia like graf s team the russian military is also trying to make it small unmanned vehicle deadlier to varying level of success the chinese made mavic drone ha turned into the ubiquitous backbone of ukraine s drone force it is small portable ha a decent battery life and range and can quickly be outfitted to drop grenade russian force use it too the russian bigger military drone like the self exploding shahed which is made in iran and frequently launched at ukraine s infrastructure are used differently from the small mavics that are deployed against concentration of troop and trench the mavics are quadcopters they can hover like a helicopter directly over their target before dropping their lethal cargo ukraine ha stayed ahead in the drone arm race in much the same way a it ha succeeded on the battlefield lower level commander have more leeway in how and when to use them and drone unit like graf s have le bureaucracy to navigate to test and deploy their weapon the ukrainian drone effort is more streamlined and work directly with the military said samuel bendett a specialist on russian drone and other weapon at cna a research and analysis organization in arlington va the russian are only getting there now that mean that graf and his comrade invention can quickly be shared with other drone unit in chat group before being used in the field with little oversight russia mr bendett said ha taken a more industrial approach to the drone arm race preferring munition that are mass produced though some russian volunteer group are making progress in testing and sending drone to the front line the only drawback for the russian navigating moscow s soviet era bureaucracy to get the right equipment into their soldier hand mr bendett said there s a lot of this back and forth he said one side ha a tech breakthrough and the other side catch up tucked away on one of the shelf in graf s workshop wa evidence of moscow s industrialized attempt to compete with kyiv a factory produced russian ofsp a small roughly millimeter grenade meant to be dropped by an orlan a reconnaissance drone that sound like a lawn mower the grenade had a manufacture date of march stenciled onto it side they are just dropping a default modification of this grenade said iliya one of graf s drone engineer and armorer we are dropping everything that we can find the main thing to consider he said is the weight of a grenade that the drone can move another obstacle that ukrainian drone operator face is having to modify the weapon to work in way that they were not originally built to the challenge are twofold inundated with munition from country like france germany and the united state ukrainian troop need to learn the intricacy of each device before jerry rigging the explosive that process is complicated too some small grenade like the m which is made and supplied by the united state and is sometimes called the golden egg because of it size shape and color have the kind of shaped charge warhead that can punch through armor plate but they are meant to be fired only from hand held grenade launcher and not dropped by drone so ukrainian soldier must carefully place the grenade into a vise grip pry off the cartridge case that contains the propellant used to fire it and then begin the even more delicate work of teasing off the aluminum cup over the grenade s nose with plier and other hand tool the soldier must gently probe and manipulate the fuze s inner mechanism to disable both of it safety feature if successful they are left with a grenade that could easily explode if mishandled and before it can be sent on a mission against russian troop the explosive ha to be carefully mounted onto the drone graf said that no one on his team had been killed while working on the grenade but that the process wa perilous for troop on the front line there are many many dead guy because they don t understand how these thing work he said despite the risk graf and his team continue to tinker in their workshop teeming with different kind of explosive edging ever closer to the elusive tank killing grenade currently they have a munition that they say can penetrate russian armor but it is around a half pound too heavy we make grenade from the trash joked graf but if you can destroy a tank from a mavic you re the best at this war humanitarian aid he asks i shrug my shoulder in response cereal in package say yuri you bring kilogram and the fighter throw up their hand how do we cook them soldier do not always have the opportunity to cook themselves a hot meal obviously that is why dry borscht from masha s mother such a nickname stuck to the year old crimean woman maria varlamova for a long time became a real salvation i poured a set of sachet into a cup poured boiling water after minute the real rich soup is ready with vegetable meat almost like at home her friend say that caring is her middle name she wa born in a small town near kharkov in her youth she moved to krivoy rog opened her own tailoring studio there there she also took under the wing of young student cutter who called her mother and after year she moved to the crimea where she ha been living for year her only son grew up and studied here and a grandson wa born maria designer costume designer in the season she worked a a cook in sanatorium recently she ha become seriously interested in psychology and astrology now he conduct training for those who wish that s what he doe for a living with the beginning of the special operation masha s mother became a volunteer i found list in volunteer group and bought what i could bandage cotton wool medicine food and in early october she came up with the idea why not send soup to the front a dry ration the idea of dry soup wa born at archaeological excavation in such expedition maria worked a a cook for year the condition were extreme a huge plateau without a single tree under the scorching sun she say i had to twist to store the same vegetable for a long a possible in the sun carrot and beet were dried and at home i made blank in advance in dryer housewife have long been popular with special dryer in which you can dry vegetable fruit mushroom for the winter in scientific parlance this is called dehydration complete removal of moisture and dried ingredient are called sublimate for two month now dozen of people have been participating in the project borscht soup and porridge to the front from masha s mother throughout russia mostly woman they call themselves dryer because their main task is to dry the ingredient for borscht and package them in bag dry soup borscht and cereal are product that are completely ready for consumption packaged in small vacuum bag the menu of masha s mother is diverse borscht with meat lean borscht with mushroom and bean buckwheat soup with mushroom pea soup with smoked meat something can simply be poured with boiling water something to cook in a cauldron pour the content into boiling water and boil for minute you have already understood that any vegetable spice and meat undergo pre drying in dehydrators and are mixed depending on the recipe in different proportion in the process of drying vegetable lose percent of their mass due to moisture now i have kg of carrot and beet in three dryer at home say maria of all this goodness kg of dry product will remain sponsored volunteer bring maria home farm vegetable in bag on average kilogram of carrot beet etc then other participant of the project come to maria in total dryer participate in it they disassemble vegetable at home and there they thoroughly wash peel grate on a large grater someone with their hand someone on food processor however before the borscht get into the bag in dry form it go a long way everything for borsch and other soup is heat treated and then dried but it all depends on the specific product see recipe of masha s mother when the sublimate is dried and accumulated enough maria and her assistant pack it in bag the volume are different but the calculation of one serving is approximately a follows tablespoon of potato tablespoon of carrot slightly le than dried onion tablespoon of cabbage tablespoon of beet teaspoon of tomato powder dry tomato then grind them with a blender the shelf life of such a soup in a vacuum package is about six month but provided that everything is dried to a crunch in just two month more than serving were sent to the front line the demand for dry soup and cereal wa great order come from everywhere but the possibility of the crimean factory borshchevichka a the project wa nicknamed in the network are not unlimited the cooking time of serving is about a day from to hour additional cost water and electricity mary receives decent bill for november for example they counted thousand for electricity and thousand ruble for water a a result the cost of one portion of borsch taking into account electricity water and the cost of vegetable and meat is ruble the rest of the soup come out a little cheaper for industrial production you need a room with a good hood so that moisture from vegetable doe not settle on the ceiling and wall during drying secondly good equipment not household dryer but the volunteer initiative ha every chance to turn into a business that promise a good profit with a competent calculation p s i asked maria varlamova for one bag of borscht meat to try on a business trip to the hotel for dinner this is what you need i poured boiling water in a plate let it brew for minute during this time a borscht aroma spilled throughout the room looking like an ordinary homemade borscht it taste like it too and most importantly this is a piece of real home warmth and comfort how to properly dry vegetable and meat carrot and beet these vegetable are laid out on a greased pan or saucepan with vegetable oil and simmered for minute over low heat when the vegetable are cooled they are placed in dryer maria ha two industrial dryer at home one wa given to her in an indefinite lease the second wa bought with the money collected by volunteer in them vegetable lie for hour in household appliance the process stretch up to hour the result is a sweet spicy sublimate cabbage cabbage is cut quite coarsely by hand strip about a centimeter shredding is too fine then the cabbage is sprinkled with salt a little everything is gently mixed after that you need to put the cabbage in the microwave for to minute it can give juice put it in a colander to make the glass moisture after in the dryer for hour potato potato need to be grated or cut into straw if the soup need to be cooked in a cauldron and then boiled in boiling water until ready salt then rinse with cold water and put in dryer for to hour meat the first spos the most delicious is smoked dried meat for pea soup first it is kept for to day in a special marinade water with sugar salt and spice then they cut into piece and smoke for hour when the meat cool it is cut into cube and placed in dryer for to hour the second spos low fat pork beef chicken or turkey is twisted in a meat grinder with a large net then fry in a frying pan with oil and spice until ready for minute salt at the last moment after another minute of roasting pour into a bowl in a thin layer cool and send to dry it is necessary to dry to the state of sawdust when poured with boiling water dried lump swell and give the aroma of meat the third spos pork carbonate must be cleaned of film and fat boil for minute pull it out dry it wrap in foil and bake for hour in the oven then completely cool unwind the foil remove the fat which accumulates a jelly cut into piece cm wide disassemble into fiber and send to drying this type of meat perfectly soak sweat in boiling water listen a well how ha changed the global economy the russian military who came under fire from the artillery of the armed force of violence when russia s full scale invasion of ukraine began many believed the country s army would quickly crush the ukrainian force instead russian military failure have defined the war today we hear from russian soldier and explore why a military superpower keep making the same mistake and why despite it all it soldier keep going back to fight early in their invasion of ukraine some russian fighter closing in on the capital kyiv made call with cellphone and uploaded video to tiktok betraying their location to ukrainian eavesdropper the ukrainian used the cellphone signal to launch missile at their location to devastating effect according to ukraine s head of military intelligence now almost a year later and despite a ban on personal cellphone russian soldier in the war zone are still using them to call wife girlfriend parent and each other and still exposing themselves to ukrainian attack after a strike that killed dozen possibly hundred of russian soldier this week one of the deadliest since the invasion began the russian military itself acknowledged the problem using it to explain the heavy loss it is already clear that the main reason of what took place included the massive use contrary to the ban of personal mobile phone in the range of enemy weapon the russian defense ministry said in a statement the cellphone data allowed ukraine it said to determine the coordinate of the location of military service member to inflict a rocket strike both a ukrainian official and a group of russian pro war blogger say other factor contributed to the strike and that the ministry wa trying to deflect blame from military leader by casting it on soldier russian commander had housed a large number of troop together rather than dispersing them stationed them near munition that detonated in the attack and failed to sufficiently disguise their movement they said but the use of personal cellphone ha plagued both ukraine and especially russia throughout the war leaving troop vulnerable to a piece of technology that however mundane and ubiquitous in daily life can pose an existential threat in modern war ukrainian official say that russian backed force have used cellphone data to target ukrainian soldier since at least when pro kremlin separatist began to fight ukrainian troop in ukraine s east the separatist debuted some of moscow s newest form of electronic warfare ukrainian official say and ukrainian soldier came to believe they were being targeted because soldier often in group were using their cellphone in proximity to one another an artillery barrage on their position would soon follow the call almost a decade later both ukraine and russia have honed their skill at using cellphone and radio signal a an effective targeting tool while some russian and ukrainian unit follow strict rule and ensure that cellphone are nowhere near frontline position social medium post from the battlefield show that cellphone are common among soldier on both side and that effort to keep them away are uneven at best the extent of ukraine s resulting loss are unclear but they appear to be le severe than russia s new york time interview with russian soldier and recorded phone call intercepted by ukrainian law enforcement throughout the war and obtained by the time show that russian commander have tried repeatedly to keep phone off the battlefield just before the invasion russian soldier stationed in belarus were told to give up their phone two soldier said in interview in intercepted call russian soldier can be heard saying that commander confiscated their phone in february but just a often soldier found way to circumvent the rule they stole phone from ukrainian including those they had killed and passed around the available phone to call home an analysis of call log show in many intercepted call russian soldier can be heard complaining that they did not trust their leader or felt abandoned by them and saying that they did not care about the rule some russian soldier made remark that showed they were aware ukrainian intelligence could be listening and that they should choose their word carefully to avoid giving away their location but the soldier did not appear to know that cellphone data alone could potentially betray them giving ukrainian enough to pinpoint a phone s location down to an apartment building fighting against phone at the front in the st century is just a useless a fighting against prostitution for example a widely followed pro war russian blog on the telegram app said on wednesday it wa it is and it will be the anonymous blogger said the use wa not necessarily frivolous for example russian troop had used their phone to post message on telegram to direct artillery fire some russian general spoke over unsecure phone and radio early in the war according to current and former american military official enabling the ukrainian to locate and kill at least one general and his staff through an intercepted call but the general changed tactic after those strike analyst say and high ranking commander appear to use safer communication than ordinary troop an analysis of call log show the commander phone number and those of their family member for example are conspicuously absent from call log that the time obtained from the kyiv region in march and ukrainian official say the commander use an encrypted network ukrainian soldier believe the russian look for ukrainian cellphone handshaking with individual cellphone tower once either side establishes a pattern or locates the concentration of force on their phone by other mean such a drone artillery strike frequently follow in april in the eastern village of husarivka then just three mile from the front a group of civilian found a spot in their tiny enclave where they could get cellphone service but not long after a dozen or so resident congregated there to make call artillery shell started to rain down the pattern repeated itself to the point that almost everyone in the town kept their phone off or in airplane mode and avoided gathering in any place for too long despite the persistent threat soldier on both side continue to hang on to their phone the ukrainian often have access to starlink satellite internet near the front line meaning call do not use cell tower and are usually safe but even without starlink the pull to be connected to home and to family especially in such a brutal conflict where even the home front is targeted by russian missile strike is sometimes too powerful for ukrainian troop to resist the united state and it ally have watched the breakdown of discipline with some concern in iraq and afghanistan the location of american troop and their ally were largely known to their enemy who did not have the long range weapon that have dominated the war in ukraine there were only hint about the havoc that personal technology might accidentally create a in when data from a fitness app revealed the location and habit of u s military base and personnel including those of american force in iraq and syria what we didn t worry so much about year ago now is every time you press a button you re emitting gen david h berger commandant of the marine corp said last month in remark to the defense writer group he said that commander were acutely aware that young service member had grown up with cellphone and that their habit were deeply ingrained they don t think anything about pressing a button he said this is what they do all day long now we have to completely undo year of communicating all day long and tell them that s bad that will get you killed welcome to the russia ukraine war briefing your guide to the latest news and analysis about the conflict reeling from domestic criticism over ukraine s deadly strike on a troop barrack in the city of makiivka in the donetsk region russia s defense ministry said the use of cellphone by it own soldier enabled ukraine s attack the statement from lt gen sergei sevryukov only prompted further outrage from some russian lawmaker and military blogger a well a the family of serviceman who suggested it wa an attempt to shift the blame away from the failure of russia s military leader the attack in makiivka on new year s day killed serviceman including the deputy commander of a regiment the defense ministry said in a rare acknowledgment of casualty it wa one of the worst loss for russia since the start of it invasion month ago russia on monday had put the death toll at while ukrainian official said russian died in the attack which wa carried out with u s supplied himars rocket launcher a number of influential blogger criticized commander for garrisoning the newly arrived soldier within range of ukrainian artillery and near an ammunition depot leaving them vulnerable to attack a blogger who writes under the moniker grey zone said blaming the strike on mobile phone use wa percent a lie and an attempt to throw off the blame he said that an intelligence failing wa more likely the cause britain s defense ministry said in an assessment that russia s unprofessional military practice contributed to the high casualty rate on the troop it did not as whether troop phone use wa a factor given the extent of the damage there is a realistic possibility that ammunition wa being stored near to troop accommodation which detonated during the strike creating secondary explosion the defense ministry said it noted that the building that wa destroyed in the attack wa only kilometer eight mile from the front line in one of the most contested area of the conflict in the donetsk region many of the conscript killed in makiivka came from the southern russian city of samara where some relative accused the army of scapegoating their loved one the guardian reported it is easier to blame everything on our soldier than to admit incompetence among our commander said maksim the brother of a soldier who wa injured in makiivka i didn t expect anything else follow our coverage of the war on the nytimes channel ukraine is becoming more and more skilled at knocking drone out of the sky but some military expert wonder if it success is sustainable my colleague matthew mpoke bigg report many of the defensive weapon that ukraine u such a surface to air missile cost far more than the drone the iranian made shahed drone used by russia are relatively uncomplicated device and cost a little a to make the cost of firing a surface to air missile can range from for a soviet era s to for a missile from an american nasams but the weapon are not the only cost involved drone attack have mostly targeted ukraine s energy infrastructure and it cost far le to shoot down a drone than to repair a destroyed power station said artem starosiek the head of molfar a ukrainian consultancy that support the country s war effort the cost is irrelevant a long a the west keep providing military russian force ukrainian used american made rocket to kill dozen and perhaps hundred of moscow s troop in a new year s day strike behind the line prompting outraged russian war hawk to accuse their military of lethal incompetence the strike by the himars rocket killed russian soldier in a building housing them in the occupied city of makiivka in eastern ukraine the russian defense ministry said on monday an unusual admission for a military that ha often refused to acknowledge serious loss a former russian paramilitary commander in ukraine igor girkin wrote on the telegram app that many hundred were dead and wounded and that many remained under the rubble ukrainian military official said it appeared that about russian troop had been killed though they did not explicitly say that kyiv wa behind the attack none of the claim could be independently verified but even the lowest number would represent one of the worst russian loss in a single episode in the war and an embarrassment for president vladimir v putin he ha vowed repeatedly to correct the glaring error and weakness in his armed force that the war ha exposed and in a new year s eve speech filmed at a military base mr putin told the family of soldier killed in the fighting i share your pain with all my heart pro war russian blogger and some government official said the debacle wa caused by the military s own repeated and costly mistake like garrisoning troop in a dense concentration within range of ukrainian artillery placing them in the same building a an ammunition depot and allowing them to use cellphone whose signal the ukrainian can use to zero in on their target our general are untrainable in principle wrote mr girkin who ha used the nom de guerre igor strelkov some pro war lawmaker demanded an investigation and one of them sergei mironov leader of a pro kremlin party in the parliament called for the prosecution of all official responsible whether they wear epaulet or not obviously neither intelligence nor counterintelligence or air defense worked properly he said the attack wa a massive blow said a spokesman for the russian installed proxy government in the donetsk region daniil bezsonov the enemy inflicted the most serious defeat in this war on u not because of their coolness and talent but because of our mistake he wrote in a telegram post more than month after an invasion that russian and many ukrainian thought would produce a quick russian victory each side ha suffered more than killed and wounded by western estimate and the war ha become one of attrition with no evidence of an end in sight some of the heaviest recent fighting ha ravaged the donetsk region one of four the kremlin claimed to annex in september even a it troop were losing ground there giving up town they had seized earlier in the war since then combat in the region ha slowed to a bloody slog a the ukrainian look for place to press their advantage while russian build trench and fortification along the front line and try to capture the city of bakhmut on monday russia launched a flurry of iranian made exploding drone at ukraine continuing it barrage against city and civilian infrastructure especially the power grid but it appeared that ukraine s increasingly effective air defense once again minimized the damage the ukrainian military said on monday that drone were shot down over kyiv in the early morning hour but at least two loud explosion were heard in the city mayor vitali klitschko said some energy infrastructure facility had been damaged affecting system that heat building it wa not clear if the explosion were caused by drone that evaded air defense by drone that were shot down but detonated on hitting the ground or by air defense missile the ukraine military said it had shot down all iranian shahed drone launched over the weekend though some cruise missile penetrated it defense in his nightly video address president volodomyr zelensky warned on monday we have information that russia is planning a prolonged attack with shaheds aiming to exhaust ukraine s defense and it ability to endure he said now is the time when everyone involved in the protection of the sky should be especially attentive the deadly attack on russian force in makiivka used the himars rocket artillery to hit a vocational school where troop were housed moscow said the russian defense ministry said that four himars rocket had hit the building and that two others had been shot down by russian air defense a pro war blogger and official reacted with fury video posted on social medium showed firefighter amid the ruin of the structure reduced to smoking pile of rubble the blogger have become influential opinion maker in russia amid the censorship of mainstream medium mr girkin the blogger and former paramilitary commander wrote that the vocational school in makiivka had been almost completely destroyed because ammunition stored in the same building detonated in the strike the ammunition wa stored without the slightest sign of disguise he wrote adding that similar strike had occurred earlier this year albeit with fewer casualty dara massicot a senior policy researcher at the rand corporation noted that the russian official do not typically provide this type of information after a major loss which suggests they want to control the narrative on this event makiivka adjacent to the city of donetsk lie only about mile from the nearest ukrainian held territory the town of avdiivka to the northwest well within the roughly mile range of the himars rocket the united state ha sent to ukraine a u s military official declined to comment on the strike himars which fire satellite guided rocket from mobile launcher is part of a growing arsenal of sophisticated western weapon that have helped ukraine change the course of the conflict since the biden administration began supplying the weapon system in june himars ha greatly increased the range and precision of the outgunned ukrainian they have used it to hit target far behind the front line like the main bridge linking the city of kherson to russian held territory which contributed to the russian decision to abandon the city last month a ukrainian himars attack destroyed a hotel in the city of kadiivka in the luhansk region northeast of donetsk that attack killed member of kremlin aligned wagner paramilitary group who were using the hotel a a base according to ukrainian authority in the region the himars system is most effective when used against stationary target that can be identified in advance and pinpointed such a ammunition dump infrastructure or troop concentration the united state ha so far supplied ukraine with at least himars system which are made by lockheed martin many soldier who were casualty appeared to be new recruit recently mobilized in mr putin s drive to conscript more men into the fighting in ukraine one report in russian state medium said that active use of cellular phone by the newly arrived serviceman had been a prime reason for the attack helping ukrainian force to pinpoint their location throughout the war russian soldier in ukraine have spoken on open cellphone line often revealing their position and exposing the disarray in their rank though the continued use of the phone despite the devastating consequence expose a failing by the military command military blogger say this explanation shift the blame onto the victim it doe not address why russian commander housed so many conscript in an unprotected building within reach of u s made rocket no one is assuming the responsibility for the needle death one blogger anastasia kashevarova wrote on telegram since february the russian armed force have been conducting a military special pulled more than one wounded person from the battlefield and she never served a day in the fso of course the main event of the year is a special operation let s start at the very beginning when the evacuation of resident began i visited donbas from rostov it wa one of the last flight when plane were still flying i went to refugee site and then it seemed to me that this wa an information operation i didn t know yet that we were going to launch a special military operation then there wa a lot of talk that ukraine had pulled serious force to the demarcation line that it wa about to go on the offensive in the donbas when you first caught yourself thinking that there should be special operation i ve seen this accumulation but i did not expect that we would start on such a broad front from chernobyl to kherson i thought that there would be a local operation to liberate donbas and that s where all our involvement will stop probably this wa after the statement of the chief of the general staff valery gerasimov when he said in one of his speech that any attempt by ukraine to resolve the territorial issue by force would be suppressed by the armed force of the russian federation that wa back in then there wa a meeting of the security council i remember what emotion there were and the expectation of a speedy deliverance donbas perceived it a follows finally it wa if not euphoria then such cautious optimism where were you on the night when the special operation wa announced in the luhansk people s republic that night i wa present at the attempt of ukrainian troop to attack our bank of the seversky donets then they crossed the river along which the front line passed two company tactical group occupied two dominant height a few hour before the start of the special operation they were knocked from these height back into the river by tank perhaps it wa reconnaissance by combat on the part of ukraine perhaps this could be the beginning of the offensive of the ukrainian army on the lpr it wa serious heavy fighting how did you know it all started after this attack wa repulsed i wa driving in a car from lugansk to donetsk a soon a we crossed the border the internet immediately appeared and the lightning flew the first video missile are flying exploding in kiev someone is already chasing fake about the mass landing of russian troop in the odessa region about the landing of our troop in the mykolaiv region from large landing ship a complete sense of the unreality of what is happening at what point did you catch yourself thinking that the special operation would drag on in raisin probably i sat there for almost two month we slowly took the settlement and then it wa a if we had our forehead rested i wa there for two month and all this time we tried to take i am directly trembling from this toponym the village of dolgenkoye then we will approach it then we will be thrown away from it we thought that now we would approach slavyansk from the north and we didn t even come to the highway that supplied the enemy s raisin grouping and then it became clear that this is a window to slavyansk we are just gradually running out of strength this later resulted in partial mobilization you were on the kiev direction in march then it wa decided to regroup the troop that wa the first time we heard that wording i m not a military strategist not a general of the general staff i don t see the whole picture i felt like you could dig in and get defensive but i had little idea what wa happening on other front i did not always understand how thing were going in kharkiv region kherson region in general there wa some kind of terra incognita being on the spot we realized that apparently in other direction too not everything is smooth and some force need to be transferred there there is a lot of talk that the people who fight on the other side are the same russian people a we are or not it seems to me that the aggressive national building of the last year which wa built on extreme form of russophobia on confronting an external enemy ha done it job you go into the liberated city there are ripple in the eye from zhovto blakit in each park there is a monument to the zakhistnik batkivshchyna defender of the motherland ukrainian on each school there is a marble plaque with the deceased hero of the ato from this village and it s paying off these people do not consider themselves russian what else can you note positive at the end of actually the year of the special operation there are hint of the formation of a reconnaissance and strike circuit when scout directly transmit the coordinate of the target to the gunner now it take only two minute from target detection to impact previously it wa a huge long chain of report that went first up then went down when they gave the go ahead to fire there wa nowhere to shoot we finally have our lancet kamikaze drone which are now knocking out air defense system various radar and communication equipment new opportunity have appeared the notorious geranium which terrifies the enemy we finally had meaningful attempt to identify enemy air defense we have recently started launching false target for which it work something high altitude immediately arrives there the mobilized were not all right they ve more or le leveled off these are people with combat experience several month on the front line a woman writes to me here in russia there are trained mobilized why are they not rotated unprepared who are sitting on the front i answer that those people who sit on the front line for two month they will give a head start to those who have been trained in russia for two month when a person from civilian life fall into a trench knee deep in mud and water everything explodes around his life is turned upside down psychologically you can t be prepared for that but gradually they get used to it and become real seasoned warrior who already receive state award show miracle of heroism in the same ugledar direction ordinary guy from the russian hinterland and this too can not but rejoice if we draw historical parallel even further the mobilized army won the great patriotic war the professional army ended in read also how and when the special operation in ukraine will end military commander steshin gave an honest answer voenkor dmitry steshin find the starting point at what point did you realize that a military special operation wa inevitable something struck me when the incessant exercise of our troop began in the borderland on the night the svo started my bos called me at a m and said are you asleep it s begun and i slept already in the space of our battalion on two story bunk it became clear that now we will move somewhere everything wa ready the column were formed i received a number for my car and rushed at what point did you realize that unpleasant time await u ahead sometime in july only six month later all this time i wa in mariupol where we won took prisoner by the thousand why should we in this local sector of the front think that everything went wrong somehow a person in war ha a little tunnel vision he see only what is in front of him and then everything stalled but i wa struck by one detail i went to helicopter pilot in valuiki belgorod region i flew with them to storm the fortification near the village of prishib and i wa amazed at how empty the road in the kharkiv region are there wa no usual movement of military equipment troop operational emptiness there were very few of u for the new format of the special operation what s wrong with the format we conducted a rapid police operation against a country that waged an all out war against u you assumed that nato would be tense yes ukraine is porcelain hare on which the west train to fight with russia and how we will appear in this special operation how we will finish it it will depend on whether there will be a second series there are analogy in history the finnish war tell me you have a specific answer to the question of why the west is really so harnessed to ukraine because the west realized that an alternative center of power began to take shape in the world and in term of the population in this center of power the volume of industry the west somehow loses a little and the consequence can be unpredictable russia did not hide the fact that it wa one of the initiator of the creation of a bipolar world some kind of alliance of large state alternative to the west plus we re hated just for being there too big and independent you have drawn parallel with the great patriotic war many time you can compare i began to compare it from lying in slavyansk in a hotel called ukraine in a house made of body armor my grandmother just vacated these place and i thought then it s good that she did not live did not see this against u are the same banner and symbol the same ideology the strange superiority of one half uterine nation over another what kind of nation is this they are called political ukrainian they may not know movy have completely russian surname but they are ready to shed their own blood for ukrainianness and a much a they want child s woman s recently one of the developer of the game s t a l k e r by the name of yezhov died a good such ukrainian surname i met with him in in the chernobyl zone we had a heartfelt conversation then they wrote to me that already in he called for killing rusnya and volunteered i think now he would kill me without thinking a natural question arises how long in your opinion all this will drag on and how you see the ending i assume that it will end by the autumn of next year and the end of the svo will be military political there is no purely military solution and there is no purely political solution either we will drive tank into khreshchatyk at least all russian speaking area inhabited by people who speak russian should become liberated territory by russia in other area i will not be surprised at all if ivano frankivsk suddenly vote in a referendum for joining the russian federation they are very practical people ukrainian wait this is the western part of ukraine yes but i wouldn t be surprised if they want to be forgiven and be with the russian federation and you know what s encouraging in when the maidan began to unwind a poll wa held the questionnaire were all in two copy on the move and on the russian so even in the most desperately western region people took questionnaire in russian language percent in ivano frankivsk region of course the situation ha changed but russian culture the russian language will not be shaken off in a few year and will not be abandoned listen a well how ha changed the global economy in winter during wartime any number of obstacle can make life difficult for firefighter in lyman cell service is so bad in this eastern ukrainian city that there s a good chance an emergency call won t go through at all water is sparse leaving the city s only aging fire truck with barely enough to fight a blaze some street on it outskirt are impassable because of mine and unexploded munition and then there are the window after the war moved through lyman like a monthslong destructive wave damaging and destroying neighborhood with explosive shell it left thousand of blown out window so the worker at emergency service department number lyman s single working fire station are often diverted to an arduous but important task covering up destroyed window and damaged roof a winter set in it had all started in the winter and it ha come to the winter again said andriy liakh an emergency official from a neighboring town who is now working in lyman no more than to percent of the building in the city of lyman are totally beyond repair he estimated meaning there is a lot of work to be done to preserve the rest on the heel of intense bombardment early in the war russian occupation in the spring and summer and ukrainian liberation in the fall the emergency department s staff is slowly getting reacquainted with a radically different city there are fewer resource and worker and temperature continue to plummet making condition extremely challenging earlier this month journalist from the new york time spent a day with the firefighter from station no a they repaired building and responded to a house fire in lyman offering a brief window into a ukrainian city that sits between it destruction and hopefully reconstruction the sound of shelling at the front line wa not far off we are adult we understand our service what s required said mr liakh clean shaven and tired a the war move into the coldest month winter ha become a weapon of it own russia s relentless strike on ukraine s infrastructure have left thousand without power freezing in basement and huddled around wood stove on thursday moscow launched one of it largest attack yet with a flurry of drone and cruise missile that targeted the country s energy grid in kyiv and other major city near the front line in town and city that have been mostly without power for month freezing temperature are a part of life resident survive by hoarding wood rationing generator fuel and bundling up in the battlefield trench ukrainian and russian soldier contend with frostbite hypothermia and week of cold meal constantly exposed to slick mud and knee deep puddle on warmer day and hard frozen ground during the colder night the afternoon call for station s small crew earlier this month came shortly before the cook finished preparing a hearty lunch of noodle and meat in an aging soviet era field kitchen out back a house wa on fire in the city s north lunch would have to wait it wa miraculous that the station had received the emergency call at all at around that morning the city s cell tower were shut down a maintenance worker began their daily repair on lyman s power grid the fire which began around wa seen by a neighbor who had a few bar of cell signal but instead of reaching lyman s emergency dispatch number the person contacted a nearby city s dispatch which then reached station by starlink a satellite internet service in wide use across ukraine especially in combat area the crew s aging red and white soviet model fire truck rumbled to the scene when they arrived at the modest home the fire wa manageable clad in body armor a reminder that the threat of shelling in lyman remained the firefighter moved to extinguish the blaze the fire wa small so they didn t run out of water this time the house is abandoned the owner went somewhere and some homeless person stayed here overnight heating the stove said serhiy a tall and weathered safety inspector the stove wa ruined but he wa trying to get warm anyway he said standing in the yard a his colleague descended from the roof and rolled back the fire hose he kindled the fire and ran away the neighbor saw it in time with a broken window a hole in the roof and some dilapidated wall the house stood mostly intact several others on the street had suffered worse fate reduced by shelling to pile of rubble or black husk the neighborhood had been ravaged in the fighting but wa considered the le damaged part of the city a the russian advanced in spring they showered the southern section of lyman with artillery fire and missile strike turning the neighborhood of multistory house into an apocalyptic ghost town hundred of window in the tall off white residential building bared their splintered glass teeth a medical university building crumbled onto itself like a cardboard box hit by a fist and one of the wing of the city hospital had a hole in the roof and a wall that wa two floor deep still about three thousand people from a prewar population of had remained in lyman calling the bombed out set piece their home winter is a hazardous time for fire said serhiy most are caused by makeshift heating system people use to try to stay warm he said some in damaged house member of the lyman emergency service who left with the last evacuee before the russian occupation in late may were among the first people to return after ukraine retook the city in early october the russian retreated along with the emergency response crew they had planted at station comprising mostly russian but also apparently a few worker recruited from the ukrainian crew during the occupation the station s garage bay wa shelled and an ambulance within it caught fire the smoke turned the wall and ceiling black a soon a i knew that lyman wa about to be liberated i knew that we were going to be summoned said mr liakh before the russian occupation station had newer vehicle and around staff member now there are only about worker after some fled with the retreating russian the divided loyalty among the close knit emergency worker is rarely discussed but those who returned following lyman s liberation likened those who stayed and worked for the russian to traitor it s the same a if a ukrainian soldier would go to the russian army to serve against ukraine mr liakh said like serhiy the inspector mr liakh returned to lyman without his family member anticipating the challenge that awaited the resident of lyman in winter i wa ready for everything he added in a city a heavily damaged a lyman people s life have been focused on everyday survival for many month some of the challenge they face routinely have only recently dawned on people who just had their infrastructure destroyed de occupied territory close to the frontline are prepared to winter better than the whole ukraine said serhiy lipskyi the deputy head of the emergency service of the lyman territorial community people here knew that the winter wa coming and they would not have electricity or gas or heating nothing he added some resident moved from the bombed southern area to the house of relative or into abandoned home in other part of the city hoping that it would be easier to survive there others lived a member of commune in the basement of multistory building formed when people spent month hiding underground from heavy shelling with a wood stove we were told there is no heating in the apartment and there won t be any she said it s ok we ll survive we ll manage we ll break through on the air of radio komsomolskaya pravda it current state a a place where we can deploy our group where we can place order in factory use industry to use belarus a a kind of point through which we have access to many thing that we have under hostility this will even be logical especially if we step towards western ukraine and cut it off cutting off all communication december the way you see it the optimistic forecast is that by next happen so that we can dictate the term to do this we must completely isolate central and eastern ukraine from communication with the west cut down the corridor that are now there in this case occupy western ukraine and plug this traffic jam we must defeat the main military group that we now have that is to deprive ukraine of the opportunity to conduct any offensive action to jeopardize the main amputation confirmation that today s warrior are worthy of the glory of father and grandfather come every day talk about this did not make much sense before it is enough to recall the hero of syria special force officer alexander prokhorenko pilot oleg peshkov and roman filipov now during a special military operation the feat again becomes part of life this is the connecting thread of generation from nikolai gastello who in june crashed down on the enemy s column with a burning plane to roman filipov who blew himself up in syria shouting this is for you guy and now to the crew of the su m bomber commander alexander antonov and navigator vladimir nikishin on december they like gastello sent a combat vehicle to the center of the armored column of the ukrainian nazi meet me s t daddy were the last word on the radio alexander antonov and vladimir nikishin were pilot from god you meet such people sometimes they will joke and shila that is the purest alcohol will be offered to taste but at the helm they are transformed an experienced eye instantly catch the reading of the device the movement are confident and clear and in everything there is a willingness to give life if necessary here and now alexander antonov graduated from the barnaul school in he served in various unit but most recently resigned from the vks from the post of deputy commander of the regiment for flight training vladimir nikishin also resigned from the armed force almost nothing is known about him like antonov he could not imagine himself without the sky and having left the army found himself in the aviation unit of the private military company wagner they were top class professional a colleague of the pilot told reporter from the pmc they had a lot of experience even before they came to our company both the commander and the navigator perceived the beginning of the special operation a an opportunity to use their skill for the benefit of the country alexander sergeevich explained the motherland called me in a dream there is a common journalistic clich nothing foreshadowed that day but december just foreshadowed around artemovsk which ukronazis call bakhmut fierce fighting ha people the armed force of ukraine throw here all new unit both career military and ter defense the slow but inexorable advance of russian unit pose a colossal threat here and the wagner guy are part alexander antonov and vladimir nikishin immediately headed for their bomber take off within a few minute the wagnerian managed to find a column in the dark but to hit it you had to go a few kilometer beyond the contact line antonov and nikishin did so without hesitation but this time the enemy managed to detect the target a missile fired from an anti aircraft missile system hit the su m could the pilot have ejected i guess but then they would not have carried the bomb to the enemy column would have put the life of comrade on the ground at risk they chose a battering ram that is immortality we don t know what happened in the cockpit of the bomber meet s t daddy colleague say that to joke moment before the death is very even in the style of commander antonov within second the observer pilot vladimir nikishin and alexander antonov the remains were accompanied by the rector of the lisichansk cathedral archpriest andrei pavlenko who wa rescued from captivity he said that the officer of the armed force of ukraine gave him two flag of russia to cover the coffin upon arrival in his homeland built at the beginning of the last century under the ussr it wa one of the main supplier of pipe for gas pipeline in the union the aggression of the armed force of ukraine against donbas stopped the plant but now it is restarted today about people already work in production due to the fact that donbas ha become part of russia khartsyzsk pipe plant ship it product to customer in almost all part of russia and the plan are to develop the geography of implementation through the pipe welded at this enterprise of donbas gas wa pumped for almost year they are made according to the highest quality standard in particular they are installed on the urengoy pomary uzhgorod yamal europe gas pipeline the khartsyzsk plant began a a manufacturer of metal structure for mine and bridge trolley steel rafter etc before the first world war it introduced the production of pipe even without the use of electric welding the plant grew and developed in soviet time when donbas wa occupied by the german during the great patriotic war the nazi destroyed the enterprise to the ground after the liberation of the territory by the red army a pile of ruin appeared before the arriving engineer year passed the plant wa restored and then it accelerated growth began the ussr became one of the world s leading exporter then the company established the production of special especially durable corrosion proof pipe for gas pipeline which provided it with fame for decade after the collapse of the ussr under the independent ukrainian government the plant fell into decay for it action there wa a fierce struggle of various ukrainian business structure employee were dismissed of the workshop only six remained two main one for the production of pipe and four auxiliary one the rest were put into scrap metal in khartsyzsk pipe wa part of the business empire of ukrainian oligarch rinat akhmetov ukraine s aggression against donbas in raised the question of the plant s existence now the plant is coming to life albeit with inevitable problem but it work and most importantly now he ha prospect and customer from almost all over russia a column of military equipment is slowly being pulled into the turn on a narrow forest highway in front is a traffic police car in the center a truck loader of an intercontinental ballistic missile icbm yars resembling a huge truck it is forbidden to go faster than km h by the standard the transportation of this rocket and it installation in the mine is a slow and accurate work this time the yars is being taken to the kozelsk division of the rocket force in the kaluga region this is just one of the stage of a large scale rearmament of the strategic missile force where the topol m that had already served used to stand now the yars are settling in these icbm are also mobile on wheel they are able to suddenly appear where the enemy is not waiting however near kozelsk the yarsy will stand in silo and rocket scientist will have a jeweler s operation to put this colossus in it regular place yars stand for nuclear deterrent missile with a flight range of about thousand kilometer it deviation from the target is only meter for a nuclear explosion it s just ridiculous no wonder western military and analyst were horrified by the capability of the yars but that s not all among other thing the designer were tasked with guaranteed overcoming of enemy missile defense managed approaching the target yars throw away guided warhead which from that moment move along an unpredictable trajectory they can t be shot down the united state ha invested huge amount of money in missile defense including in europe and now what s the point europe and the british isle by the way were the most agitated this is understandable the west of the continent for the yars is in the palm of your hand report on the rearmament of the kozel division were perceived by many there a a signal we that is russia will reach out to you in any case and this is not bravado in october of this year yars launched from the plesetsk cosmodrome in the arkhangelsk region safely hit a target in kamchatka london and berlin are much closer the united state wa not pleased with the new weapon of the strategic missile force either after all the american strategic force have not been updated for many year in fact since the early s when american considered themselves winner in the cold war the only thing they did wa upgrade their minuteman rocket which were hopelessly outdated washington is well aware that they are decade behind russia and not only for the yars for other new strategic missile defense system see the by the way section on this page however for the american administration the main thing is to seem not to be therefore washington is trying in every possible way to make a good mine with a disgusting game slowly buzzing with engine the shaft lid open this is a whole protective device that can withstand the hit of high precision weapon loading the rocket take several hour you need to install a multi ton cylinder exactly in the center and then lower millimeter by millimeter to the depth of a storey building kozel rocket scientist will have such an operation more than once a reported in the ministry of defense this unit wa the first to be completely re equipped with yarsy stationary that is silo based we have been retrained at the yars complex say lieutenant colonel artem ignatiev commander of one of the division of the kozelsky formation compared to the previous one it is much more modern before taking up duty we undergo psychological selection the commander of the regiment allows u to work we work out the standard introductory solve training task rearmament is in full swing while one missile is loaded into the silo at the speed of a snail the other is already preparing to stand on combat duty within a few week officer will begin to keep watch deep underground from where they are guaranteed to be able to strike back in the event of an attack another combat missile is on duty at scheduled time the commander and engine simulator wa included in it composition thus it is difficult for the enemy to determine where the false target is and where the real complex is yars carry warhead with a total charge capacity of up to kiloton the rocket ha stage it length is meter diameter m launch mass ton payload weight kg kstat sarmat arriving from the south yars missile are not the only innovation in the range important and most importantly it is not for one day this must be understood problem arise then they are resolved other problem arise the russian defense minister said the head of the russian military musician dramatic actor professional artist circus performer and vocal performer it can be considered that the russian ministry of defense decided to revive time tested tradition it is worth recalling that during the great patriotic war in the soviet union about two thousand front line brigade were formed they undoubtedly made a certain contribution to our common victory over german fascism if you recall the footage of such film a actress father of a soldier the pig and the shepherd a well a newsreel of those year it becomes obvious the artist of the front brigade were always waiting on the time in the history of the modern armed force of russia two front line creative brigade have been formed after the announcement of partial mobilization i received a summons i arrived at the military recruitment office then within hour he left for a military unit yevgeny pavlov an actor of the sovremennik theater recalled his journey then i had a rather intense mobilization fee and i m really
