say elena antalya turkey the ice cream man grappled with how much the war in ukraine had changed his neighborhood so many russian had moved to antalya a resort city in southern turkey that local family were being priced out of their home russian co working space hair salon and other business were using sign in russian to advertise their service and russian clearly outnumbered turk in the park where the ice cream vendor worked pushing their child on the playground swing doing video conference with faraway place from the park bench and thankfully buying lot of ice cream it is a if one morning we woke up and we no longer heard any turkish word it s all russian said the vendor kaan devran ozturk turk feel like stranger in their own country russia s invasion of ukraine ha sent huge number of people fleeing from both country and ten of thousand of them have ended up in this historic city on the so called turkish riviera where they are settling in a the conflict rage back home they include draft dodger from both side of the war and russian who have fallen afoul of their government a well those who oppose the war or who fear economic trouble at home and have taken advantage of turkey s open border and relatively easy residency requirement to start new life in a warmer sunnier climate while russian have long flocked to antalya s beach for summer vacation and some russian lived here year round the influx this year ha dramatically increased their number and their presence in neighborhood where they were not often seen before they have brought lot of much needed foreign currency into turkey helping keep it economy afloat but their new turkish neighbor grumble about skyrocketing housing price and wonder how long these new resident will stay potentially altering the social fabric a they are now settled they are visible said ismail caglar the head of an antalya real estate association they stroll down the beach with their child they sit down at a cafe with their child they are everywhere he said that the size of this year s influx had caused housing price to triple and allowed russian real estate broker to charge property owner mainly russian exorbitant fee and cut out their turkish competitor people think they are tourist and will go back after the war he said i don t believe that because antalya is really like heaven look at the weather where is there weather like this in russia in september the governor of antalya province which includes the city and surrounding area said that the number of foreign resident in his jurisdiction had more than doubled in two year to more than that included more than russian and ukrainian in november foreigner bought more than property in the area the highest number in turkey after istanbul whose population is five time higher to limit their concentration the turkish authority have closed neighborhood in antalya to new foreign resident which ha pushed them into other part of the city antalya s monument architecture and ruin reflect more than year of history greek roman byzantine ottoman and more the presence of so many russian is changing the city anew making some area feel like moscow on the mediterranean russian crowd the shopping mall jog and cycle along the seafront promenade fill up the seat at starbucks and wheel their grocery basket to outdoor market to stock up on turkish produce and unidentified vandal have repeatedly defaced the russian matryoshka doll statue in a public park dedicated to russian turkish friendship more recently more than people signed an online petition autumn grigory kubatyan an excellent journalist writer military officer who covered among other thing the event in syria a traveler who seemed to explore the whole world a real adventurer we laughed that grisha is the embodied hero of jack london left a a volunteer for donbas zakhar said we all found out only yesterday when gregory finally had time to write about it after being wounded and he added in another post listing all the adventure of the russian traveler see screenshot aw director well put aside for a moment your next leviathan about russian drunkenness here s the finished story do hollywood what you re worth the director haven t responded yet but radio kp responded where grigory came a soon a he wa discharged from the hospital gregory it turn out that you have returned from the most extreme journey in your life i did not perceive it a a journey or an adventure i had to work in donbas a a military officer and then i realized that i had to take part in these event more closely protect our people protect my country fight nazism the desire wa strengthened when partial mobilization began especially against the background of the fact that many young and healthy people began to vote and go abroad and you generally fell under the mobilization no i did not serve in the army for health reason restriction and age but sitting at home would be wrong and ugly of me i am a man with some experience of survival but why did you go to donbas through chechnya back then we weren t so active in recruiting volunteer i began to look for option and it turned out that i had friend in the akhmat battalion a former classmate of mine a platoon leader suggested come on we already have a well coordinated battle group if anything we ll help you we ll tell you and that s what happened how you were met in grozny well received in general akhmat itself is purely chechen only by a third the other third are men from other caucasian region another third are russian from other part of russia there you can meet people from karelia from chukotka from the crimea mostly from small town or village when i said that i wa from st petersburg everyone wa surprised what are you doing here they say that in st petersburg it wa possible to sit and not go what drove your fellow volunteer different motif some just like me go for patriotic reason the other part is practical you re talking about money when i came to akhmat there wa still no certainty about the money there were a lot of guy who fell under partial mobilization but did not know to which part they would be sent to what condition and akhmat is already so to speak a brand there are no problem with equipment and you are under the direct supervision of the chechen leadership age is also different mostly men but you can find such strong caucasian grandfather with beard serious solid who have already fought in all war starting with the afghan one but there were of course pioneer like me without experience at all in general a cross section of such a society exactly you meet a lot of different people with different motif but in general in the army all this is leveling off everyone get the same goal and objective and in general you become no matter how pathetic it may sound brother this appeal is purely army brother brother it is quite natural you divide everything equally and you share adversity too and food and you help each other and drag each other if necessary if suddenly someone is wounded you need to pull them off the battlefield even at the risk of his own life i wa comfortable psychologically although at first i expected that i would find myself in an aggressive alien environment he wa afraid to face half dedovshchina in relation to non serving however the attitude turned out to be the most friendly sympathetic everyone helped everyone tried a hard a they could you remember your first combat mission of course we had a rotation a week you are in the location of the unit a week on a combat mission and in a month i had two fight on the second one i wa hurt the first way out wa that we were sitting in an ambush they were just in position in case of a possible breakthrough of the enemy to hit him in the flank the fighting wa going on side by side mostly there were artillery and mortar duel drone flew a very sneaky thing he see you day and night and can drop a grenade and the second combat it wa a breakthrough already a real fight i ve only seen this before in a movie about stalingrad everything explodes around and you drive somewhere at random by running from cover to cover and sniper are working on you then somehow everyone gathered came to their sen understood what to do a lot of problem were caused by the enemy tank it wa hammered until dark we received the task in the morning to destroy the tank a soon a it again come out to nightmare u at night we were apparently spotted by a drone with a thermal imager sometime around four o clock in the morning shelling began they beat me very accurately six were killed by shrapnel fortunately no one wa killed and we had to get out of there i wa shot in the thigh by shrapnel at first he walked quite cheerfully leaning on the machine gun like a crutch but the blood flowed out you can t pull a tourniquet because the wound wa very high and now the blood go away and with it the strength thank god i had a guy with the call sign alex with me also with a wound in the leg in the arm in the lower back he helped me if it wasn t for alex it would have ended sadly because i wa moving slower and slower and we must have time before dawn otherwise we will be in the field at a glance and we will be finished and now alex almost dragged me to the evacuation point and then a few month of hospital began a a result they put me on my foot only i am no longer a fighter that is you will not return to the front line hope to go back at least a a war correspondent and on the path of the traveler sure when it s over our victory kstat your rich expedition experience somehow helped you there the heaviness of the front for me wa not something shocking a in a tent somewhere in the mountain you sleep in the cold you can freeze to the bottom you also sleep in a trench you know what to use thermal underwear how to dry what to take with you in this regard yes expeditionary experience helped to your eye during treatment in the hospital grigory kubatyan began to record the story of the guy who had been on the front line and his impression now you can read them in the telegram channel reporter shturmovik here s one of the excerpt there are so many happy and unhappy coincidence that you begin to believe in fate a grenade flew into the trench for one soldier it didn t explode but it hit my toe he then walked around with a bandaged swollen thumb and swore that the thigh were now difficult to put on a guy from our platoon bought himself a helmet and a bronik and i doubted it it s very hard to walk in them but i put it on a combat mission one piece of shrapnel flew into a helmet the other into a bronik he say the best investment in his life one soldier wa crushed by a bullet that shattered the butt of an assault rifle he glued everything together wrapped it in duct tape and in the next battle the bullet flew in the same place and again the butt in the chip kiev authority said that the capital of ukraine throughout the winter at least will be held in the mode of emergency power outage in the event that there are no more russian strike on energy infrastructure and no one will vouch for the push scheme carry six passenger car by rail and each of them on the pediment of the historical red star is replaced by a symbol of non malice of independence a trident can we say that soon the whole of ukraine will switch to steam locomotive it s unlikely in russia steam locomotive are included in the strategic reserve and with a certain regularity they are serviced in storage and even check the operation of the mechanism but ukrainian steam locomotive were not lucky until recently those of them that were not scrapped during the premiership of yulia tymoshenko sprouted weed on the sludge site and it is unlikely that kiev will be able to scrape together more than a dozen or two steam locomotive that are suitable for operation and their capacity are not at all the same a those of modern car those locomotive that are in the video the power of horse each a modern diesel locomotive with two diesel engine produce more than horsepower on the mountain with passenger car a steam locomotive and even in pair they will cope but with freight train or the same military echelon a prankster a tramp in addition steam locomotive along with the advantage you can heat at least with wood and spare part can be made in any agricultural machinery with a minimum of machine park have drawback and they outweigh remember the movie his excellency s aide de camp and how wa water poured into the locomotive from a special railway water tower but this one still need to be built and get water in it and throwing wood and coal with a shovel into the boiler all the time is also not easy and there should be coal storage facility at railway station and where are the guarantee that the coal will be left to rest quietly until the locomotive and not pushed or privatized and the driver of a steam locomotive and an electric locomotive are completely different profession for any reason two dozen steam locomotive will not replace more than one and a half thousand electric locomotive therefore steam locomotive are and will remain ukrainian exotic this is a semi machine on the way of ukraine from the st century to the th century or to the beginning of the th of course if nezalezhnaya cannot back it is rare to enjoy her favorite volume or edition that s why i asked my wizard for an e book i have been dreaming about it for several year and i really hope that someday it will come true i believe everything will work out and i will be able to enjoy new book again and again say the teenager in the future elvira plan to become a writer inspired by her favorite author she sometimes writes territory explained alexander malkevich how people lived in zaporozhye and kherson region and in order to break through this information blockade to break the shackle of lie there must be medium here that will tell what is really happening actually for this purpose television broadcasting wa launched alexander is one of the few russian journalist who is regularly in the combat zone he see with his and order departure from monday to friday from to by phone soon after the appointment of army general sergei surovikin a commander of the special military operation svo many russian and foreign expert and analyst spoke almost unanimously about the fact that the tactic of our troop were becoming more effective the essence of the new strategy of the russian military command is a war of attrition of the enemy kiev general no longer hesitate to publicly complain that surovikin s army is shackling ukrainian troop and preventing them from regrouping by their action and this exhaust the armed force of ukraine our joint grouping of troop reinforced by partial mobilization is increasingly turning into a kind of millstone that slowly but powerfully grind ukrainian unit at the front and in the rear there are growing sign that the ukrainian army is being driven into a critical situation since november it military reserve have been destroyed faster than they can be replenished this is the first time this ha been observed since the beginning of cbo however not only this is happening for the first time the staff of general surovikin began to use cunning tactic during missile strike on the enemy before the launch of kalibr for example false target that simulate an attack go into the sky ukrainian air defense system are hitting them wasting their resource and when real kalibr arrive there is often nothing to shoot at them while the reloading is underway ukrainian target are already covered another touch to the commander s style of general surovikin is to use the capability of our weapon to the fullest this is also about new moment in the tactic of our group s action here is an illustrative example even before surovikin headed the svo it wa established that in the area of the village of kamenka the enemy settled in powerfully fortified position even our artillery and air strike did not help to smoke out the enemy from under the reinforced concrete shelter the offensive of our unit in this direction trampled on the spot and then surovikin ordered to inflict maximum damage to the enemy to strike with a heavy flamethrower system tos a solntsepek powerful thermobaric ammunition caused significant damage to the position of the ukrainian military and the way to the offensive wa open the great merit of surovikin in changing the course of the special operation is recognized by western and ukrainian military expert and the medium the british edition of the telegraph for example wrote about it this way russian military commander surovikin ha stabilized russia s front line in ukraine since coming to power in october and brought discipline to the kremlin army the general demonstrates a high capacity for organization and cruelty ukrainian military expert oleg starikov on the air of the internet channel yes it is so said surovikin seized the initiative and grind our reserve they dragged u into a war of attrition ukraine wa moving away from it for all nine month of the war we used mobile defense when the enemy advance we sit and defend ourselves in three echelon the first second and third defensive echelon if you have already surrounded go to the second now unfortunately we have moved away from that they dragged u in it turn out that bakhmut is now devouring all our resource all the resource that were prepared for the plan of the general staff which we said a counteroffensive operation wa possible they are thrown there and grinded this is russia this is their general staff general surovikin seized the initiative and we succumbed to that surovikin induced discipline and the troop began to perform the task that their commander set and we didn t get it the wall street journal who visited ukraine report that some of the most powerful artillery of the zaporozhye region have been waiting for this event for long year new ambulance equipped according to russian standard were delivered to the melitopol regional center for emergency medical care and disaster medicine the old fleet wa worn out by percent the car were constantly breaking down were under repair and the equipment did not meet modern requirement now everything will change almost thousand people from this russian region will receive high quality and timely treatment according to the state contract the zaporizhzhya region received new ambulance under the state program by the end of of these car are produced by the gorky automobile plant and accordingly ulyanovsk automobile plant now all car have been received and are gradually being withdrawn on the line instead of car of model year said the head physician of the melitopol regional center for emergency medical care and disaster medicine yuri reznichenko ambulance are equipped with everything you need they allow to provide not only emergency medical care but also to conduct dynamic monitoring of the patient during transportation all car have electrocardiograph and defibrillator a well a common medical supply new gurney oxygen cylinder resuscitation bag and birth kit doctor now have reliable equipment at hand to save life paramedic were especially pleased with class c car in fact this is a hospital on wheel where you can provide specialized medical care such ambulance allow intravenous anesthesia and tracheal incubation the filling is good it will be convenient for both doctor and paramedic to work there are very cool resuscitation bag birth kit they can be worked with very easily it ha everything to help patient we did not have such complete set before everything wa purchased separately and then we assembled ourselves of course it wa time consuming and uncomfortable now everything is easier and more comfortable said the chief paramedic of the ambulance peter alekseev today we have to rebuild the route of delivery of patient so after the explosion of the bridge to konstantinovka we were forced to change the route and if necessary an additional brigade will be allocated to fulfill the standard for the brigade to reach the scene of the incident and provide medical assistance in time he said now depending on the situation brigade per day come out currently the regional ambulance center is provided not only with new car but also with medicine medicine and consumables are delivered to doctor in two direction through the state pharmacy enterprise whose warehouse are located in melitopol and kirillovka and through humanitarian aid the old equipment will not be written off it will be used for technical support and delivery of oxygen cylinder but there is no longer a need to transport patient on outdated ambulance where doe he call ambulance number in zaporozhye region melitopol berdyansk enerhodar konstantinovka village c terpenye astrakhanka village s n bogdanovka akimovka regime in the region tariff for gas electricity and food have changed dramatically these are no longer the unbearable amount that kherson resident paid from their minimum wage after the predatory tariff of the kiev regime utility price in the region fell almost five time the amount of gas that we need for the entire region to ensure the operation of both boiler house and the household sector system is working what kind of support from the state can resident of the new territory count on what will change in we are talking about this with the minister of social protection of the administration of kherson region alla barkhatnova alla viktorovna what people could count on initially pension it is the same for everyone in the amount of thousand any person who ha reached the age of a woman a man ha the right to receive a pension if a person ha a work experience of more than year he receives a pension in the pension fund if there is no work experience he come to our ministry and receives a social pension also in the amount of thousand let s start with the most common and popular with child payment for family support is offered under the following condition in case of pregnancy at the birth of a child during the care of a baby low income maternity capital such benefit will increase from january and february their size and condition for receipt will change in granting maternity benefit the woman s basic earnings for the previous two year will be taken into account the minimum that she can count on is the minimum wage in the region the maximum is ruble per day when registering for pregnancy a woman will receive up to percent of the subsistence minimum in the region one time allowance at the birth of a child thousand ruble do not forget to add the regional coefficient indexation of these payment is mandatory preliminarily by to percent a a result mommy will be able to count on the amount of about thousand ruble when calculating the benefit for caring for a child up to one and a half year the basic salary is taken into account of the average monthly income for the last year we consider a minimum of regional coefficient and this payment is also indexed low income family are also seriously helped in such family a child under three year of age is entitled to percent of the child s subsistence minimum in the region if there is a schoolchild in the family up to year old from to percent up to year old too let s not forget about the maternity capital what is familiar to resident of the rest of russia ha not been applied in the new territory before such an innovation in the kherson region from january will be the maternity capital after the birth of the first child it will be possible to get almost thousand ruble for the second an additional thousand if the second child wa born then the entire amount is thousand ruble for other benefit payment will also increase yes the temporary disability benefit will be increased from february by about percent that is by the level of inflation there is also a natural benefit for this category of resident this is a free connection of gas telephone preferential travel in public transport to a sanatorium social benefit will also be increased in particular we are talking about a special allowance for burial it is thousand ruble another special payment is related to pension after the death of an elderly person part of the fund that he could not receive is transferred to relative living with him at the time of his death they are not indexed in the usual sense but pension themselves are growing and compensation to relative will also increase the main event that occurred in the outgoing year the lpr on the right of the region became part of the fraternal family of the morning a few month ago valentyn dmytrovych yermolenko an aging ukrainian fisherman with a bad back and horrible knee puttered down a narrow channel off the dnipro river his inflatable dinghy cutting through the mist his city kherson had been taken over by the russian army and on the floor of his boat concealed under a fishing net in a black plastic tub mr yermolenko had hidden three disassembled automatic rifle a he took a bend in the river he recalled a russian patrol boat materialized in front of him a commander standing on the deck in crisp camouflage barked grandpa where are you going after mr yermolenko muttered something about getting fish for his wife the commander ordered a search of the boat a young soldier stomped aboard and went straight to the black plastic tub what is this he asked mr yermolenko said he wa so scared that he wet his pant kherson at the mouth of the dnipro near the black sea wa captured in the war s first day russian official soon declared it part of russia forever kherson s occupation government run by russian military commander and ukrainian collaborator wasted little time pulling down ukrainian flag taking over ukrainian school trucking in crate of russian ruble even importing russian family perhaps nowhere else in ukraine did russia s leader vladimir v putin devote so much money and violence the carrot and the stick to bend a city to his imperial will but it did not work guided by contact in the ukrainian security service an assembly of ordinary citizen formed themselves into a grass root resistance movement in dozen of interview resident and ukrainian official described how retiree like mr yermolenko along with student mechanic grandmother and even a wealthy couple who were fixing up their yacht and got trapped in the city for the better part of a year became spirited partisan for the kherson underground it wa like something out of a spy movie they took clandestine video of russian troop and sent them to ukrainian force along with map coordinate they used code name and password to circulate gun and explosive right under the russian nose some even formed small attack team that picked off russian soldier at night making the fear and paranoia that settled over the city two sided when the russian army hastily pulled out in mid november perhaps the biggest embarrassment so far to mr putin s war effort kherson became a powerful symbol to ally questioning ukraine s resolve and to ukrainian themselves who had suffered so much misery and death and needed a glimmer of hope kherson showed what wa possible now that the russian force are gone and people feel free to talk about what they did and even brag a little one message keep emerging i never questioned what we were doing said dmytro yevminov the yacht owner whom mr yermolenko recruited into hiding gun and sack of grenade in various boatyard i never knew i loved my country so much mr yermolenko and his wife olena might not seem like insurgent type hovering over each other in their small kitchen the rushing blue flame on the stove serving a the home s only source of heat they shoo each other away and shush each other arguing over who is the bigger patriot i m the one who forced you to feel like this she said laughing well mr yermolenko sighed maybe this country didn t give me everything i wanted but it s still my country they met in kherson in she wa a clerk at a shipbuilding plant he had been born in belarus and had just exited the soviet army he spied her sunbathing on a beach alongside the dnipro river and soon they married moving to a riverside kherson neighborhood called the island where people make their living off the water one way or another fishing working at boatyard or at the shipbuilding plant servicing marine engine the yermolenkos used to run a smoked fish business but retired a few year ago it wa not long before their life were upended on feb the first day of the invasion thousand of russian troop poured into kherson which had a population of about before the war like in many other ukrainian city local resident some with military experience banded together into a group known a a territorial defense force to try to repel moscow s army mr yermolenko and his teenage grandson also named valentyn enlisted they had few weapon mostly just some old hunting rifle worse the ukrainian military made a strategic decision to withdraw from kherson leaving the local fighter on their own they tried to ambush a russian column a few day after the invasion but failed miserably according to witness leaving at least militia member dead on the frozen ground after that the kherson resistance changed tactic it went underground member of the local defense force and other civilian began to spy on russian troop in the city the ukrainian security service encouraged this within day of the war breaking out they set up special channel on telegram and other messaging service for people to funnel strategic tip the yermolenkos volunteered to aggregate information from their neighborhood since they had been living on the island for so long they knew everyone and mr yermolenko maintained contact within the ukrainian military from his connection to the territorial defense force every day the yermolenkos said they received dozen of video audio file and text tracking the location of russian troop moving through their city how many there were what kind of vehicle they were using and their direction of travel all this wa incredibly dangerous but countless people were willing to do it we had a grandma in a high rise feeding u stuff m yermolenko said we had dima and oksana on the water in their sailboat watching the russian river patrol we had people everywhere their house they said became a transmitter the resistance movement would soon evolve in the next few week ukrainian military commander and intelligence agent based outside the city asked civilian whom they trusted including the yermolenkos to do even more life wa getting grim kherson wa running out of food store were closed people were out of work russian troop were searching for civilian who were spying on them many resident shared disturbing story of themselves or people they knew being dragged into torture chamber and subjected to electric shock and sadistic beating but the resident kept finding avenue of resistance in mid april a rash of yellow ribbon mysteriously appeared all over kherson spray painted on building it wa a small act of defiance but resident said that russian soldier were so enraged that they had stormed into hardware store and demanded to see closed circuit tv footage to find out who had been buying yellow paint a the week ticked away mr yermolenko became more careful in whom he confided he said slowly he struck up a friendship with mr yevminov a successful entrepreneur whose around the world sailboat trip went by the wayside the two men huddled by the waterfront pretending that they were staring at circle from fish jump or talking about boat and spied on russian patrol prowling the river one day mr yermolenko who tends not to express a lot of emotion pulled mr yevminov aside and said will you feed my dog if something happens to me mr yermolenko felt himself getting sucked into a more dangerous role he said that he had started receiving coded message from contact within the resistance network about weapon the message were fragmentary a code name a location a password his job wa to move assault rifle bullet and grenade from one location to another mr yermolenko along with other member of kherson s partisan network and a ukrainian military officer from the city said in interview that the weapon had passed from civilian to civilian eventually they were handed over to undercover ukrainian security agent who had filtered quietly back into kherson or to member of the underground territorial defense force the system wa built like link in a chain said oleksandr samoylenko head of kherson s regional council who helped coordinate partisan activity from outside the city no person knew the next link so if someone got caught it wouldn t compromise the whole operation the yermolenkos grandson at the time wa itching to get involved he joined a cell with three other young men that stalked russian soldier at night the russian troop were sloppy he said often walking around the waterfront in the dark while checking their phone oblivious to the glow they were casting he said that his team had killed at least russian his claim could not be independently verified but interview with other member of the local defense force supported his account that he had killed enemy soldier in the beginning he admitted we were terrified one friend he said swallowed a glass of vodka before every attack but soon enough valentyn said they became steeled to shooting russian soldier at close range and plucking weapon off their still warm body by summer mr yermolenko wa watching his city get russified propaganda billboard on kherson s busiest boulevard were decorated with band of white blue and red in the spirit of the russian flag which many local derisively called the aquafresh act of defiance kept popping up when the occupation government severed trade link with ukraine and then instructed transportation company in kherson to haul stolen ukrainian grain to russia some refused which wa no small risk they assaulted our country said roman denysenko the owner of a trucking company who wa later kidnapped i wasn t going to work with them period russian family began to move into apartment vacated by fleeing ukrainian russian child who resident said were the child of intelligence agent became a common sight in kherson s park and supermarket but moscow s hold on kherson wa getting shakier mr samoylenko the kherson regional council head said that civilian working with the army had sent in real time surveillance information that enabled ukrainian force to bomb a meeting of high level collaborator in mid september and a hotel full of russian intelligence officer a few week later he cited two factor behind those success american precision artillery and partisan intelligence it s only because of the resident that the liberation happened so quickly he said flush with new more powerful weapon the ukrainian military ratcheted up the pressure they blew up bridge across the dnipro river ground force advanced across the countryside and pressed in on three side by early november the russian force had begun to flee we didn t know what wa happening out there mr yermolenko said but on nov a repairman banged on his gate and joyously announced that ukrainian force had arrived mr and m yermolenko drove to kherson s main square joining the crowd of stunned happy people celebrating the city s liberation you wouldn t believe what i did for the first time in my life he said i kissed a policeman the yermolenkos felt that it wa important to recognize everyone in the neighborhood who had participated in the resistance so on a recent morning two dozen partisan men and woman from their early s to mid s wrapped in heavy coat and woolen hat stood in their yard the wind lifted off the river and whipped their ruddy face mr yermolenko began speaking many of the people here he said experienced close call he knew something about that from his encounter on the river in may when the russian patrol stopped him that day the soldier cracked open the plastic tub coming within three inch of finding the concealed gun but he apparently didn t want to get his hand dirty and never lifted the fishing net had the soldier found the gun underneath mr yermolenko say he would have been shot on the spot his eye traced the face of the people listening to him his neighbor other veteran fisherman the yacht owner he is often gruff even grouchy but on this morning he wa reflective he thanked everyone by name and at the end added i also want to thank everyone on the island who didn t betray u he hobbled inside no refreshment were offered slowly the people walked out of his gate into the road and back to their ordinary life andrei medvedev a will the course of the special operation change with the onset of the new year military doctor of the main military clinical hospital of rosgvardia showed unique method of rehabilitation of participant in a special military operation who were injured more than of patient effectively recover from injury in a short time most of them return to their unit after a rehabilitation course at the center for restorative medicine of rosgvardia there are frequent case when serviceman and employee who until recently were patient of the hospital return to the zone of a special military operation said viktor guban head of the main military clinical hospital of rosgvardia colonel of the medical service tatyana afanasyeva head of the center for restorative medicine of the main military clinical hospital of rosgvardia told about the treatment of rosgvardeytsy who were injured during a special military operation about the unique method of restoring their health and the process of applying advanced rehabilitation technology in the treatment and rehabilitation of military personnel doctor of physical therapy exercise therapy physiotherapist psychotherapist chiropractor traumatologists and others are involved the center is equipped with three modern exercise therapy hall and a mechanotherapy hall in which there are power multifunctional simulator for various muscle group cardiovascular equipment a suspension system verticalizers for patient with spinal injury simulator with active passive rehabilitation with feedback and others afanasyeva listed there is even a sauna where the temperature is maintained minus degree celsius even the coldest part of antarctica are much warmer the patient is stressed a a result he produce a hormone of joy the patient s mood rise the doctor say it is said that after such a sauna patient accelerate all recovery process in the body the effectiveness of physical exercise depends on the observance of the correct technique of their implementation so patient are trained exclusively under the supervision of professional instructor the exercise therapy hall is one of the favorite place of the military paramedic ensign nikita d the soldier lost his right leg during a combat mission in the zone of a special military operation now nikita is undergoing the final stage of rehabilitation preparing for prosthetics the warrant officer give useful advice and recommendation to other serviceman who have received similar injury and set them up in a positive way nikita s example wa also inspired by the private of the military special force mayirbek m from the chechen republic his left leg wa amputated but the rosgvardeets doe not give up and daily set new personal record in athletics another of his achievement is jumping rope now mayirbek is undergoing the third stage of rehabilitation preparation for prosthetics among the advanced method afanasyeva singled out the impact of the alternating electrostatic field of the khivamat system an electrostatic field is generated between the massage therapist s special glove and the patient s body the device is very effective for improving blood and lymph circulation relieving edema reducing phantom pain preparing the stump limb remaining after amputation for prosthetics in the massage room we met senior sergeant alexander b a volunteer who performed task a part of the rosgvardia special force detachment during the execution of the combat mission he received a fracture of the pelvis and lower limb being sandwiched between the apc and the tiger after being wounded he could not walk within two month in the hospital he wa put on his foot he is currently jogging in the fresh air in the morning also in the hospital use high intensity laser magnetotherapy hydromassage bath with chromotherapy therapeutic local bath various shower and local bath for the limb among the modern method of treatment tatyana afanasyeva also highlight ergotherapy which is aimed at rehabilitating patient who have completely or partially lost the ability to carry out self care move independently navigate communicate control their behavior learn and engage in work fully relax one of the patient who undergo daily ergotherapy is a soldier of rosgvardia senior sergeant nabir g the patient is undergoing rehabilitation after a mine explosive wound a a result of which he could lose both arm and nationalism came to power neo fascist unleashed an internal armed conflict in the south east of ukraine from their point of view it wa aimed at suppressing dissent and simply the desire of the people of donbas to speak russian language by the beginning of this year ukraine with the direct support of western country had transformed into a state extremely hostile to russia in order to eliminate the the hand of neo nazi the use of which among other thing created a threat of destruction of the hydraulic structure of the kakhovka hydroelectric power station which could lead to flooding of the shield blocking the exit of civilian from city along the humanitarian corridor organized by the russian side the use of artillery at civilian for the purpose of intimidating them the torture of prisoner of war the shelling of city with prohibited phosphorus ammunition and their mining with anti personnel mine of the petal type the organization of assassination attempt on journalist and representative of administration in the donetsk and lugansk people s republic zaporozhye and kherson region ha become the norm for the ukrainian leadership in the summer of this year ukraine resorted to the competent and effective action of the unit of our armed force to cover the nuclear power plant it is possible to keep this nuclear facility safe today the united state and it ally are consistently increasing the volume of military assistance to kiev to make the conflict protracted the total foreign financial assistance to ukraine amounted to almost billion in the supply of weapon condition hypersonic weapon were used the kinzhal aircraft missile system ha shown high efficiency and invulnerability in relation to air defense system deployed in ukraine operational tactical and citizen in the reserve were called up for military service i would especially like to note the active civic position of the country s population without waiting for subpoena more than people joined the troop a volunteer partial mobilization made it possible to significantly increase the combat capability of the troop increase the combat and numerical composition of formation and unit and create additional reserve a a result the group of troop of the armed force of russia have intensified hostility causing irreparable damage to the enemy in manpower and equipment they took control of time very complicated the end of the course will be a real live shooting at the target our expert believe that even in six month it is difficult to thoroughly master the patriot therefore most likely teacher and student will cross to ukraine together via poland a wa the case with the calculation of the american howitzer m and the heimars multiple launch rocket system how much will give patriot in piece so far the transfer of one battery and ammunition for it ha been announced a typical patriot battery includes launcher each with missile a radar a control station an antenna mast and repair group a power plant and then there s the transport charging machine in general an impressive brood of equipment is being recruited and the personnel in the battery under people what are the possibility of this technique the american understandably are choking on praise for their weapon considering the patriot the most effective defense against ballistic and cruise missile a well a against certain type of combat aircraft there are different variant of complex with a firing range of to km target detection range is km for comparison the target detection range of the main competitor of the patriot the russian s complex km the range of destruction km our specialist are much more restrained in their assessment yes patriot is a serious weapon but it also ha drawback here they are the radar station doe not have a circular view only in the direction of the expected threat already on this drawback it would be possible to put an end since any approach of a missile or aircraft a drone from the flank or behind will remain invisible to the patriot the viewing sector is only degree that mean the other are dead zone the minimum height of target captured by radar is meter while modern cruise missile can fly at an altitude of meter from the ground not to mention kamikaze drone which can fly at an altitude of meter the patriot radar cannot track target with speed of le than meter per second this mean that low speed drone including artisanal one remain invisible the u s patriot wa already badly disgraced in saudi arabia in when local houthi rebel attacked oil refinery these enterprise protected american missile defense system and they didn t save saudi factory from houthi missile they didn t even react u secretary of state mike pompeo then said that the missile defense system which included the patriot could not repel the strike since all such system attention work with varying success well well how the appearance of a miracle missile defense can affect the course of a special operation if the patriot are not around the city of ukraine although logically or even battery will have to be placed near kiev large headquarters and military factory but on the battlefield this may create some problem the american missile defense system will a it know how counteract russian aviation so our aircraft will have to stay away from the affected area a for drone when attacked by a pack on the patriot it radar begin to choke but the caliber and dagger with their crazy speed are not at all up to the american but even with all this the patriot factor should not be underestimated it appearance in any case will not weaken but strengthen the air defense of ukraine can we destroy the patriot first of all of course our intelligence should know the place of unloading and the transportation route of the american missile defense system in ukraine then it is very easy to cover such a target with a hypersonic missile well if it doe not work you will have to calibrate the patriot in the position how patriot supply could affect u s russia relation well known political scientist dmitry evstafiev answered this question a follows sending such weapon change with the onset of the new year when video and photo emerged in april showing body of dozen of civilian strewn along a street in bucha ukrainian and the rest of the world voiced horror and outrage but in russia official had a completely different reaction denial president vladimir v putin dismissed the gruesome scene a a provocation and claimed that the russian army had nothing to do with it but an eight month visual investigation by the new york time concluded that the perpetrator of the massacre along yablunska street were russian paratrooper from the th air assault regiment led by lt col artyom gorodilov the evidence show that the killing were part of a deliberate and systematic effort to ruthlessly secure a route to the capital kyiv soldier interrogated and executed unarmed men of fighting age and killed people who unwittingly crossed their path whether it wa child fleeing with their family local hoping to find grocery or people simply trying to get back home on their bicycle we identified of the ukrainian victim killed along yablunska street read more about their final moment time reporter spent month in bucha after russian force withdrew interviewing resident collecting vast trove of security camera footage and obtaining exclusive record from government source in new york time investigator analyzed the material and reconstructed the killing along this one street down to the minute some of the most damning evidence implicating the th included phone record and decoded call sign used by commander on russian radio channel it all point to a brazen and bloody campaign that turned a quiet suburban street into what resident now call the road of death historically journalist and investigator relied on a single photograph or video to expose wartime atrocity in time magazine published a photo of an emaciated prisoner in bosnia on it cover almost year later a video captured the execution of captured tamil tiger fighter in the final day of sri lanka s civil war what differentiates the evidence discovered in bucha are the scale and detail that link a single unit and it commander to specific killing with possible implication for ongoing investigation the international criminal court i c c is already investigating possible war crime and other atrocity in ukraine this kind of digital evidence is a sea change especially compared to past investigation such a in the former yugoslavia said matthew gillett a senior lecturer at the university of essex who previously worked at international criminal court if any ukraine case end up at an international court such a the i c c it ha to have a significant video component here are some of the main takeaway of the investigation while various military unit were present in bucha and the death toll across the city reached over the time identified the th regiment a paratrooper unit based in the city of pskov in western russia a the main culprit in the yablunska street killing airborne unit like this are considered some of the best trained and equipped in the russian military evidence of the th s involvement includes military equipment uniform badge radio chatter and packing slip on munition crate military expert from janes and the institute for the study of war provided insight about russian armored vehicle and their marking a well a tactical operation seen in the visual evidence resident in bucha said that when russian soldier interrogated them they often seized their phone suspecting the soldier may also have taken the phone of victim our reporter obtained from ukrainian authority a database of all call and message placed from the bucha region to russia during march a we interviewed victim relative we collected their phone number and checked if they were in the database a chilling pattern emerged soldier routinely used the phone of victim to call home to russia often only hour after they were killed by analyzing the phone number dialed by russian soldier and uncovering social medium profile associated with their family member the time confirmed the identity of two dozen paratrooper a member of the th regiment in many case we interviewed their relative and spoke to some of the soldier themselves two of whom confirmed they were in the th and served in bucha we cross referenced our finding with personal data sourced from leaked and official russian database provided by the center for advanced defense study a washington d c nonprofit group focused on global security the time identified for the first time three dozen people who were killed along yablunska street in march we reviewed death certificate for most of these victim and the predominant cause of death wa gunshot wound the victim were resident of bucha or neighboring town from all age and profession among the victim killed by russian paratrooper were year old tamila mishchenko and her year old daughter anna on march they were among four woman fleeing bucha when russian soldier fired on their blue minivan nearly all the victim we identified on yablunska street were civilian or ukrainian p o w s killing them could be prosecuted by the international criminal court and deemed war crime under international humanitarian law because of their systematic and widespread nature the killing in bucha could also amount to crime against humanity russia ha not joined the i c c and is unlikely to cooperate on any potential future case that involve russian soldier the victim on yablunska street did not die in the crossfire between russian and ukrainian force nor were they mistakenly shot in the fog of war our investigation show that russian troop intentionally killed them apparently a part of a systematic clearing operation to secure the path to the capital dozen of civilian were shot dead in other case men suspected of link to the ukrainian military were rounded up and executed lt col artyom gorodilov the regiment commander at the helm of the th oversaw operation of the paratrooper unit in bucha time investigator obtained document that confirmed the call sign he used when communicating over the radio with his troop security camera along yablunska street captured some of this radio chatter establishing that lt col gorodilov wa in command and two soldier in the th who served in bucha confirmed in interview that he wa there after russian troop retreated from the kyiv region lt col gorodilov received a promotion to colonel in april from the then head of the airborne force col gen andrey serdyukov the ceremony wa held day after the shocking image from bucha emerged neither general serdyukov nor colonel gorodilov s immediate superior at the time maj gen sergey chubarykin ha publicly announced any investigation into the carnage in the town despite the global outrage over the image a superior officer they ultimately answer for the action of the force under their command by neither stopping nor investigating the atrocity in bucha they could ultimately bear responsibility for them the russian ministry of defense the russian embassy in washington and colonel gorodilov did not respond to request for comment this year would have been the th anniversary of benefit young people will be able to officially get a job and get a housing certificate for the purchase of an apartment or house eight month after mariupol fell to russia following one of the most wa bombed by twin russian airstrikes on march and a many a people were killed in the strike in response to the devastation russia erected a screen around the building tall enough that it can be seen from space ap found caitlin mcfall is a reporter at fox news digital covering politics u s and world news medicine in the kherson region are becoming more affordable on the left bank of the dnieper the first state pharmacy began to work here you can buy medicine at competitive price the price of medicine in our pharmacy is much lower than in commercial one the mark up for vital drug is no more than and for other medicine no more than said the minister of health of kherson region vadim ilmiev the pharmacy operates in the city of henichesk at the central district hospital address prospekt mira on weekday you can buy medicine from to and on weekend from to the pharmacy present medicine of russian production buyer can pay for them in both ruble and hryvnia now in the kherson region there are no problem with medicine resident receive all the necessary drug in full and this will not be the only state pharmacy on the left bank the ministry of health still plan to open similar institution in the region on the left bank of the dnieper there is also an ambulance her phone number work around the clock dear parishioner in connection with the latest event all baptismal rite conducted by because in the independent state they set a course for the complete destruction of the only canonical orthodox denomination in this territory the ukrainian orthodox church moscow patriarchate uoc mp and the war wa declared not only by schismatics looking at parish and hungry for treasure who are a dime a dozen in ukraine but also by the state that joined them and at the head of the anti cross satanic campaign stood the president of ukraine volodymyr zelensky the kiev regime led by zelensky on which there is no cross is leading the split of orthodoxy in ukraine russian foreign ministry significant battlefield success in recent month for ukraine intense fighting continues in the small city of bakhmut in eastern donetsk where trench warfare ha become the norm concern like trench foot frostbite and gangrene have become an everyday reality for soldier dealing with the brutal condition a winter set in koval who wa a close a mile from bakhmut where some of the most brutal fighting is raging said winter camouflage gear is at the top of soldier wish list snow ha begun to carpet battlefield across ukraine and the changing weather condition not only mean soldier need winter gear like coat boot thermal sock and sleeping bag but they need cover from russia s latest weapon of choice drone drone are a relatively more affordable way for moscow to wage war against ukraine when compared to other type of missile system and the kremlin ha ramped up it drone use in recent month across the country but troop on the front line need more than air defense to counter these weapon system koval said koval described how camo cover which act a windbreaker like covering and can fit in a backpack are used to great effect to disguise soldier and their equipment to their surroundings it s literally saving their life these camo cover so they don t get shot from the sky she said the effort which is organized under a nonprofit the kovals set up evil cannot enter heaven is a family affair employed across ukraine to kill the enemy spy on it formation and guide bomb to their target but this month the ukrainian military began a program to use drone in a more unusual role to guide russian soldier who want to surrender the program had it genesis in late november when the ukrainian military released footage of a russian soldier throwing his weapon to the ground raising his hand and nervously following a path set out by a drone overhead leading him to soldier from the ukrainian army s th mechanized brigade a few week later the ukrainian general staff released an instructional video explaining how russian soldier can surrender to a ukrainian drone and it is now part of a wide ranging effort by ukraine to persuade russian soldier to give up the program called i want to live includes a phone hotline a website and a telegram channel all dedicated to communicating to russian soldier and their family it s too early to know whether the drone effort will lure russian deserter in any meaningful number but it add another avenue for ukraine to recruit russian deserter this one with a distinctly modern twist to the age old tactic of informational warfare and if nothing else it may further the erosion of russian morale on the battlefield russian defeat have already provided an opening for ukraine to exploit that low morale especially in the month after the kremlin s september mobilization which ha sent thousand of new recruit into fierce battle with little training and scant supply petro yatsenko a spokesman for ukraine s coordination headquarters for treatment of prisoner of war said in an interview monday that ukraine ha had more than direct request for information on how to surrender through the i want to live program it is not possible to independently verify the claim mr yatsenko said the military would not release information about the number of russian in ukrainian captivity for security reason andriy yusov who represents the intelligence department in ukraine s ministry of defense said ukraine had received million inquiry about the program since it wa set up on sept most of the query are coming from russia he said and the vast majority involved appeal from people who are studying for themselves or their relative the possibility of saving life in the bloody and unjust war for the past ten month both russia and ukraine have engaged in robust informational campaign targeting enemy soldier with leaflet social medium post radio appeal text message and television campaign all dedicated to convincing them to surrender in may when the russian were laying waste to town and city and beginning to gobble up land in eastern ukraine not all the gun were loaded with explosive some soviet era self propelled howitzer had shell set up to explode in the air and scatter leaflet over ukrainian controlled territory according to zvezda a russian state owned nationwide tv network run by the russian ministry of defense we give the last warning to the ukrainian nazi to surrender an artilleryman named vadim told the station more recently the russian announced that it drone operator were sending sm message to ukrainian mobile phone subscriber telling them to lay down their arm there s no evidence russia s text to surrender drone have had any impact the ukrainian campaign ha featured both high tech and low tech mean of communicating artillery unit routinely use vampire multiple launch rocket system to fire projectile filled with leaflet each across russian position hanna malyar a ukrainian deputy minister of defense said this wa one way to give russian occupier one last chance to yield themselves when there wa no internet connection otherwise the only thing that awaits them on the ukrainian land is death she said also work around the clock at an undisclosed location in kyiv taking up to call daily mr yatsenko said but just a surrendering wa considered one of the most dangerous act on the battlefield of the first world war the same is true in ukraine today with a frontline sprawling over hundred of mile and the land between the trench a treacherous wasteland of mine watched over by sniper and subject to near constant bombardment arranging a surrender present danger for all involved that is where drone come in the surrender that wa caught on the video released in november and geo located by military analyst to the eastern donbas region wa an accident of sort mr yatsenko said it wa not planned and the fact that it worked with all the possible thing that could have gone wrong made the ukrainian wa ready by early december the first step is to call the i want to live project and receive instruction and coordinate it is important to arrive at the indicated point on time and wait for the appearance of the quadcopter after which raise your hand the video informs russian after the drone show the vector of movement the prisoner must follow the drone they are told the drone will fly at walking speed and guide you to ukrainian position if the drone s battery fails then the soldier must wait for a new one to arrive to continue moving mr yatsenko said the how to surrender to a drone program is only in it infancy he would not offer precise number for russian who have surrendered to drone so far but said it wa more than a handful the ukrainian program mr yatsenko said is the first one designed to use drone on a broad scale a part of a coordinated operation to encourage surrender we are giving them a last chance to save their life he said education in the zaporozhye region a you connect gas to their home for free the fact that russian armored vehicle on railway traction began active work in the zone of a special military operation became known in early march back on march video information appeared about how our armored train is calmly and confidently working in the southern direction of the svo he then helped in the evacuation of civilian moved in the zone of melitopol at that time the usual passenger train took citizen of foreign country towards the crimea by rail and the russian armored train covered this departure ensuring the safety of hundred of people time ha passed some task have been adjusted but the main goal of those who work under the cover of armor on the rail remained the same they should help to ensure the safety of those who perform the main task of the cbo on a daily basis yes this updated armored train ha sufficient armored coverage yes the main possibly vulnerable part of the composition tied to steel line are protected to the right extent here on the platform there are weapon of different type along the entire train equipment and firepower are competently placed proper shelter are equipped to fire and repel enemy attack both from the ground and from the air of course the question arises what kind of equipment is the special train equipped with engineer and developer respond a follows the latest technology which is designed for technical reconnaissance and mine clearance and also for the restoration of partially destroyed railway track plus small artificial structure with not the most serious damage the locomotive of the armored train is located approximately in the middle of the train why is this done to exclude the possibility of disabling the locomotive with the first blow of the enemy in the tail and in the head of the composition are placed armor capsule those who serve on an armored train have small arm of all type ranging from an assault rifle to a heavy machine gun it is armed with an anti aircraft gun for the destruction of air and ground target the main caliber is a twin millimeter gun equipped with position for sniper since the main task of the special armored train remains to ensure the safety of military echelon with various cargo personnel and equipment today it regularly move forward studying the route a team of driver of such a train is ready to instantly respond to any threat for example they can accelerate quite sharply in the event of a surprise attack by the enemy but basically an armored train follows it steel path not very fast it doe not have the task of setting speed record and in front of each bridge and overpass it certainly make the necessary stop the armored train dy down for a while bristling with barrel and the soldier of the mine demolition platoon move forward they are covered by arrow from the head platform fighter check the condition of the embankment carefully inspect the fence they visually study the bridge support whether there are any explosive device there there is insurance this is a special installation on an armored train it suppresses the signal of radio controlled landmines in general in case of a possible explosion of a steel highway a special platform always go in the head and by the way it ensures the safety of traffic not only of military echelon it should be noted that if necessary a special train of the railway troop of the western military district can become a reliable cover for train with a civilian population that is our armored train ha already left it spare track and it s moving in the right direction military in captivity from january the tax system will change in russia all organization and entrepreneur will switch to a single tax payment this will significantly simplify the mechanism of mandatory payment of tax in simple word now taxpayer legal entity and people doing business will be enough to deposit fund for all tax item at once to a single account indicating only two detail the amount of payment and tin nothing more need to be done in the outgoing year in the region of russia such a measure wa introduced a an experiment for citizen only the name it received the single tax payment now the innovation will extend to entrepreneur the essence of the unified tax account is a follows all the payer s money is added to one basket that is a person doe not need to pay different tax separately for example transport or for land real estate etc in the taxpayer s personal account or according to the detail of the tax authority at the place of residence he simply deposit a certain arbitrary amount into the account and the tax authority themselves distribute it a necessary thus tax can be paid in advance and all in one account maintenance of the en excludes the presence of both debt and overpayment for different type of payment the amount remaining after the distribution of item can be returned within one day since this system is a novelty for resident of the kherson region the local administration of the federal tax service will hold an open day on december in the form of a seminar at which the tax authority will give all explanation about the innovation employee of the tax service of kherson region will also talk about the nuance of registration and re registration of taxpayer and special tax regime there will be two such seminar in skadovsk and henichesk both start at in skadovsk kherson resident are waiting in the house of culture at the address mariinskaya street in henichesk the event will be held at the address kovalenko brother street attention entrepreneur of kherson region can send question to the tax authority in advance until on december by e mail nalog khogov ru the integration of the new region into russian legislation continues another step on this path wa the ruble zone it ha been operating here for several month because since the end of may the currency ha been put into full circulation all shop outlet bazaar and market have long used only ruble however from january settlement in hryvnia are completely stopped in all district of the region the corresponding decree wa signed by the acting governor vladimir saldo also recently this wa stated by the head of the kakhovka administration pavel filipchuk he appealed to the resident of the district and recalled that since the beginning of october the russian currency ha been the main one in the region i remind you that since october our kherson region is a full fledged subject of the russian federation therefore we live according to the law of the russian federation from january the ukrainian hryvnia completes it turnover in the territory of the kherson region therefore you definitely need to exchange cash in bank of kherson region said pavlo filipchuk he also added that for many resident of the kherson region russian ruble have long become a convenient currency which is now also stable and promising a complete rejection of the hryvnia will help to resolve all dispute over the exchange rate and currency exchange i am sure that this is a timely practical and correct decision to complete the life of the hryvnia and a full fledged transition to the russian ruble the stable currency of our state filipchuk added according to the resident of the region themselves the rejection of ukrainian money will not affect their life in any way because for the entire time they are in russia the population actively u ruble we re even more comfortable that way first it is easier to pay in store because seller do not have to look for hryvnia which are almost gone in the region secondly it is simply more pleasant for u to pay in ruble and know that we have russian money in our hand the currency of the state which we love and respect and recently officially live builder from other region of the russian federation approach the problem comprehensively a large amount of work is being carried out inspection current repair modernization with the use of new equipment etc restoration work is underway at quarterly boiler house almost all were built in soviet time and work on morally and physically obsolete and worn out equipment even in donetsk the equipment is very old it s just dangerous to use say the master of repair of heating system ivan trofimov even in a provincial russian town you will not find such a thing we change everything slowly we bring new one the main thing is to spend the heating season normally and then we will put everything in order there s a lot of work to be done but then the heat will come to each house strictly on schedule so that winter and shelling do not freeze the city russian builder have formed emergency and technical reserve the reserve of material and labor ha been formed in sufficient quantity for the prompt resolution of issue and the conduct of all work the ministry of construction of russia said where boiler house cannot be restored at all they are completely destroyed or are in the zone of constant shelling by the armed force of ukraine heat is supplied through block modular boiler house in total by the end of the year it is planned to mount such mini boiler house about thousand private and apartment building in the new region are subject to restoration they were destroyed by the armed force of ukraine which leaving city and town turned them after themselves into a zone of continuous ruin but russian specialist have been working for the past nine month for a reason housing is being repaired the systematic supply of building material and well functioning work will allow the administration of settlement to restore about more private house by the end of the year promised the minister of construction and housing of the dpr eduard osipov earlier thousand private residential building were restored in the dpr in total by the end of the year it is planned to restore more than thousand square of housing of all kind in the republic this is reported by the ministry of construction of the russian federation by the way in the new region that have become part of the russian federation the national project housing and urban environment will be implemented which includes the fourth federal project mortgage in it is planned to develop comprehensive full fledged program that provide for the replacement and modernization of infrastructure utility and dilapidated housing in the dpr he further called on the fsb border guard to protect russia s border including those in the annexed region putin attempted to seize earlier this year russia s troop have not only colder and energy need are becoming more and more therefore of course the situation for kiev is getting worse and worse by the light yes we see picture from space a dark spot and what do they have fall to the very billion cubic meter that they produce they will be self sufficient it certainly doesn t make it any easier for them but maybe they ll somehow pa it off a their own achievement however russian airstrikes are pounding the country s vital infrastructure cutting off electricity and heat and depriving them of drinking water but general frost on which the russian have relied for century to help defeat the country s enemy ha also turned it weapon against president vladimir putin s soldier the russian force who have been fighting on putin s order against their slavic brother for month are reportedly dying from hypothermia because their uniform no longer hold up to severe eurasian winter the fiasco stem from several odd decision made by the post soviet military leadership and by putin himself the soviet red army uniform wa a poor man s version of the imperial russian army dress from the th century in the run up to world war ii when russia had the largest army in europe approximately million soldier moscow prioritized low cost but effective couture compared to the pompous flashy design favored by the czarist general the uniform wa practical with no frill other than a bright distinctive insignia worn by senior officer that made them easy target for german marksman the winter wear included a greatcoat or half length fur coat a cap with ear flap and thick felt wool valenki footwear worn by the russian military and civilian alike for hundred of year designed for extreme russian winter the uniform helped the russian force beat the french in and the german in napoleon bonaparte admitted that the russian winter wa largely responsible for the disintegration of his army many of hitler s lightly clad nazi troop also froze to death an exception wa the officer field cap that proudly sported a new russian national symbol the double headed eagle which the soldier dubbed mutated chicken igor sergeyev who rose to defense minister in under yeltsin but wa fired by putin in made russian military dress look like that of the u s army and anatoliy serdyukov who wa also fired by putin ordered winter uniform to be slim and tailored but the biggest uproar in the rank erupted after the radical change made by a famous fashion designer valentin yudashkin known for his theatrical style yudashkin s evening gown are displayed in the metropolitan museum of art in new york the california museum of fashion in los angeles and the museum of fashion and textile in paris service member complained that the uniform wa made of cheap synthetic material making them too hot in summer it pocket were too small and didn t fit a mobile phone or identification paper and other document velcro patch fell off button disappeared within two week stitching came apart and color faded after a couple of wash the uniform wa also inappropriate for combat because it made a rustling sound with movement and melted in fire most importantly the designer uniform wa also too flimsy for russian winter because instead of natural textile like cotton linen and wool it wa made of new high tech material the russian soldier joked that at minus celsius they started jumping up and down to keep warm and at minus they couldn t wait for the enemy to shoot them to spare them from freezing to death putin s current defense minister banned yudashkin s invention the minute he assumed his post in prompting the famed fashionista to blame the russian military authority for playing dolce gabbana rather than following his design recommendation current russian defense minister sergei shoigu made a series of his own innovation since shoigu ha no military experience himself he didn t want to visually appear a being outranked by his army men shoigu introduced the limit to the number of medal worn on the ceremonial military dress to allowing only those earned in combat until then russian serviceman participating in military parade on red square decorated themselves with several dozen medal arranged in four or five row that didn t fit on their chest many of them civilian and therefore meaningless the most radical change to the russian uniform wa introduced by putin himself in september by presidential decree putin banned the famous russian military papakha headdress which wa worn by russian and previously soviet general and high ranking office made of the fur skinned from day old baby lamb of a special breed called karakul these hat kept the russian general warm because the fur bristle were thick densely set and water repellant but putin and shoigu chose to replace the papakhas with much le costly cap made of rabbit fur with the vain russian military brass having prioritized style and copying the west over functionality in the post soviet uniform it is hardly surprising that their force are shivering to death a winter set in on the battlefield while the troop look dapper during the famous russian military parade pleasing putin and his lieutenant they are
