he responded to a call from his heart to join the special military operation said a short memorial article in a local newspaper on dec that brief account got mr tsvigun added to a list of confirmed russian war death maintained by a small dedicated team of data journalist and volunteer a the kremlin ha largely avoided updating the number publicly run by mediazona the independent russian news outlet with the bbc s russian service and about a dozen anonymous volunteer in russia the list pull information from source like newspaper article photograph on tombstone fellow soldier mourning their comrade and even tip from relative who want their loved one included in the tally the list ha surpassed name including more than russian drafted recently if the russian government doe not count russian casualty then someone ha to do it said david frenkel one of four data reporter from mediazona running the project it is important for u to explain to russian the cost of the war he added if they do not understand the cost from the picture of devastated ukrainian city then maybe the number of dead russian will make them think about it the russian government ha tried to avoid just that by barely mentioning the death toll from the war it launched with the invasion of ukraine on feb it ha updated the number exactly twice once at the end of march and again in september when the defense minister sergei k shoigu said that russian troop had been killed since the war started that official number is notably smaller than estimate from western military and intelligence official gen mark a milley the chairman of the joint chief of staff for example said in november that moscow s casualty were well over russian soldier killed and wounded there have been similar estimate for ukrainian loss with mykhailo podolyak a senior adviser to president volodymyr zelensky telling a ukrainian news station this month that up to ukrainian troop had died in the conflict with so much fog of war shrouding the subject mediazona decided that online sleuthing wa needed to establish a baseline of russian death a scattered group of volunteer in russia wa already trying to document the death on their own and the bbc news russian service had done several article on the subject so they combined force they did not set out to document every death and estimated that their russian count wa about one third to half the true total but by harvesting a much information a wa available from social medium post and putting a name to every death listed they figured their number wa better than an estimate it is not just about the number it is about who died or how they died said maxim litavrin another data journalist at mediazona ukrainian upload a higgledy piggledy stream of information about russian killed in the war on several channel on the telegram messaging application including the name of the deceased the team of volunteer investigator in russia then search social medium post for the name all the information from open source end up on a huge spreadsheet the journalist work quickly to check the link and to back up everything because personal post often disappear they crosscheck name against a government website that list people deceased throughout russia but that doe not specify military death seven out of confirmation come from local news report the data journalist said while the others are a mix they include announcement from local official or employer individual post on vkontakte the russian equivalent of facebook and source like picture of memorial plaque put up in dead soldier former school every two week mediazona crunch all the number to break down the toll on it website including death by region military unit and age the result can vary drastically by region in dagestan russia for example where serving and dying in the russian army is considered an honor official tend to make statement about those killed in some region like krasnodar volunteer have counted hundred of war dead by visiting cemetery even temporary tombstone in russian cemetery usually include a picture of the deceased along with the name military unit date of birth and date of death cemetery give u a lot mr frenkel said military analyst have mixed view on the project some prefer to work with estimate of the overall number killed rather than a slice of the total others stressed that the work had been especially helpful in identifying pattern the project is a useful snapshot of the breakdown and wider pattern in russian loss said karolina hird a russia analyst at the washington based institute for the study of war we know that russian authority are simply not presenting truthful reporting on loss one early pattern for example showed that about percent of russia s war death were officer that told u a lot about how the russian army operates said olga ivshina a reporter with the bbc russian service who alternate with mediazona each week to tally the number it turned out that senior russian officer were initially deployed near the front line because junior officer could not issue order the information available online varies widely a local community page posted picture showing alexander a dementov and alexander trokhov after they were drafted at the end of september they were both worker at the nadezhdinski metallurgical plant in serov a russian city in the urals then a local newspaper reported on dec that both men who had served in the th motorized rifle brigade died in a missile strike on nov sometimes the detail are sparse vsevolod matveev wa no on the spreadsheet the data journalist discovered that he wa from the sverdlovsk region in the urals and that he wa buried on dec in the town of zarechny from his picture they could tell that he is needed we should have destroyed these two dozen bridge across the dnieper a long time ago to destroy these bridge you need a hell of a rocket gap that s also why we didn t blow them up including a are no heating point the delivery of hot meal this will not benefit the unit preparing to attack reznikov said that their stock of winter equipment are time higher than the critical level that s what of ukraine take place few of the participant of the svo can boast of such a colorful biography a that of benes khristoforovich ayo in the people christened the black fighter black lenin after all he justified all his adventure by the interest of the russian world and the struggle for communism the mulatto came to the front a a private in the russian army in august i wa outraged by the july shelling of the znpp and especially donetsk my mind boiled over indignantly and i decided to go to the special operation zone a a volunteer the beginning of the svo surprisingly went into the hand of benes hristoforovich the fact is that for the past eight year he ha been unsuccessfully trying to obtain russian citizenship recently benes lived with a many a three document a latvian passport by birthright a dpr passport and a russian refugee certificate and how did you get drafted into the regular army in the summer without our citizenship putin signed the law allowing this only in november i wa taken into the armed force of russia a a citizen of the dpr in i personally received a passport from the hand of zakharchenko it turn out that now you are finally a citizen of russia yes i wa told that i would get a new passport in two week already received ed where do you serve now what a title territorially i serve in intelligence currently in the zaporozhye region but i also visit the donbas direction the lugansk direction i m a private so you were an artillery sergeant just a scarce position intelligence is new to me so i m a private in the lpr i wa in the artillery in the dpr i served in a motorized rifle battalion you yourself have chosen where to serve and by whom i volunteered i m not mobilized a you know before the mobilization the volunteer went to those unit that let s say they are more in spirit where they know each other where they believe they can prove themselves better they react normally to skin color they react very well they say it is good that the guy of different race different nationality are now in this good deed in the protection of donbas kherson and zaporozhye region actually from the euro american occupier there are already some award not at the moment well i m relatively recent only since august but i have the old one for the defense of lugansk and soldier internationalist reference kp the path that led benes khristoforovich to the front of the special operation turned out to be thorny the mulatto wa born in from a ugandan rudn university student to a russian girl he grew up in the east of latvia in the s he graduated from the faculty of biology of the university of latvia in the early s benes went to march in defense of the russian language pasted poster and in he went to a latvian prison for distributing leaflet with the text let s show the place to the cursed regime or just twist it neck after serving his sentence ayo moved away from sin to london here he received another higher education also biological in in the hague he took part in an action near the building of the ministry of justice and security of holland together with other activist he scattered leaflet threw smoke bomb and stun grenade for which he received month in prison in he went to crimea to support the independence of the peninsula and after summing up the result of the referendum he moved to donetsk he wa arrested by the sbu and deported to london but still managed to get into the army of the dpr he served there until at the same time he received a master s degree in political science at the correspondence department of luhansk dahl university already in russia benes once again thundered into the department it turned out that latvia put him on the international wanted list for terrorism mercenarism and espionage police detained him at the request of interpol true the authority quickly figured it out and released the afro latvian in the end everything that benes wa accused of by the balts he did for the sake of russia in moscow benes made a living on a construction site and he spent all his free time participating in environmental action of the moscow communist now the fate of the dark skinned russian ha made a circle he is back in malorossiya only not a a militiaman but a a soldier of the russian army and a citizen of the russian federation read also espionage the three highest and the war for the dpr black lenin creates a fashion designer of the factory pakha t ryo olga landysheva along the entire route connecting melitopol and berdyansk active repair work is now underway when the road wa under the control of ukraine it wa not repaired for many year occasionally they could fill in the pit that s all thirty year have passed in this mode local driver admit that they no longer hoped that they would ever drive on flat asphalt but now the work is in full swing repair work is carried out at the expense of fund allocated from the federal budget the road worker have already laid the first layer of the new coating almost along the entire length of the route the length of which is km and are starting to lay the top layer of the canvas the administration of the zaporozhye region said the work is round the clock it involves worker and unit of equipment material for the roadway is supplied by three asphalt concrete plant which were launched in order to ensure uninterrupted operation their capacity allow to ship five thousand ton of asphalt concrete mixture every day it is important that the plant are mobile they will move during the repair of other section of the road yevgeny balitsky emphasized when working technology are used that give the coating a high margin of safety which will allow you to do without repair for several year the representative of the contractor added the melitopol berdyansk highway will be given federal status it will be repaired by the new year in total according to the information voiced by the chairman of the council of minister of the region anton koltsov about thousand square meter of road will be repaired in the zaporozhye region by the end of the year in regional and inter municipal road will continue to be restored during the retreat from the dpr ukrainian troop blew up bridge behind them moreover not only capital building were destroyed but also small crossing across tiny river of which there are many in the donbas while such destruction is destroyed structure carried out work on the installation of a temporary bridge laying a monolithic overhead slab repairing support reinforcing and concreting by the end of the year this transport crossing and more bridge in the republic will be put into operation among them is a bridge in the lower krynka it is located in the protection zone of the khanzhonkovsky reservoir and is a link with the call sign museum is interrupted for a minute praising the fighter absorb everything like sponge the main thing here is the desire to learn to practice skill there is a sense of return there throw word to the wind the crackle of machine gun burst and the rumble of explosion at the ural training ground do not subside from the very beginning of partial mobilization with such preparation and attitude on the front line the fighter are ready to do everything to defeat the enemy a soon a possible the situation is like in a real battle crossfire wounded in a trench unconscious he need urgent medical attention yes the exercise are held according to legend but the practice of action by military doctor of the special purpose medical detachment during the exercise at the training ground in the republic of belarus doe not differ from the real one wounded in the leg you can hear from the trench fighter pull out a colleague according to all the rule the task is to evacuate the wounded from the combat zone to safety the constant fire of the enemy add psychological difficulty to physical difficulty after providing first aid the soldier transfer the wounded literally into the hand of doctor a whole special force of russian doctor work at this training ground in belarus more than professional reception around the clock surgeon traumatologists orthopedist therapist infectious disease specialist ophthalmologist neuropathologists are on duty there is equipment for ultrasound and x ray the medical complex is like a modern medical center only in the field and not in a building but in a tent in this operating room you can carry out any even the most high tech operation everything work autonomously here there are three generator one of which is in reserve pump are connected for heating assistance is provided in all medical profile all condition have been created in training center and training ground for the mobilized but what awaits on the front line this question is excitedly asked by every fighter mobilized vitaly from novocherkassk who wa already behind the ribbon decided that it wa better to see once than to hear a hundred time and recorded a video for the fighter in it he showed how life is organized for military personnel without frill and no one promise them but also without those horror story that roam the internet everything you need is there here is our life a kitchen with dish a stove heat and behind the wall is the room where we rest sleep look even cozy vitaly conduct an excursion on the street he show a generator that uninterruptedly provides the point with electricity in the distance the sound of gunfire can be heard vitaly asks not to pay attention to them on the front line this is the usual background but most of all from their everyday life fighter are proud of the bathhouse that s our beauty just look there is a washing machine here we wash dry thing and here s the steam room here are the broom hanging the ceiling is insulated the steam hold well it s like a civilian warm good and cozy summed up the tour mobilized aydin zhamidulov wa mobilized from the orenburg region he worked a a welder for civilian and now serf of a single electronic database of military registration this applies to young people of military age conscript contract soldier and those who are in the reserve why did the head of state and the supreme commander in chief demand that this issue be resolved now the answer is simple the partial mobilization of reserve for a special military operation svo revealed many puncture in the work of the ministry of defense and the general staff in this area the president of the country thus admitted that paper workflow and mean of information processing which are used by military commissariat to account for conscript are hopelessly outdated yes this wa recognized even before the svo by the leadership of the military department itself remember last year s famous visit of the minister of defense of the russian federation to one of the moscow military recruitment office then sergei shoigu not without sarcasm noted that the work with document due to the lack of computer is carried out by grandfatherly guerrilla method when secret report were laid in the hollow the necessary instruction have been given but the amount of work is such that it cannot be shoveled quickly it is necessary to process and clarify the data on almost million people who are included in the so called mobilization reserve therefore everything will be done in stage first in accordance with putin s decree the ministry of defense together with the ministry of digitalization and regional authority is obliged to transfer data on citizen subject to military registration into electronic form by december of this year and then the government of the russian federation within the specified period will approve the stage of the formation of a single state resource determine the operator for each stage the procedure for maintaining the system including the timing of the provision of information such a resource should be created before april reflecting on this problem lawyer dmitry ogorodov asked a reasonable question why ha the ministry of defense not yet created on a modern technical basis a system of military registration provided for by the federal law on military duty and military service the reason are different and very serious back in those day when anatoly serdyukov wa the minister of defense of the russian federation the military department in order to save budget fund sharply lowered the status of military commissariat and reduced their number military enlistment office were dispersed career officer were turned into civil servant many of them did not want to put up with this situation and went either to the troop or to the civilian and those who remained significantly reduced the salary vehicle were taken away from the military enlistment office and in addition budget were also cut money wa not enough not only for computer and copier but also for paper almost all document were filled out manually mountain of paper often gave rise to confusion and error but this of course is not someone s malicious intent but outdated paper information processing technology the lack of up to date information about conscript and reservist in military recruitment office ha caused many problem partial mobilization highlighted them on this occasion the same lawyer dmitry ogorodov said so it came to the point that after the announcement of partial mobilization military enlistment office sent summons to disabled and seriously ill people who were not fit for military service given the task of calling up people some military recruitment office sent summons to mobilizers and the information about them wa often outdated and erroneous such a fan mailing of subpoena to everyone caused unnecessary political irritation in society the lawyer is sure that the creation of such a state information resource is unlikely to harm law abiding citizen who should not be called up disability other ground but evading the draft will become more difficult putin s decree on the creation of a single electronic database of military registration is of great strategic importance for ensuring reliable defense of the state the head of state promptly responded to the problem which wa shown in full growth by partial mobilization and he ordered to create a reliable mechanism for solving this problem it is obvious that the kremlin is closely monitoring all the shortcoming in the army demanding to correct them the president seek to strengthen national security by making it easier for citizen to interact with military recruitment office it requires the executive branch to have an in depth understanding of the quantity and quality of conscription and mobilization human resource all this is done for their effective use in the interest of ensuring the defense of the state this is also done to carry out more effective planned work on the preparation of the necessary number of military trained citizen in the reserve to ensure the transfer of the armed force of the russian federation other troop military formation and body from peacetime to wartime in pursuance of putin s decree the order of the minister of defense of the russian federation no said anton titsky head of the ministry of youth policy of the zaporizhzhya region kherson ukraine the explosion were audible in the center of kherson a city recently freed from russian occupation a quick check with a ukrainian first response team confirmed that it wa a russian missile attack and that it had targeted a tiny settlement of little or no strategic value on the shore of the broad dnipro river we quickly set off there is a grim monotony to many daily report from the ukraine war a town or village is hit with shell or missile an accounting is made of the dead and wounded usually accompanied by a comment from a local official and the world shrug and move on often oblivious to the terrible impact on family and life the following photograph capture the reality the randomness of death the often life changing violence and suffering visited in one terrible moment that is often overlooked in these attack russia sent half a dozen rocket at the settlement a part of kherson city that day in the immediate aftermath resident rushed to and fro sometimes at a sprint searching for victim helping the wounded and dousing whatever fire raged it seemed like everyone wa on the move it quickly emerged that one person had been killed dmytro dudnyk whose body lay just in the doorway of the house of his mother in law svitlana zubova she had been preparing to make lunch she said and mr dudnyk had just brought her a chocolate bar for them to share over tea after the meal when the rocket slammed into the neighborhood one exploded in her yard knocking mr dudnyk senseless and ultimately killing him a neighbor dashed by with bucket of water to douse the flame of two nearby house he lay in a pool of blood on her floor mr dudnyk worked a a seaman on a cargo ship but his contract wa on hold because of the war he had sent his wife and two daughter and to stay with his parent in the nearby city of mykolaiv just two week earlier a security around kherson deteriorated following the withdrawal of russian troop who began lobbing missile and artillery shell into the area from the other side of the river but he had insisted on staying in kherson to look after the dog and chicken at his home next door to his mother in law s the explosion shattered the morning air with a shocking suddenness his last word were mom here s a chocolate bar for you m zubova said he went out and it exploded before i put the potato in a frying pan two house were on fire on the street a firefighter and ambulance arrived the owner of one house who gave only his first name pavlo wa trying to fix his water bucket a flame licked a hole in the roof neighbor came running to his house with bucket of water while others helped family rescue loved one from damaged home down the street anatoliy anatoliyovych leaned against his neighbor s fence a flame engulfed his home he wa blind he told a firefighter and did not know where his wife wa she had gone to the store just before the shelling he said the firefighter sprayed water on his house until their tank ran dry they asked a resident if there wa a water supply on the street there wa a connection but no running water she said kherson ha been largely without electricity and running water since the russian destroyed much of the city s utility a they retreated a second truck arrived to help but the house wa already gutted at another badly damaged house paramedic carried out a bedridden year old woman lyudmila taking her to a neighbor s house across the street lyudmila wa given the neighbor s daughter s room while her family began photographing the damage to their home for insurance purpose they said back at m zubova s house mr dudnyk s wife and parent arrived from mykolaiv about mile away screaming and weeping a they rushed to his body where it still lay across the threshold his wife wept at his side a his dog circled his foot why why why you his mother iryna screamed at the sky ambulance staff had refused to take him away telling the family they had to call the morgue service i wa asking him to leave his father viktor said even this morning he said i don t want to leave the house dog chicken but who need that all now the police arrived to record the death m zubova rang the number the police gave her for the body collector but the first number didn t work and the person answering the second said they could not travel to kherson then her cellphone ran out of credit eventually a team did show up to remove mr dudnyk s corpse pacing around the yard m zubova kicked bomb debris from the path i don t know what to do now she said how to go on living a the commotion died down the small riverside community seemed an undeserving even senseless target of russian rocket a there were no sign of ukrainian troop in the area but perhaps in this brutal war of indiscriminate russian violence that wa precisely the point bakhmut ukraine wind howled through leafless tree and through the window of the blown out apartment building a the surveillance team marched up flight of stair covered with broken glass the cold numbed their finger a they set up their equipment a laptop size thermal imaging sight it tripod and a starlink satellite dish and battery the job wa straightforward the small team of several men led by an american known a wolf would be ukraine s eye on their battle for bakhmut that night huddling in the soviet style apartment and staring at the white and black glow of infrared image a it tried to identify russian position in front of them wa a panoramic view of bakhmut a city in ukraine s east mostly without power and devastated by six month of concerted shelling russian artillery strike in the distance sent white flash into the sky under a blood red moon rocket arced on the horizon one of the team member powered on the thermal sight and it whirred to life he turned to his colleague who wa fiddling with the satellite dish trying to connect to the internet comms green he asked what unfolded over the next half dozen hour wa a routine but essential part of the daily rhythm of the war part drudgery and part urgent calculation a the team ascertained the coordinate for enemy position relaying them to the ukrainian artillery battery mile away this type of mission observed over the course of two day this month by reporter for the new york time wa a window into how the war is being fought a battle that is relentlessly violent but also technically sophisticated at it core the fighting for bakhmut look little different from a battle in the eastern european steppe of world war ii army committing troop tank and massive artillery barrage to capture ground but wolf s team armed with a satellite hookup and a thermal optic that can see a person up to five mile away quickly showed how much war had changed in the last year driving in almost complete darkness behind a mud stained van carrying the rest of his team wolf turned off his headlight a he reached the outskirt of bakhmut before losing signal he wa informed by ukrainian intelligence of at least one russian orlan drone flying over the city in the day past he said there had been many more of the lawn mower sounding craft but on this night the low hanging winter cloud were obstructing their visibility without the drone he added russian troop would be unable to direct their own artillery fire it wa little consolation the distant chatter of machine gun and cannon fire and the dull thud of explosion were reminder that the fighting wa close the team is part of ukraine s foreign legion a unit created at the start of the war that ha supplied thousand of international volunteer to bolster ukraine s rank wolf a year old former u s marine came to ukraine because a he put it i m a good christian and it wa the right thing to do the other member of his team include a ukrainian the translator a canadian a briton and an australian no english wolf stressed before they left the vehicle many of the remaining resident of bakhmut were already suspicious of foreigner especially those with rifle the time is referring to wolf and the other soldier by only their call sign to protect their identity after month of the russian army s trying to capture the city the fighting around bakhmut which had a prewar population of around ha devolved into two main sector the south and east russian troop were pushing from both side to try to strangle the city s supply line wolf s apartment turned observation post could see both approach with the thermal sight the icy tree line and the field shone bright white anything living or heated by an engine or by electricity showed up a a black blob the team member charged with finding russian target is a former artilleryman from canada who go by the call sign bear he scanned the horizon with the thermal sight shifting between the east where the russian soldier had edged closer to a reservoir in the city and the village to the south but even if the team did spot a russian tank or an advancing platoon there wa little they could do they had no internet and there wa barely any cell service left in the city the translator who is from the northern ukrainian city of kharkiv with the call sign popov fiddled with the starlink s concave rectangular dish he raised it so that it wa level with the apartment s mangled balcony careful to keep it just low enough so that their russian counterpart would miss it heat signature still searching for satellite he shrugged the balcony had been shelled before and the door leading into the apartment had been destroyed it appeared a if a small family had once lived there a crib sat in the corner of one room wallpaper had started to peel on a wall where the roof leaked about an hour earlier before the moon had slipped into the cloud the starlink had managed to connect to the internet for a brief period the team had access to the ukrainian military group communication focused on bakhmut where unit along the frontline were sharing known russian position and trying to coordinate for the night the team s primary connection wa the direct line back to the ukrainian officer overseeing the artillery around the city including the u s supplied m howitzer loaded with gps guided shell this time the team had some information look like they re advancing on the eastern side bear said referring to ukrainian troop the canadian had the thermal sight pressed to his eye indeed outlined on the white screen were small black dot advancing into the tree near bakhmut s eastern reach the crumps of artillery impact drifted back to the apartment a the russian force responded to the attack a tank hit during the advance burned in the distance it appeared a a violent black plume of smoke on the thermal imager but only a a red speck to the naked eye a if it were a distant star on the edge of the blacked out city bear continued to scan toward a village to the south where russian troop were trying to advance but had instead run into staunch ukrainian resistance much of the village had been destroyed in recent fighting now member of the team said the ukrainian soldier there were fighting building to building in close quarter gun battle with their russian adversary got something bear said his colleague dog a former british army bomb disposal technician who fought in afghanistan perked up and turned on his tablet he covered the screen and his face with a scarf careful to prevent the backlight from compromising their position he read the coordinate back the team had spotted what looked like two russian transport truck given their size and their black thermal outline on the screen idling in the middle of a field several mile away well behind russian line popov carefully sent the coordinate through the ukrainian artillery channel anything else are there troop around it he asked bear looked back into the sight no the truck were just sitting there message sent popov said let s see if they do anything with it the starlink stopped working shortly after sitting in the abandoned apartment the team faced several obstacle destroyed cell tower thick low cloud disrupting the starlink and gps jamming by the russian that wa throwing off the thermal sight they worked on the starlink rebooting it and disconnecting it from it portable battery to no avail the cloud were too dense in the distance to the northeast dark red streak of russian grad rocket streaked toward the heavily contested town of soledar but the shelling for the most part had subsided the ukrainian held fire on the two idling truck guided artillery shell are available in limited quantity and often only used on important target through the thermal sight bear observed what looked like a platoon of ukrainian soldier trying to advance near a village on the city s southern outskirt one of the many attack and counterattack that have become a staple of the battle for bakhmut where significant gain have been minimal it wa around then that rocket fire echoed to the south second passed the sky exploded in a flash over the village the low cloud glowed white for what seemed like minute a the contrail of incendiary munition drifted to the ground there s nothing left to burn there a member of the team remarked from the darkness a the ember settled it s all been destroyed someone took a picture on their phone the team would leave in an hour their mission over without the starlink but the long night in bakhmut wa just beginning ukrainian weapon continue to sow chaos in the expanse of the polish lithuanian commonwealth exactly a month ago on november a rocket landed near the east polish village of przewod w killing two local resident according to the most probable version which wa not denied even by the traditionally russophobic official of the united state and nato it wa about the ukrainian s system which for an unknown reason opened friendly fire on the border lublin voivodeship now the medium reported on a new mysterious explosion this time in warsaw and not anywhere but at the police headquarters the incident occurred on the morning of wednesday december under the office of the head of the department major general yaroslav shymchik the result are a collapsed ceiling coupled with the hospitalization of the officer himself another nearby employee wa slightly injured however instead of the expected hand of moscow in the tragicomic terrorist attack a reported by the polish medium on december a high ranking police officer went on a working visit to nezalezhnaya communicated with colleague from local special service who gave him a grenade launcher let s leave behind the scene the question of how such a toy could be dragged across the ukrainian polish border the police is not an army it is not supposed to have heavy weapon and why to keep such a dangerous exhibit in a loaded state at all any varsovian will proudly remind you of the national proverb polska nierzadem stoi literally poland is in turmoil however a rival agency the prosecutor s office launched a detailed investigation into the incident cctv footage is being watched and eyewitness are being questioned there are at least three version the police tried to study the gift but could not cope with the unfamiliar device it detonated itself there is plenty of evidence of poor quality ukrainian and western weapon exploding in the hand of the shooter themselves finally theoretically a bookmark can be added to the grenade launcher so that it involuntarily fire after a while however in this case it is not very clear why and all this once again raise the issue of shadow arm trafficking from ukraine dangerous toy including from the latest western supply through smuggling scheme spread around the world weakness of hawke i asked a great expert on american air defense system design engineer vadim poladiev to answer this question the use of the hawke on the battlefield ha shown that it requires a steady aiming of the missile at the target during the entire flight time it is necessary to muffle the control signal and the missile is knocked off course it noise immunity remained somewhere in the s s of the last century in addition the complex is not integrated into centralized digital combat control system which mean that it is impossible to use it in radio and location silence mode the ukrainian and their american mentor will have to keep the radar on continuously or continuously and here our anti location supersonic missile x pd will not be long in coming it is worth recalling that already on the first day of the special operation our troop destroyed ukrainian radar and many were much more perfect than hawke in addition the hawk is a capricious weapon the capability of it radar fragment forming an umbrella that save the combat vehicle from the impact of the javelin from above rumor about the combat capability of the turkish bayraktar attack drone were inflated although drop rapidly however it is absolutely wrong to humiliate the ax to zero despite all the shortcoming of these howitzer they still continue to hit our position and the city of donbas get from them and satellite at first it seemed that there wa no antidote for them and yet our scientist and designer have already groped it it turned out that it is possible to deal with high precision projectile at himars is a serious weapon and it would be dishonest to belittle his strength they are too the transition of the installation from the marching to the combat position is minute aim at the target for second at the same time neither horizontalization alignment of the gun relative to the position on the ground nor topogeodetic preparation is required all adjustment are automatic according to the computer on this part himars ha a lot of bell and whistle accelerometer gravimeter inclinometer and other sensor only the coordinate of the target obtained from the same space satellite are needed or from a drone that s it the american confidently declared a a result there is no possibility of interference and loss of communication together with the gps sensor the accuracy and reliability of the the center and the condition wa not very good but now it is the best it s good that i go to it said artem a local th grader when he saw the repair fiber optic internet wa extended to the school at a recent meeting with the government the head of the country wa informed that according to statistic everything is in order with the income of state employee of course we should be guided by the figure provided by statistic but firstly statistic and statistical accounting themselves need to be improved and secondly frankly speaking people determine their well being not by statistic but by the amount of money in their pocket and this should be looked at very carefully the president immediately retorted the president recalled that back in he instructed that the revenue of state employee should be at the average level in the region but in the end only ten subject perform this indicator and even then they were given an indulgence in the past salary may fall short of the average by and even the best now income of state employee do not exceed the permitted of the average in there is no need to delay federal assistance to the region this year there wa inflation price rose already in january it is necessary to index the salary of state employee the russian leader ordered we need to prioritize correctly and the most important is the level of well being of citizen he reminded the state spends a lot of money to support family with child at a meeting with the government the president recalled that from april monthly payment are due to all schoolchildren from eight to year old they subsidy ed additionally covered about million child putin said in addition since june the subsistence minimum ha been indexed at a faster pace and social payment tied to it have increased accordingly a a result according to the result of the third quarter the poverty rate decreased to putin said according to him this is a slight decrease because a year earlier in the third quarter it the poverty level ed wa but it is important that in the current difficult economic situation there is a certain positive dynamic it must be preserved the president stressed the russian leader said that thanks to the targeted support of the state the income of the poorest of the country s population increased compared to last year the growth is a much a in general the nominal growth of income for the first nine month of this year is but this is nominal and we need to achieve real growth the head of state said i repeat it is important to consolidate such trend to achieve a steady excess of the growth of citizen income over inflation rate i very much hope that a we said it will decline in the first quarter of next year we need to achieve wage growth in the economy in all key sector he added opinion daria litvinenko a mother of many child from the melitopol district my third child appeared on new year s eve i did not have time to issue social payment from ukraine i received only hryvnia after the appointment of social payment from russia i do not think about what to buy child food diaper or toy it is also cool that there is such a bonus a free meal in kindergarten school plus the fact that i am on maternity leave but i still have time to work i wa offered social work in the administration natalia mayatskaya a pensioner from the village of tikhonovka i am glad that we have returned to russia i have been waiting for this since the s the life of my family turned for the better i have three child under my care and now thanks to social assistance i can fully provide for them all necessary we can now live not survive my pension ha gone up fivefold i can buy myself all the medicine and grocery i need payment for housing and communal service ha significantly decreased and we also expect gasification of our village and believe that this will happen russia is a country in which everything is done for the people it is done and not only fed with promise then we are only with russia the head of the kherson and kaliningrad region vladimir saldo and anton alikhanov made a joint decision on the possibility of completing the business trip of sergey yeliseyev to the kherson region and returning to his previous place of work for six month in the new region of the russian federation sergey eliseev wa awarded the order of courage in a conversation with komsomolka he summed up the main result of his work in kherson spoke about assistance to the common population threat against him from ukrainian militant and suggested that his successor would have to decide sergey vladimirovich you have created a new government of kherson region from scratch that s right in six month we managed to create the entire structure of the new government we have brought the work of the authority in line with the regulatory framework of the russian federation after all kherson resident lived up to this moment in the condition of an independent subject yes we had difficulty with personnel a huge shortage of manager people were afraid to cooperate with the new government because they were intimidated by the ukrainian in social network and call they received threat that they would be found and killed there have been case of attempt on life unfortunately yes on several occasion my guard filmed various explosive device hidden or camouflaged in my travel route all this had a negative impact on the formation of a new government therefore the most courageous kherson resident cooperated with u how to organize effective management in such condition several region of the russian federation were assigned to the region ryazan adygea kabardino balkaria kaliningrad and pskov they distributed among themselves the district of kherson which were closely helped on all front one of the main task of our chef wa precisely the training of the staff it seems to me that we have coped with this task a quality government ha emerged how wa the situation in agriculture it wa extremely important to ensure the harvesting of grain crop together with the district administration we have created state unitary enterprise sue they bought grain from the population and sold it outside the kherson region we have ensured that price are market price without speculation a a result more than one million ton of grain crop were harvested eight elevator were launched for receiving processing and storing grain new combine and grain carrier have come to u we bought the right amount of fertilizer a far a the military situation allowed we sowed the field what about the industrial sector it should be noted that the management of many enterprise fled to ukraine opposed russia these enterprise were recognized a ownerless and through the decision of the commission were transferred to temporary management to new director so that the team work and people receive a salary but now i must admit almost all of the enterprise remained on the right bank or in the kilometer zone of the left bank which wa evacuated due to shelling to what extent social assistance to the population ha been established organized social and pension payment we have not seen a single ukrainian database from scratch we recalculated the entire number of pensioner and needy resident of the kherson region at the time of my departure we verified about pensioner more than thousand people received social payment salary were paid steadily educational institution have worked in full to the maximum on september we launched school college and university almost thousand child went to study and in the field of health care there are success we have launched the work of about polyclinics and hospital a legal entity wa re registered new chief doctor were appointed and they also established the supply of medicine and equipment how kherson resident themselves have changed in six month of your work i believe that my greatest achievement is a change in the mood of the population if at the time of my arrival there were many doubter afraid then by the referendum the situation had changed radically people were not afraid to openly express their opinion work with u and help u i immediately said to all my subordinate they will judge by you who the russian are we were the first and the first impression is the most memorable it wa important to do everything right and we succeeded what are the future challenge facing your successor the successor of course will not be easy because of the evacuation of part of the population and government structure now the main thing is to establish effective management of the territory in the shortest possible time i know that an entire government quarter will be built on the left bank it is extremely important to ensure a decent life for evacuated people because many have parted with their home it is crucial not to forget anyone so that everyone receives the necessary payment housing certificate well so that ordinary everyday affair were solved without problem it wa warm in the house the road in winter were sprinkled with sand and salt i believe that everything will be fine the question is rib what is happening to people on the right bank of the kherson region the ukrainian authority are engaged in repression for the slightest suspicion of sympathy for the russian authority for the fact of obtaining a russian passport even for the fact that the child wa sent to a russian school for all this people face criminal prosecution not to mention the fact that the uk is now conducting check on the fact of death execution on the right bank there s mayhem going on there the draft law on the inclusion in the civic chamber of russia of representative of the lugansk and donetsk people s republic a well a the zaporozhye and kherson region wa submitted to the state duma of the russian federation by five people s deputy from united russia the composition of the civic chamber of russia formed in the summer of will be updated in and if the proposed project becomes law and to exercise public control over the work of government body and participate in the examination of federal bill from the point of view of right the change proposed by ur in practice will ensure the equality of all subject of the russian federation when represented in the civic chamber our bill will contribute to the consolidation unification of public figure of new territory olga zanko developed her thought this we believe will be an important part of the integration of the non profit sector into the russian legal field when the composition of the civic chamber of russia is updated in representative of the lpr dpr kherson and zaporizhzhya region will have a real opportunity to become part of it it will be easier for them to protect the right and freedom of citizen in their region in the formation and implementation of state policy by the way a the initiator of the bill noted regional public chamber have already been created in the two republic of donbas well in kherson and zaporozhye region it is planned to create them next year the composition of the civic chamber is updated every three year and the next one is expected by june among the important initiative of the civic chamber of this convocation are a public discussion of the reform of the guardianship and custody system the development of a mechanism for targeted financing of support for child with rare disease and the improvement of the activity of public monitoring commission in place of deprivation of liberty in the first week of the special operation all the authority of the kiev regime left kherson the regional administration the sbu the police like the wind blew away it wasn t even anarchy that began but real chaos looting and looting became everyday thing on march russian troop entered the city and then the formation of the administration of the kherson region began film director igor telegin became one of the first who literally began to create order in society from scratch over the past six month he had to endure dozen of threat two assassination attempt and despite everything enter into the confidence of the people hold victory day and a referendum on joining russia in march the administration of the kherson region consisted of only eight people igor telegin wa one of them he wa asked to head the department of domestic policy telegin ha participated in the war in afghanistan and now he ha accepted a new challenge no one ha had such experience say igor telegin when the supporter of the kiev regime left they took away all the server there were house the population some shop and everything there wa no power so we had to create everything from scratch and now it s a historical experience but where to start to work it wa necessary to build a plan of action i just rolled up my sleeve and started thinking okay i ll recruit a certain number of people but do what i needed to do domestic politics and then i came up with the idea to write a program he set goal objective and a plan for their implementation the first thing to do wa to stop the chaos in the city and calm people down the population wa already frightened and from time to time shot were heard here threat from the kiev regime arrived and there were terrorist attack on victory day it became clear that telegin wa moving in the right direction on may the city had to hold a parade and take people outside then it seemed impossible and in the end the result exceeded all expectation true not everyone wa happy about telegin s success in his new position the kiev regime wa preparing terrorist attack hoping to eliminate the official threat came from there someone wrote death to collaborator telegin on the door of the apartment another assassination attempt happened on august right on the day of the national flag i wa walking home from work that evening they tracked me down that road in the morning and on the way back gram of tnt exploded right behind my left leg i wa thrown back by an explosion i received a concussion a well a multiple shrapnel wound to my back and leg miraculously he survived after being wounded igor telegin began to form the combat brotherhood in the kherson region his candidacy for the post of chairman wa approved and the man began to work combat brotherhood is the foundation on which the patriotic education of our youth who have been brainwashed here for year is based allegedly we are victim of repression the holodomor and so on they wanted to take away our identity from u but try to break the winner it will not work so they made victim out of u whine cry there wa no great victory this is how year were washed and we begin to revive the memory of the exploit of our ancestor and we do it just through the combat brotherhood young people need to be persuaded through our great tradition through suvorov alexander nevsky and zhukov because we are the victorious people for someone moving to a new city will be an important chapter in life someone just came to wait out difficult time both of them understand that without the support of the authority volunteer and just not indifferent people they will not remain the family of elena from nova kakhovka waited until the last moment that everything would get better home work school it wa very difficult to leave the usual way of life but when shelling began near their apartment the woman packed the belonging of her relative in a day we had to escape and a quickly a possible so two adult and two child ended up in olginka tuapse district they brought an old grandmother with them the main thing is that we are all together and the condition are very good we were warmly welcomed the staff of the boarding house where we live is polite say elena we want to draw up all the document we did not have time to make a russian passport at home because we worked there wa no free time now they have written a statement and we ll look at the situation i would like to come back but if it doe not work out then we will gladly stay here like the krasnodar territory another southern region of russia receives evacuee hundred of people go to the rostov region to get a roof over their head tatiana and her teenage daughter took almost five day to reach the temporary stay drove perfectly people here are very kind sympathetic what is needed please we are satisfied with everything say a resident of the village of malaya lepetikha kherson region we are not making big plan yet the main thing is that we are alive and safe viktor from nova kakhovka wa evacuated in november to the tuapse district of the krasnodar territory for a month i completed the document received a payment of thousand ruble and even found a job now he is thinking of staying in the kuban it s great just great the food here is excellent i started going to the gym to get in shape the people here are very nice and friendly the nature is beautiful the climate is pleasant i feel very comfortable here i don t want to go home the man admits a resident of the kherson region elena soon plan to change her residence permit a female teacher ha fallen in love with anapa so much that she want to stay at the resort and work with child three day later i received a call back from the ministry of education and wa informed that there are a lot of vacancy in my specialty teacher are needed everywhere i believe that i am also needed because i love my profession very much she said elena plan to build her life in russia and there are all opportunity for this but the main thing for a woman is her corner in the near future she hope to obtain a housing certificate for the purchase of housing at the resort the story of the large nazarov family is similar to the rest of the story of evacuee from the kherson region shelling urgent collection of thing and the road to the unknown then it seemed that surviving the fear of the future would not be easy but after alexander and anna reached anapa with their four child it turned out that everything wa not so bad and most importantly quiet and calm we have slept here for the first time in a long time now we are not afraid that there will be a arrival and you and your child will suffer and there they woke up from every rustle everyone wa on their nerve say the head of the family after the move anxiety wa replaced by confidence in the future the child went to school there is temporary housing they are fed and helped with paperwork we were so warmly received both in the boarding house and just the resident of anapa they help everyone they brought diaper shampoo cream gave a winter stroller for the youngest daughter people collect humanitarian aid and regularly bring it to u of course we did not expect this admits alexander in his native village of krynki the man worked a a coach graduated from the kherson higher school of physical culture his wife is a cook by profession therefore spouse will not be left without work they have already submitted document for a housing certificate they believe that they will be able to establish life in anapa and preferably near the city in a house with their own plot we are used to the fact that you can work on the land grow vegetable and fruit it is easier for u to stay in a private house because there are a lot of u the man smile the main thing is that peace should come and the rest can be adjusted that time been fighting to capture the city of bakhmut in the donbas the head of the regional administration serhiy haidai said in a post on telegram that the hotel that wa destroyed in the city of kadiivka had served a a base for the wagner force he posted photograph of a two story building which appeared to have been shattered by an explosion and a crater in the center of a courtyard they had a little pop there just where wagner headquarters wa located haidai said in an interview to ukrainian television according to reuters a huge number of those who were there died haidai s claim could not be said on telegram footage posted on social medium showed a large fire burning in the distance many people were killed and russian force were ferrying their wounded by car to hospital in crimea also in february many of ukraine s child have been uprooted from their home and separated from their family and there s been a push by many to help comfort traumatized child most recently these effort have appeared in the form of dog therapy the center for social and psychological rehabilitation in boyarka ukraine brought in an eight year old dog on dec to spread joy to the center s kid the associated press reported bice a playful dog with an important job instantly brought smile to the child s face a he walked into the room the dog s owner darina kokozei invited each child to step up and ask bice to do a few trick obedient bice sat stood on his hind leg rolled over and gave his paw to the kid for treat the group of youth ranging in age from two to year old have all experienced war trauma some witnessing russian soldier invading their hometown and even beating their relative some student have family member on the frontlines or their family member have been killed in service the state operated community center ha been a resource for people coping with trauma since russia s invasion in february the ap reported staffer such a psychologist oksana sliepova provide regular psychological therapy for those impacted even though the center ha worked with horse in the past sliepova told the ap that this wa her first time experiencing canine therapy i read a lot of literature that working with dog with four legged rehabilitators help child reduce stress increase stress resistance and reduce anxiety she said sliepova shared that many of the child are terrified of loud noise ever since the invasion even the sound of a window closing or a jet overhead may cause a child to drop to the floor and ask for the nearest bomb shelter location in an interview with fox news digital verywell mind editor in chief and licensed psychotherapist amy morin stressed the benefit that dog therapy can have in term of releasing stress and anxiety the florida based morin said that introducing dog into therapy is a great idea especially for child who immediately laugh smile and find joy at the animal presence the expert explained that it also help kid who are facing trauma cope with their emotion a long a the kid are physically safe said morin this kind of pet therapy can certainly help in serious circumstance such a war the center for social and psychological rehabilitation is located about mile southwest of kyiv it wa originally founded in to provide support after the nuclear explosion at chernobyl in now the center also double a a shelter that provides stable lighting and heat beginning of the evacuation from the right bank of the kherson region anna wa not afraid to come to the aid of the resident of her native region and helped with the transportation and accommodation of those who found themselves in the same difficult situation now anna polonskaya still help her compatriot and manages to take care of her little daughter despite her age the girl ha already managed to do a lot for those who primarily need support the movement union of mother of kherson region appeared in every city of the region in the summer of after the start of a special military operation it wa created by mother who had a common goal to help child and their parent in nova kakhovka the leader of the movement wa anna polonskaya the girl brings up a two year old daughter so she know firsthand what a difficult time her parent had to go through we had closed school kindergarten and people did not have the opportunity to find work therefore we decided to create a movement where all the mother of the kherson region can unite and help each other at first it wa very difficult it wa necessary to organize everything to find people mother who were ready to help others say anna the movement union of mother of kherson region quickly gained like minded people we began to hold forum in different city and look for people who could help u and we to them so in mid september more than delegate gathered at the forum of the union of mother in henichesk the main issue raised by the participant were security and spiritual and moral education of the younger generation the upbringing and tranquility of child is the main thing that worried parent despite the incessant provocation on the part of the kiev regime a anna say in ukrainian time it wa very difficult for the mother of the kherson region to exist the girl had just had a daughter who needed to look for a kindergarten there wa little help from the state with the advent of russia it is easier we have payment there are fund that can help here is ours mother of kherson one of them previously there were practically no such organization and help respectively too the girl note when due to ukrainian provocation in mid october the russian federation made a balanced decision to begin evacuating resident of the right bank of the kherson region anna could not stay away despite her external fragility the girl volunteered to help the resident of her native nova kakhovka with the movement to the other bank of the dnieper among her ward a a rule there were family with child there wa no fear for himself he wa for the city and the inhabitant because of the constant arrival in the city it became dangerous to be russia helped people were allocated boarding house and sanatorium with three meal a day at first there were few people they simply could not believe that they were being helped that everything wa free but we explained everything to them and the activity began to grow say anna according to her in the first day after the beginning of the evacuation it wa more or le calm but then the soldier of the armed force of ukraine openly began to shell the civilian population they started shooting at u with short range weapon and artillery along the coastline we were constantly changing our location repeatedly there were heavy shelling when we took people out unfortunately during the evacuation from the attack of the armed force of ukraine even a person died the girl lament it became clear that the nationalist would not spare anyone shelling of civilian began to occur more often during the day we took out two hundred people in a few day everything wa adjusted to automatism we created a hotline and a public reception people came explained everything to them wrote them down say anna anna polonskaya helped to take people out of nova kakhovka until the very end of the evacuation even poor health did not prevent the girl she had a bad cold because the main thing at that time wa to save compatriot including small child anna s daughter at that time along with her parent had already been evacuated to the left bank but the girl herself decided to stay to the last i left when the situation became critical i wa forbidden to be there because i wa not trained in military training say anna now the brave girl along with her parent and daughter is in henichesk anna is busy looking for suitable housing and a kindergarten for the child no matter how turbulent the situation may be child should develop the movement union of mother of kherson region exists a before even with a large number of like minded people to the question of whether anna will return to novaya kakhovka when the russian military liberates the right bank of the dnieper from the ukrainian occupier the activist of the union of kherson mother answer unequivocally of course we will restore the city vital activity infrastructure culture participant of the humanitarian mission of united russia continue to work in the kherson region one of their main task is to help those who want to go to other region of russia finding themselves on the left bank of the dnieper recently activist helped a teacher who could not leave an elderly mother with limited mobility alone having received a request the volunteer immediately went to help we are approached with similar request every day basically these are people who need to transport low mobility elderly relative we involve the ministry of emergency situation of russia ambulance service and try to help everyone and we will also continue to do this said igor kastyukevich head of the humanitarian mission of the united russia party in the kherson region natalia a teacher from the skadovsky district appealed to the activist of the mission when she lost hope of leaving we had a lot of thing and pet it just seemed impossible we already thought that we would have to stay although it wa very scary but we turned to volunteer and they quickly organized everything a whole team came to the rescue everyone wa transferred to the bus and comfortably taken to dzhankoy thank the woman volunteer for their help this is not the only case for example a week earlier an elderly woman who needed medical attention wa also evacuated from skadovsk she had problem with her eyesight and with blood vessel exacerbated by her experience now the woman is helped by doctor and her granddaughter olga who left with her volunteer also help with medicine recently humanitarian mission activist delivered medical kit to the village of zalizny port resident of kherson evacuated here complained about the lack of medicine and volunteer rushed to the rescue the kit themselves were formed at the request of evacuated resident they included vitamin painkiller antipyretic sedative heart drug and the rural medical center wa also transferred both the simplest drug and mean of narrowly focused action volunteer also work with child who are in temporary accommodation center on the left bank of the their homeland and concern for it fate in song music and poem i think it s hard to go back to the classroom right away and start studying well say a newly demobilized history student today we are sitting in the trench and tomorrow in class albeit remotely but there will still be so much to catch up with the young man s doubt are not surprising until recently he wa at the center of hostility but after the order of russian president vladimir putin on the demobilization of student he returned home where together with the same guy like him he took part in a meeting with the first deputy head of the presidential administration of the russian federation sergey kiriyenko and the acting head of the dpr denis pushilin with the ministry of education we discussed the need to consolidate a
