not lost therefore the program is adapted accordingly for you in addition in lugansk all university work in full time mode unfortunately this is not yet possible in donetsk online knowledge can not be pulled up so you can organize a trip to other russian university i set the task that in december or january it would be possible to go to the leading university of the country at least for a few week the meeting of demobilized student with sergey kiriyenko and denis pushilin wa held informally at the end of it those who returned from the front line were solemnly presented with military award since it will not be easy to catch up with classmate it wa decided that individual curriculum will be drawn up for the demobilized when the child were mobilized we decided like all other university to send them on academic leave say svetlana drozhzhina rector of donetsk national university of economics and trade upon return it is enough to write a statement that the young man return to the educational process in his own group but during this time academic debt have formed so an individual training plan will be worked out a curator will be assigned to each of them and if during the participation of a student in hostility his group graduated say from a bachelor s degree under the guidance of his mentor and he will be able to defend himself pa exam and enter the magistracy among the student there are many who decided to stay on the front line for month that the guy took part in hostility they managed to get a military profession five recent soldier came to the meeting with sergei kiriyenko and denis pushilin in military uniform why in uniform have you decided to continue to serve asked the acting head of the dpr yes my principled position is that first all university student are demobilized and only then those who want to sign a contract the freshman who wa among the five who decided to remain in the rank wa offered to graduate from a military school and become an officer with each of the others a separate conversation many of the young people such a year old nikita mashkov want to use the acquired skill for the benefit of donbas and then become military i wa mobilized on march i m a sapper he said before the army he studied at the technical university mine clearance wa taught to me in the unit and then i gained practical experience we were sent to mariupol i took an active part in the cleansing of the city the demining of azovstal and i decided to stay in the army realizing that there are very few people with such skill and the need to clear the territory of dangerous object in our republic is very large i even love doing it i think that at the end of the contract i will return to my study and then i will connect my life with the military sphere my family supported me in my decision important since november the dpr ha launched a round the clock hotline on the demobilization of student each of them will receive the status and certificate of a participant in hostility and all the benefit due under russian law all child are guaranteed the provision of psychological assistance and those who studied for a fee will be transferred to the budget the hotline number for the demobilization of student and mobilization in the dpr is in october russian president vladimir putin at a meeting of the security council instructed to create a special coordination council under the government under the leadership of prime minister mikhail mishustin whose task wa to meet all the need of the army during the cvo the council included representative of law enforcement agency deputy prime minister of the government minister of the socio economic bloc and representative of the presidential administration and although the council work under the leadership of mishustin the president regularly receives report on the result of the work and keep question on his activity under his control just the other day at a solemn event on the occasion of the th anniversary of rostec putin again drew attention to the supply of the russian army and demanded to increase production and supply throughout the range of product demanded by the russian army first of all we are talking about weapon and ammunition among the decision listed by the president is the requirement to put into production the best sample of military equipment based on those that are already operating working fighting and confirming their characteristic and the need for additional incentive for the best worker at dozen of plant in different region of russia working with maximum load and in several shift people work hard looking up to our ancestor to the great tradition of many generation of our master gunsmith who proved by their deed that russian weapon are a weapon of victory putin said and assured that all decision to support enterprise will be made a quickly a possible it is clear that a good and solid rear is one of the most important component of the success of the operation but even more important is the state on the front itself including the support of those who are there from the state and it s not just about ammunition shell and drone it can hardly be argued that everything ha been smooth since the first day of the conflict partial mobilization wa not without problem the army still lack new type of weapon such a the same reconnaissance and attack drone something is not being resolved due to bureaucratic confusion but a for the direct competence of the president there are no delay and delay the example of the president is often followed by the head of the region of russia everyone know perfectly well that the governor of the tula region hero of russia alexei dyumin primorsky krai oleg kozhemyako and other not just frequent guest in the unit but also supplier curator and first assistant to military personnel prime minister mikhail mishustin is also trying to clearly implement the president s instruction and solves all issue related to the army especially those related to the administrative provision of improvement for military personnel and their family a a matter of priority putin at one time insisted that the money due to the mobilized be paid promptly and emphasized that the basic payment to the military participating in the svo cannot fall below the established limit le is impossible more please on almost any emerging issue if it is required for a quick solution to the problem presidential decree are signed in a short time and amendment to law are signed by him just a quickly yes what can i say if only in recent day the president ha signed several law at once that raise the status and level of support not only for the serviceman themselves but also for their family member on november news agency reported that putin had signed three law relating to military personnel and their family according to the first of them volunteer participating in the operation and there are more than one thousand of them are assigned the status of a combat veteran according to it volunteer and member of their family along with ordinary serviceman of the armed force of the russian federation will be able to use the benefit and measure of social support established by law in addition volunteer who have become disabled due to injury concussion or mutilation while participating in a special operation will be able to apply for the status of a disabled combatant and this is an additional help to them and their relative and the law immediately came into force on the day of publication another law establishes a supplement to the social pension for recipient of three order of courage or order of personal courage and this increase is very significant of the pension in there were officially such people since then the bill ha clearly exceeded a hundred but a the president recently noted in the svo zone all serviceman are hero this of course is not an incentive for a feat they are performed at all not for the sake of award but because of the impossibility of otherwise achieving a solution to the problem but recognition of merit another no le significant than the first law on exemption from taxation of material assistance to participant in the cbo and their family according to it both gratuitous payment and material assistance provided to these category are exempt from paying tax payment to seconded employee of company who travel to the exempted region to restore infrastructure also fall under tax exemption and the importance of this amendment to the tax code is almost impossible to overestimate for thousand of volunteer who collect for hundred of million sleeping bag legging body armor quadrocopters product and even optical sight for the participant of the operation a well a helping the relative of the participant of the svo with food clothing medicine etc not the first law and not the last because everything related to the svo remains in the focus of the president s attention in the new region of russia there is an active creation of the domestic banking system in the lugansk and donetsk people s republic in the kherson and zaporozhye region dozen of branch of promsvyazbank psb are already operating and recently a decree of the president of russia on some issue of carrying out the activity of the public joint stock company promsvyazbank in the territory of the dpr and lpr wa published the document prescribes how these region will be integrated into the russian banking system first of all the authority of both republic should conclude agreement with the central bank of the russian federation on the creation of territorial branch of the bank of russia on the basis of the central republican bank of the dpr and the state bank of the lpr such branch operate in all constituent entity of the russian federation then the main bank of the two republic will be transformed into limited liability company and of the capital in each of them will belong to the lpr and the dpr respectively after that the financial llcs will be sold to the russian psb for a symbolic price of ruble client and partner of the central republican bank of the dpr and the state bank of the lpr should not worry about their reorganization all their obligation are transferred to the psb a a legal successor after the completion of organizing procedure in the new region a full fledged banking architecture will begin to operate the same a in other subject of russia a branch of the central bank and bank conducting operation with citizen and legal entity yes there is still only one large bank but the trouble is the beginning the rest will pull up along the beaten path promsvyazbank is already actively working in the lpr and the dpr said anatoly aksakov chairman of the committee on the financial market of the state duma of the russian federation i think that from next year other bank will begin to come perhaps these will be crimean credit institution in particular rncb russian national commercial bank the largest bank of the republic of crimea and sevastopol the head office is located in simferopol there is a network of branch in the krasnodar territory ed the situation with banking service in the new russian region will be no worse than for example in the crimea or nearby region of the country psb also ha branch in zaporizhzhya and kherson region but the package of service there is not yet a complete a in other russian region according to the deputy from next year in new russia branch of the central bank will also actively work such subdivision are already being created in all subject of the federation in the annexed territory aksakov continued the process is quite active i think they will be ready for work in the first half of next year reference kp promsvyazbank is a fully state owned bank which is the main one for conducting operation on the state defense order included in the top bank in the country in term of asset after the withdrawal of russian troop from the right bank of the dnieper near kherson the contact line froze a if frozen but in fact it is not the front that is constrained but the unit of the armed force of ukraine forced the officer doe not disclose official information professionally we approached the plane with the navigator inspected checked the weapon sat down began to buckle up launch take off the pilot casually tell how at great speed they flew at ultra low altitude below meter this is so that you understand when power line jump so there is le chance that they will be shot down a they approached the target a column of enemy equipment how they worked on the enemy and began to move away from the target in the direction of their troop turned degree and here a powerful blow a in an accident here s a silly analogy almost peter reply diplomatically shook u and immediately the rotation along the axis began there wa very little time to make a decision a maximum of second thank goodness we had enough at what height wa the strike about meter you give the command to eject we are together the navigator said we ve been hit i immediately checked the control the plane is uncontrollable i just had time to say let s go out and put into operation the ejection system next thing the blow is strong it s all fleeting and i m already on a parachute for second we probably went down to the ground when i landed i realized that my right hand wasn t working left freed himself from the suspension system and began to look for a navigator he landed meter away those second when we were still in the air what were we thinking how do we get out now which way to go you crawled up to the navigator ran he s motionless i started to take off his helmet the hanging one he had already begun to recover and the first thing he said wa leave me here save yourself we can name the navigator dmitry koptilov what did you say to him i said nikolaich i will not leave without you let s get out together i didn t even think of leaving him there i just grabbed him by the unloading and dragged him away with one hand think so we should have at least given ourselves painkiller injection the first meter were overcome the navigator say unbearable pain i realized that i had to stab and you didn t have unbearable pain yes i somehow didn t feel it adrenaline we first overcame a little swamp that is we swam in the non commercial season only put on the anesthesia and we can already see the armed force of ukraine arrived on three or four car we decided that we would not surrender i took out a grenade and screwed a fuse into it the navigator also ha one arm the left my right is damaged he took a grenade in his left i said hold on nikolaich i m going to get the ring now and we started waiting the armed force of ukraine began to comb the area they were up to the platoon i guess you ve prepared to blow yourself up with one grenade how this decision wa made it wa quickly adopted but the decision wa difficult to surrender well i wouldn t allow myself to do that you can t give up in this life at all if we are detected there is time to live for second while the fuse burn you ve seen them search for you literally meter away we observed one he passed in one direction in the other and artillery strike began in this place i believe it wa our artillery that worked on them it saved our life because it scared them away they walked away we decided to wait until dark wet through for five hour they lie in the bush not moving waiting for dusk surprisingly men do not shake from the cold apparently the release of adrenaline and the effect of an anesthetic affect all this time somewhere nearby enemy reconnaissance is scurrying artillery explosion are heard sprinkling the wounded with earth and fragment on the flight in the late afternoon the cannonade subsides the navigator say i have a spine i can t get up peter reply nicholas we have to go it s going to be hard but it s going to go and they go unharvested field hiding in the thicket of sunflower and corn minute of walking minute of rest dmitry s injury constantly make itself felt remember a in polevoy and he decided to go to go east to go through the forest not trying to look for convenient road and living place to go no matter what it take it seemed that the weaker and more weak his body became the more stubborn and stronger his spirit wa in hour they overcame about kilometer we have come to a populated area come on stay here and i ll go see who s there in the village i tell the navigator and then they noticed a technique with the letter z everything nikolaich is one hundred percent ours they came to the first house noticed my grandfather father are there any russian troop here he said yes men i will take it away now i said can i have a drink he gave u water i wanted to drink all the way grandpa took you to someone to our gunner we went into one hangar the driver mechanic came out and he took u to the battalion at the headquarters they have already contacted ours and reported their whereabouts how the male gunner met you very well they also of course heard that such a situation had occurred and it is not known where the crew is and when we went out to them we were surprised of course but they accepted well immediately fed and then a helicopter flew after u who wa the first to be seen when he stepped out of the helicopter commander he reported on the completion of the task the commander hugged thank you guy for being alive well then there is the hospital treatment and awarding i wa happy with the award i wa confused rather i still don t realize what i did so heroically the country rated it that way i will carry this high title with dignity not only have you completed a combat mission and returned from it you pulled out your comrade in arm brought him home i didn t revert it we went together we acted a a coordinated mechanism a a crew that s the situation we did what we were taught okay so they did i remembered the teacher with a kind word of course my first instructor pilot had already been called i am grateful to all the instructor who put young boy on the wing in the training regiment this is worth a lot they have a very large and responsible job but pyotr kashtanov became a pilot only because of his perseverance he wa drawn to the sky from a young age my mother said that they lived near the airfield and four year old peter loved to watch how every day plane took off above him and the dome of parachute opened in the air that s when he said that he would definitely become a pilot although he himself doe not remember it after the th grade he entered a boarding school in tambov with initial flight training everything is like in the army a company a platoon a barrack position outfit and when i graduated i went to flight school only enrolled a much a the fifth time one discipline wa not given during this time he even served a term a a tanker but he did not give up the dream of heaven if i take on something i will bring it to the end first flight delight and admiration this cannot be conveyed because in principle it is not characteristic of a person to fly and that s for life and who wa your reference point maresyev of course this is the well known story of a man who crawled because his leg were broken to his own and he also had a dream to fly and he achieved this he flew without leg and you plan to return to the sky of course now treatment and recovery and then at the helm of the aircraft the best in the world su now the young boy will read they will also want to become pilot what quality you need to cultivate in yourself persistence is unequivocal patience is everything ha it time a they say the main thing in aviation is to always be honest in front of me comrade and commander read also mobilized men in the trench say we want to attack voenkor alexander kots told what russia lack for victory and when to expect it more listen also will volgograd be renamed stalingrad to carry out the rehabilitation of serviceman participating in a special military operation after amputation of the lower extremity in the th branch of the main military clinical hospital named after n n burdenko in the moscow region a special walking training school wa created patient are trained to properly walk on prosthesis of a high functional class under the guidance of rehabilitation doctor and physical therapy instructor military doctor also use robotic complex to develop the joint of the upper and lower extremity virtual reality technique that can significantly reduce the recovery time for the next stage of rehabilitation treatment said kp the head of the th branch of the main military clinical hospital named after n n burdenko lieutenant colonel of the medical service sergey khvostov khvostov showed journalist virtual reality program that immerse patient in various situation walking in the wood public place traveling thanks to which they begin to adapt their muscle to the load that they will encounter in everyday life transcranial magnetic stimulation is also used a method of indirect stimulation of the brain and certain part of it depending on pathology therapy with the use of interference current that normalize the tone of large and small vessel steam air carbon dioxide bath to eliminate the phenomenon of oxygen starvation in damaged organ and tissue hyperbaric oxygenation is used a method of treatment with oxygen under high pressure in a medical hyperbaric chamber the head of the branch of the military hospital listed the procedure available to patient the other day kp reported that the surgeon of the main military clinical hospital named after n n burdenko are going to return the fighter of the svo to service with a new face military doctor not only saved the life of a soldier who received a fatal mine explosive wound to the head but also restore all lost bone on a d printer thanks to the professionalism of military surgeon the serviceman will be adapted in society he will be able to talk eat talk facial expression will be preserved moreover after the full restoration of health the serviceman if he wish will even be able to continue military service the russian defense ministry promised listen a well is poland ready to hold referendum in western ukraine the russian grouping of troop in the zone of the special military operation ha prepared a springboard for the offensive and defense said military expert head of the bureau of military political analysis alexander mikhailov our soldier are much better prepared for combat operation in sub zero temperature than the enemy there are a number of reason that can become a turning point and change the course of the special operation this winter the first of them is russian strike on ukrainian energy facility in addition there are great risk of reduced support for the west and the flight of foreign mercenary who take part in the battle extensively attack on infrastructure de energize railway communication route mikhailov said on the morning program what will happen on radio komsomolskaya pravda the very logistics of the delivery of ammunition new weapon personnel the removal of wounded fighter from the battle line the shipment of broken damaged equipment or in need of repair now western equipment is mainly repaired in poland and eastern europe in general that logistics is broken and therefore for the winter period when additional food hydrocarbon fuel power generator and so on are so necessary everything that allows the group to function normally in the winter the delivery of all this to the contact line is associated with great logistical problem and how serious is the counteroffensive of the russian armed force in what direction is the advance of our troop likely the host asked the contact line is now very long almost kilometer starting from the kherson region and up to the border of the kharkiv region clash do not stop the entire contact line is active true weather condition lead to some stiffness both side switch to the winter period there is a re uniform of fighter and the arrival of military equipment which is prepared for the winter period equipped with appropriate liquid and fuel and lubricant this is the supply of related equipment to the troop which allows you to create more comfortable living condition in this respect russian troop are much better prepared we have formed a long and deeply layered line of defense it run along the left bank of the dnieper and further along the contact line up to the kharkiv region on our part additional force of personnel are concentrated the mobilized russian are taking control of the settlement of the new region of russia ensuring law and order there plus the material and technical base accumulated for the upcoming winter period in this regard on the ukrainian side everything is much sadder and we see that all the attempt of the armed force of ukraine over the past few week to make at least a little progress have failed after the regrouping of russian troop from kherson to the left bank no more settlement came under the control of ukraine on the contrary a number of settlement came under the control of russia first of all these are settlement in the dpr the advance towards artemovsk and the liberation of small settlement in the agglomeration and the further prospect of access to slavyansk and kramatorsk this lead to the achievement of the main result the complete liberation of the territory of donbas let s hope that these goal will be achieved in the coming week right in the coming week you think i mean the liberation of the dpr week are a stretchy concept but it seems to me that in the winter that is in december january and february there will be a turning point in the course of hostility because the russian army is better prepared for the winter both materially and technically russian equipment fight at low temperature unlike western which is not always tested in these condition and latitude and the mercenary unit on which this collective support of the ukrainian army is based i strongly doubt that they are ready to conduct combat operation in real sub zero temperature and in the absence of proper logistics support it seems to me that after the new year they will flee from ukraine en masse i think that winter will put everything in it place general moroz is traditionally on the russian side the situation on the front could lead to political proposal from the kiev regime which ha problem with chance to become a center of attraction for tourist khotsenko added sviatohirsk ukraine when myroslava a year old construction manager returned to her hometown of sviatohirsk in eastern ukraine last month she expected to find her house destroyed by shelling her house wa indeed heavily damaged but she discovered something else even more disturbing her neighbor who had stayed behind during the russian occupation had stolen furniture insulation and roof tile from her home and a property she oversaw in town these were people she had grown up with she lamented worse the looted tile were visible on the neighbor s roof friend are not friend anymore she said on a cold november day her brown hair tucked in a beanie and her small frame wrapped in a winter coat the neighbor are not neighbor relative a part of them aren t relative anymore because no one expected u to come back similar anxiety have been playing out among resident of the town still mostly empty of people ever since ukrainian force liberated it in september the russian arrival over the summer imposed a litmus test of sort for sviatohirsk and other tight knit community in ukraine s east where the russian church and russian television had for year been promoting loyalty to moscow a civilian who fled sviatohirsk rejoin neighbor who stayed resident say they now eye one another with suspicion and a a cold winter set in the town remains divided not by trench line and artillery but by where people s allegiance lie with moscow or kyiv suspicion run so high that resident do not even agree which side russia or ukraine is responsible for shelling that struck various neighborhood in the city damaging house and killing several dozen people no one is even letting it out who he stand for and all that said one resident an older man who declined to provide his name he wa sitting beside a warm steel stove at a makeshift coffee shop called bouch e that serf a de facto neutral territory a place where both pro ukrainian and pro russian can get a bite to eat undisturbed a long a they keep to themselves the town s freshly installed local government recognizes the problem and hope that resident with pro russian sentiment will eventually embrace kyiv especially a condition improve after living without power and basic service during the occupation the cellphone connection is working the bread factory is working the ukrainian post office is working said volodymyr rybalkin the head of the local military administration who act a a sort of interim mayor i think that even the people who knowingly stayed under occupation waiting for the so called russian world will sooner or later understand how much they were mistaken but that conversion will not be easy even before the war the presence of the monastery of the cave loyal to the russian orthodox church and considered one of the church s five holiest site gave the town a reputation for being pro russian that perception wa compounded by sviatohirsk s location in the donbas a predominantly russian speaking region where moscow for decade promoted soviet nostalgia politics the propaganda especially on television ha helped the kremlin influence some russian speaking civilian in the east even a it falsely depicts the region a essentially part of russia and cite the supposed oppression of russian speaker there a a justification for invading how sviatohirsk will move on from it troubled interlude of occupation remains unclear around people remain from a prewar population of about according to local official approximately resident have returned since the russian retreat returnees like myroslava believe that more people with pro ukrainian sensibility will come back when the weather warms in the spring diluting the local sentiment toward russia they are already slowly starting to come back because a lot of them can t pay rent in other city and they return even if their house is destroyed said myroslava who returned to her home in october she declined to provide her last name for security reason the monastery where nun and monk remained loyal to the russian church wields significant influence in the town adding an extra layer of complexity yeah people are coming back to sviatohirsk but no quality people will be left here the holy father say so said an older man deploring the return of the pro ukrainian and suggesting they did not share the pro russian view of the church the man standing in the town s cemetery declined to give his name he wa helping to rebury a child killed in the shelling whose body had recently been exhumed so that the local police could examine it in recent week kyiv s intelligence service have launched at least one operation and a series of arrest aimed at rooting out spy in the church drawing condemnation from moscow and president volodymyr zelensky recently proposed outlawing the branch of the ukrainian orthodox church that is loyal to moscow saying the measure wa needed to ensure russia is not able to weaken ukraine from within western ukraine is thinking in it own way and donbas is thinking in a different way said one of the monastery s monk who also declined to provide his name he compared those from the west to occupier the older man sitting at the bouch e cafe had done the same comparing ukraine s liberation of the town to another occupation local official are still trying to determine if some resident actively collaborated with the russian ruslan tsymbal a senior district police officer in sviatohirsk declined to discus the issue of russian collaborator but confirmed there were ongoing investigation in the case of myroslava s looted belonging the police and the military were able to get back some of her stolen furniture another problem exacerbating tension is the feeling among some resident that other member of the community might have turned on them ihor ponomarenko who owned an adventure park and served in the town s territorial defense said his name and personal information were posted on pro russian chat on telegram a messaging service toward the end of march the same thing happened to others connected to the territorial defense he said a well a local volunteer and the town s military administration they created website claiming that we are fascist and so on mr ponomarenko said he returned to sviatohirsk in october his park and cafe where he would host child s birthday party were destroyed decoration he had put up for valentine s day lay scattered in ruin other local business owner who were pro ukrainian also lost their livelihood when the russian came he said some business like his were destroyed by shelling others were looted by their pro russian neighbor he said though he did not cite any evidence resident who rode out much of the occupation from their basement shelter are still surveying part of their destroyed town and there are sharply different view among some on which army is to blame for the carnage more than people died during the occupation according to local official many from shelling initially there were a lot of people trying to prove that this is ukraine who ruined our building said mr rybalkin the military administrator even though they didn t understand that the enemy wa held off here when the ukrainian kept the russian from fording the river but neighbor still argued about how the battle for sviatohirsk which lasted from june when the russian occupied the town until they retreated in september unfolded the fighting played out in phase on either side of the siversky donets river which bisects the town a bridge that connected both side where lover once placed lock on it railing wa destroyed a kyiv s force retreated in the summer russian force on the north side of the river fired into the hill on the south occasionally striking the monastery ground ukrainian force entrenched on the high bank fired back across the river to the town the monk at the monastery accused the ukrainian of shelling the holy site killing several people though it wa clear at least on the damage visible from the exterior that the shell had come from the russian side of the river myroslava shrugged off claim by resident who blame the ukrainian for the town s destruction they like to say that ukraine wa firing from the mountain but they would not have fired if seven russian tank were not stationed next to my yard she said the rusted hulk of some of those tank are still in her neighborhood carved open by ukrainian shell much like the home around them their roof panel clattering in the cold wind she repeated they would not have fired russia s wagner group a private military mercenary force ha seen each of it fighter reportedly burn an average of round of ammunition per day in an attempt to fight off a fierce ukrainian counteroffensive wagner group fighter attempting to hold onto gain in ukraine s donbas region have faced an onslaught of attack by ukrainian force looking to take back lost ground and heavy fighting is depleting ammunition at an alarming rate according to an institute for the study of war analysis released wednesday the u s based think tank s report detailed the fighting around the city of bakhmut with ukrainian force attempting to retake position south of the city and russian force mounting an attack on the city itself that wa repelled by ukraine heavy fighting ha also been reported near kherson oblast where ukrainian force have consistently attacked russian position around the city the heavy fighting ha taken a toll on both side though the fierce ukrainian resistance ha worked to stall russian president vladimir putin s war aim and prompted him to acknowledge the conflict may be drawn out for some time russian force will also now be forced to combat ukraine s winter climate another possible roadblock amid report earlier this week that the country s military lack sufficient clothing and gear to combat the element koffler belief the weather may cause putin to slow down over the next few month though she expects russian force to attempt to ramp up their activity again in the spring the president s word about the organized separately a representative office of the young guard ha been opened forum and educational campaign of region are working local driver have their own request some important bridge for citizen explained to kp without this bridge we do not have the opportunity to get to donetsk at the moment the crossing wa blown up by ukrainian neo nazi so i had to throw pipe and fill with slag so that i could drive through at least one thin lane but now a new bridge is being built good wide thanks to the leningrad region and for the restoration of the main route according to plan for the leningrad region want to start repairing bridge in yenakiieve and double the repair of city road medical specialist of the burdenko main military clinical hospital of the ministry of defense of the russian federation for the first time in world surgical practice have developed and implemented a new method of d modeling of implant this breakthrough in medical applied science ha long been expected and not only in the army it wa necessary for the full restoration of the limb of seriously wounded fighter the russian defense ministry clarified the new technology allows for example to form an individual three dimensional implant for each wounded person it corresponds one to one in size and shape to the lost fragment of the patient s bone according to specialist of the burdenko hospital a similar d implant is installed in the area of the destroyed limb of the wounded after that it is filled with fragment of bone tissue of the patient these tissue are taken from other bone of the victim they are transplanted or grown using the patient s own stem cell according to military doctor this d technology also help to quickly and reliably restore the joint muscle and skin of a person injured in a mine explosion or received multiple shrapnel wound including in the limb area previously such damage wa considered in most case almost irreversible because of what the arm or leg had to be amputated the technological veil of secrecy in this breakthrough area wa slightly opened by the deputy head of the burdenko military hospital for research chief traumatologist leonid brizhan today according to professor brijan the operation using d technology already allows for example to completely recreate the bone of the wounded in the so called titanium case a a result the missing fragment is perfectly repeated the first patient from the zone of special military operation who wa given such a unique operation at the burdenko hospital this year in a very short time and almost completely recovered the seriously wounded soldier so highly appreciated his physical readiness after the operation for further army service that having met the persistent request of the military after recovery and rehabilitation he wa again sent to the special operation zone a year or two ago even the best surgeon and traumatologists would have said that a person with such injury is unlikely to be able to move independently due to a severe injury in the initial period of svo he lost a significant part of the tibia of the leg and now he s back in action and back in combat resident of kherson region settle in a new place many of the internally displaced person have left home abandoning everything they have gained over the year and in fact are now starting life from scratch but the important thing is that they are not alone dozen of region offered compatriot not only a safe shelter but also all possible assistance on the kuban land immigrant are greeted a relative in the first second the resident of kherson region do not even believe after all in social network alarming report appeared every now and then that no one is expected in russia and punishment is being prepared for those who should be at least the administration of the stakhanov plant noted that the repair and commissioning of the furnace were carried out by the employee of the donbas enterprise despite the shelling the enterprise did not stop working and the plant staff regularly carried out the necessary work to ensure the full functioning of all technological equipment the plant s management said also at the ferroalloy plant furnace number seven wa returned to operation thus the company resumed the production of ferrosilicomanganese a fragile alloy of iron silicon and manganese which is used in metallurgy a a deoxidizer of steel and for it alloying it give iron based alloy strength wear resistance and impact resistance the plant said that the furnace did not work for two year the reason for this wa the ukrainian shelling the result of which the equipment wa disabled there were regular interruption in power supply all this hampered the normal functioning of the plant now these difficulty are in the past noted at the enterprise after carrying out repair preparatory and commissioning work the furnace ha passed the necessary technological period of heating and is currently reaching the operating parameter furnace number four at the plant decided to transfer to the production of high silicon ferrosilicon of the f brand this is a metal alloy the basis of which is silicon it content can range from to now our production volume is ton of ferrosilicon per day and ton of ferrosilicomanganese said vitaly podorvanov head of the smelting shop we stood for a very long time because of the shelling that i would be able to speak at the presidential human right council but just in case he prepared a fish in which he outlined the main pain point of the special military operation that bother no not the military purely military topic seemed inappropriate to me for the hrc they are quite frankly discussed in a different non public format i made the top three complaint from the relative of our fighter who write to me in telegram and that s dozen of message every day the composition of the hrc is impressive but the president s schedule is limited and only half of the council wa able to speak which however raised really important topic what i wanted to say link to the front so percent of people who contact me start with the word help me find a husband son brother a a rule we are talking about the mobilized these are people who have already gone through all the instance but could not find out where their relative is and what is wrong with him it doe not appear on bad list the ministry of defense reply but the mother s heart cannot be soothed by this and woman are looking for support among journalist who have even fewer opportunity to find out the whereabouts of the mobilized at the same time the problem is solved elementarily there are example of high quality work of the command of the unit with relative when both letter and parcel can be transmitted through the point of permanent deployment they are taken to the front by their own transport and handed over to the fighter personally in their hand but this unfortunately is not a systematic approach at the same time year ago at any end of the country a person could put his letter in a box and be sure that it would reach the front and there will be an answer before the war our country wa called the most reading in the world during the war she became the most written during the four year of the great patriotic war postman delivered billion triangle postcard secret to recipient our field mail address wa announced only for the tenth month of the conflict it remains to be hoped that it will work without failure payment in second place is the issue of non payment there are case when volunteer do not receive any money for four month here s an example so that this problem doesn t look like a dry protocol string i am the wife of the mobilized oleg chertov the husband wa drafted on september and on october he wa already in the lpr for two month he did not receive a penny at all i turned and wrote wherever i could there is still no answer from anywhere we have a large family of two adult and four schoolchildren one of the child is disabled wait how wa he even drafted with so many child you tried to challenge the mobilization my husband love his homeland and did not hide behind the child the woman simply reply to me understand she doe not ask her husband to return home because he can return to the family by law she only need something to support the child while the father defends the fatherland to be fair there are no mass complaint about non payment but such appeal come regularly including from civilian i wa in kherson when the evacuation wa announced from this city and unfortunately there were case when people left for big russia but a week later they returned unable to withstand the press of the bureaucracy soulless formalism can finish anyone off what can we say about people with a shattered psyche who are traveling from hostility but stumble upon bureaucratic arbitrariness we were given a certificate for housing neither my husband nor i received the promised they also did not receive social assistance writes the ivanov couple who received russian citizenship in kherson and voted in a referendum for a new life we are both pensioner pension were also not given to u either for october or november in kherson we were given a pension of until september equipment and caring the third is equipment in some place it is still lacking especially in winter and some relative complain that you even have to take a loan to buy your husband a high quality warm uniform it lack is not always the head scratching of the rearguard although it is present it s just that many unit live in harsh field condition where camouflage wear out very quickly and according to the charter a set of summer and winter uniform per year is required so don t ask for more and the fighter have to turn to volunteer then to journalist then to relative at the same time i noticed a pattern a long time ago if in the unit the commander is initiative and not indifferent then everything is in order with his equipment and with communication with relative and with product in position there are excellent example of interaction between the military and regional authority and there is complete indifference that s where the problem come in which however are already an order of magnitude le than at the initial stage of mobilization everything will be brought to fruition unfortunately my turn did not reach me however all these problem with specific specific example from the hrc will be brought to the attention of the president or solved manually through the relevant department in the end it is possible to determine the suitability for service of a person with an introvertebral schmorl hernia that requires surgical intervention the document are in my hand without the participation of the president if you approach the soldier in a human way and not formally listen a well karen shakhnazarov for both the west and russia the defeat in ukraine threatens with very serious consequence more how do mobilized men live in the trench what are they asking for will kalibr run out when to expect a turning point in russia s military operation and what we lack for victory the main issue of recent month in the studio of radio kp with the presenter ivan pankin were discussed by the legendary military officer komsomolka alexander kots who returned from another business trip honest answer of a person who ha been to all the hot spot on the contact line are in our material that rare case when you can catch you in the editorial office after february for a long time to moscow before the new year for sure a lot of household chore have accumulated worker recently i am a member of the human right council under the president this also imposes duty it is necessary to delve into this work which in principle i am familiar with because for nine month i had to face the problem of people in uniform and a far a possible some even decide what are the main problem you face the first is the equipment and not always this problem is due to the thuggery of the command people were normally equipped for example they were brought to the forest they live in the forest and there are harsh condition and the uniform wear out quickly kamaz come under fire with supply burn everything that wa in it or they gave something away initially but it got lost in the fight sometimes the negligence of the rear guard there are complaint and question about the promised money especially among volunteer there are a lot of appeal from relative who are looking for their son and husband here he wa not in touch for a month and his relative are already panicking i understand that in the zone of a special operation the military may not get in touch for month there are place from where it is simply impossible to call but the mother or wife cannot be reassured by this moreover until recently we did not have field mail a a class in the great patriotic war postman delivered almost billion letter from home to the front and back after year for some reason this ha become a problem the ministry of defense ha published an address to which you can send letter and parcel we ll see how it work do you have a feeling that the situation one way or another is changing for the better or not negative example are the loudest and there are fewer of them than positive one over the past two and a half month i have met with those mobilized in the kherson direction in zaporozhye on the svatovsky frontier i wa not taken to special exemplary place i chose and drove to the front i met the salt of the russian land our usual men former locksmith builder it specialist i came across alone and in principle they of course are not so directly tactically dressed and equipped but normally provided with uniform live in difficult but tolerable condition no one on the front will create condition for you you create them for yourself you once wrote do not pay attention to the difficulty you are facing it is difficult not to pay attention a man come from a civilian and then he shovel in his teeth and knee deep in water swarm a trench for himself and make drainage ditch and i just looked at these guy a lump came to my throat with pride people only from civilian life are pulled out thrown into this inferno and they do not lose their spirit sense of humor they display marvel of bravery courage and precision two guy mobilized from the tambov region were especially sunk into my soul for three week they were trained a a calculation of the malka gun of millimeter and they are now on the front line on the matchmaking frontier every day they destroy the enemy s equipment clearly accurately according to the coordinate that intelligence give them their commander call them jeweler these are guy who once upon a time served military service completely unrelated to artillery this suggests that at the training ground they had high quality training a normal commander and he taught them to shoot from this huge caterpillar colossus yes they live in the forest in camping condition but they are provided with rubber boot raincoat thermal underwear that s what the commander knocked out for them they fight with desire what an atmosphere on the front line people want to go forward they say we re tired of sitting in the trench i talked to the guy in the kherson direction even before we left there and they say well what mood can there be people in russia expect some victory and feat from u but we have been standing in the forest for several month we want to advance at the same time there is an understanding that before the start of mobilization there wa actually nothing to go to because in the spring and summer we advanced for a long time lost people equipment and there wa nowhere to make up for it now the industry is working and in many area the situation ha been stabilized at the same svatov frontier the mobilized played their part they hold their ground they shoot from malok and tulip ride tank and this ha not yet come the bulk of the conscript from the reserve which is undergoing in depth training there is a slow but still progress in the direction of artemovsk bakhmut this is a very important story because there ukraine spends most of it artillery reserve there kiev is now suffering the greatest loss in manpower and it is for the donbas front that the battle for bakhmut may turn out to be a turning point the task is not just to take the city but also to destroy a much manpower and equipment of the enemy a possible since he allows you to do this doe not take into account any loss the nature of the hostility is such that ukraine suffers loss many time greater than ours but let s not be disingenuous they re on a roll right now they are trying to transfer reserve from the kherson direction to svatovo and zaporozhye that is they threaten u with breakthrough both there and there ukrainian artillery fire more per day than the american in afghanistan in a month this cannot go on forever sooner or later the ukrainian troop should begin to decline because of loss because of the lack of ammunition let s start from the word of the same adviser to the head of the office of the president of ukraine arestovich who say that the russian are running out of shell and missile he s pressing on what the russian are still bombing u with the soviet legacy what do you say to that are we fighting with the soviet legacy including what s wrong with that thank you for having it and they re fighting that s good or bad that s a given it s too bad we don t have system like france s caesar yet it is bad that we do not yet have analogue of the american hymars there is no low orbit satellite constellation but i know that there are development i will not say from which soviet heritage which in their characteristic will surpass the khaymars and we have the ability to do a lot of them these system are already being tested in combat condition but have not yet been supplied en masse you will go to the front after the new year you have what expectation high expectation usually make you frustrated therefore i am just going to continue to work to talk about people who fight treat wound help with humanitarian aid for me a special operation is first and foremost about fate this year i wa on a business trip for month out of i talked about dozen of character both in uniform and without adviser to the head of the office of the president of ukraine podolyak said that in six month they will take the crimea what do you say we should be afraid of this there is no need to be afraid we must understand that they keep it in mind and in all seriousness it s not a crazy statement by a city madman they really have it in their plan and i will tell you that if we had not launched a special operation they would have started a war against donbas and crushed it i m sure of it personally just crushed by quantity and on the courage they would go further to the crimea and heavy fighting would ensue and what is happening now in the territory of ukraine and new russian region would happen in crimea if now in the winter campaign they succeed in an offensive operation for example in the zaporozhye direction they can cut our group and reach the border with crimea therefore it is no coincidence that powerful defensive line are being built there now this mean that we calculate all scenario the winter campaign is still more of a revival of hostility or conversely it will be such a trench confrontation it s a change in the nature of the fighting if there is a warm winter then there is no need to wait for any great activity using heavy equipment at the same time if we recall the campaign of the beginning of this year yes in february there were still frost when we came to kiev the equipment calmly went to the kharkiv direction january donetsk airport wa taken despite any weather condition debaltseve wa taken and how did they fight in the great patriotic war they didn t pause for the winter the main thing is that the industry should reach the turn when it will be able to supply some equipment to the troop online every day it ha already been stated that our military industrial complex work in three shift yes yes i know we are doing very well on kalibr we are making up for iskanders very well but we also need modern tank gun barrel because the wear is terrible here in lugansk i have a friend the commander of the cannon division they were given the fourth gun to the hyacinth in these month ok a for the equipment there were complaint in the beginning how do you as it now like the barrel the equipment is also very seriously worn out in the field i repeat where the commander is initiative where he treat the personnel normally where he understands that the fulfillment of the combat mission will depend on how his fighter will be equipped everything is normal there if it is not possible to knock something out of the rear he look for way out to volunteer to sponsor there are example of excellent interaction between business and the army regional authority and the army i m not going to name anyone right now so that i m not accused of bias but there are great example instead of the final who doe time work for last question who doe time work for if hostility continue in one way or another in a global sense now time is playing on u ukraine ha an inexhaustible mobilization resource we called for thousand and they will call conditionally a million but by this time i hope our will have been qualitatively trained and equipped armed and provided with equipment and the enemy will still have problem with equipment and ammunition in the near future one way or another with a cavalry charge we will not drive the enemy to the western border but some kind of turning point i think still in the winter campaign in our direction should happen maybe in the next month a patient in serious condition wa admitted to u from the zone of a special military operation with a diagnosis an explosive injury acute bleeding detachment of the upper and lower jaw with a laryngeal defect list the actually fatal diagnosis of the senior resident of the department of maxillofacial surgery of the naval clinical hospital of the ministry of defense of russia captain of the medical service stanislav latukha military doctor in the crimea were able not only to save the life of the soldier after a massive mine explosive wound to the head but also immediately performed the whole complex of urgent measure in order to return some of his vital function in the future to restore the function of speech swallowing and breathing prosthetics of the larynx plastic surgery of the nose mouth hard and soft palate were performed the tongue wa modeled so that after healing sensitivity returned to it but what to do next when the fighter ha lost a significant part of the bone of the skull and both jaw from the crimea the soldier wa taken to moscow to the maxillofacial surgeon and dentist of the main military clinical hospital named after n n burdenko who will make him several more reconstructive operation a a result of the wound the patient formed a defect in both jaw lip the bottom of the oral cavity the right cheek and the submandibular region on the right a fracture of the right cheekbone complex with displacement now it is important to return the serviceman to a normal social life show on the tablet d model of the future face of the serviceman the head of the center for maxillofacial surgery and dentistry of the gvkg named after n n burdenko colonel of the medical service sergey tereshchuk on a three dimensional model a plan for the reconstruction of the skull on it you can see titanium plate that will hold smaller reconstructed by doctor bone to create a new jaw it wa planned to use a graft from the fibula the three dimensional model of which wa moved into the defect of the lower jaw and curved in accordance with the contour of the donor jaw after that a model of an individual titanium reconstructive plate wa created which wa then printed on a d printer explains tereshchuk surgeon have re created an implant in the area of the bottom of the orbit when it is put in place it will support the eye after that the warrior will undergo aesthetic correction of the face and dental implant will be installed thanks to the professionalism of military surgeon the serviceman will be adapted in society he will be able to talk eat talk facial expression will be preserved moreover after the full restoration of health the serviceman if he wish will even be able to continue military service the russian defense ministry said listen a well will volgograd be renamed stalingrad since the investigative committee of the russian federation ha opened criminal case against ukrainian serviceman and other representative of armed nationalist formation that committed crime against the civilian population of donbas and ukraine among the defendant are the military and political leadership nationalist and representative of the ukrainian security force among the crime are genocide terrorism cruel treatment of the civilian population the use of prohibited mean and method in the armed conflict murder intentional destruction and damage to property article of the criminal code of the russian federation and others the official representative of the investigative committee of russia svetlana petrenko listed she also noted that among the defendant are more than person in particular representative of the high command of the armed force of ukraine a well a commander of military unit who gave criminal order to shell civilian and civilian infrastructure in total the investigation of criminal case ha been completed work to record the action of the kiev regime and it supporter continues the investigative committee of russia establishes and give a legal assessment of the action of all person involved in the crime committed the investigative committee of russia emphasized for me the year in culture can be divided into two era before feb after feb before i felt pretty certain nothing would command my attention like jacques louis david radical draftsman the metropolitan museum of art s icy cerebral unrelentingly rigorous exhibition of drawing from the year around the french revolution no one had ever staged a full scale show of david s work on paper and this one offered an unusual vista of an artist whose grand painting put reason before passion and ideal before blood relation in four drawing for his death of socrates finished in we saw the philosopher prepare to drink the lethal cocktail rather than repudiate his belief eight sketch for his brutus leading right up to showed the roman consul refusing to mourn his traitorous son a their corp are hauled away my feeling for this greatest of neoclassical artist who spun roman precedent into propaganda for the reign of terror and then for napoleon have cycled over many year between adulation and queasiness in front of these drawing at the met i fell in love with david again with his intensity and his frigidity with how in his shadow today s political art look a benign a patty cake here were the slow accretive process of someone ready to die or indeed to kill for a vision of civic virtue and then a week after the met show opened feb i couldn t turn off the livestreams of the kyiv night sky lit up with white flash deranged by baying siren and crackling shell i watched from the secure distance of my phone a refugee streamed westward and those who stayed went underground later i went in person to see what had been destroyed and who wa fighting back why doe culture matter to a person to a nation in paris in kyiv in in because in time of great upheaval you need exemplar to look toward because when you might lose everything you must sum up what should never be forgotten an invasion is not a revolution the young artist caught up in europe s largest conflagration since world war ii are working amid a campaign of terror david by would become a terroriste himself nevertheless when culture took on the dimension of survival ukraine s artist have done what i thought could no longer be done they have met history head on their work is not the work of victim it is the work of combatant of active participant in an explicit culture war proving every day that civic value can help defeat a supposedly superior adversary we don t always have sufficient resource to speak to this evil and be treated a equal the viper tongued poet and novelist serhiy zhadan writes in sky above kharkiv his forthcoming book that chronicle life in the city a cluster munition have rained down on civilian yet our language ha turned out to be much stronger than any attempt to compel u to remain silent to forgo calling a spade a spade or to forgo pronouncing the name we use to identify each other we are trying to stand up to death we are trying to stand up to absolute silence in war zone or in exile on a bunker cast for a few dozen viewer or in front of ten of thousand at the brandenburg gate ukraine s writer filmmaker painter and world beating dj have fought their battle every bit a formidably a their army ha fought theirs in the nearly empty odesa fine art museum stand a full body cast of the crimean born maria kulikovska made of the gelatin that mimic human tissue in ballistic testing with flower pressed into the substitute flesh vic bakin one of kyiv s most compelling young photographer shifted from his moody black and white portrait of raver and model to stark full color reportage from bucha and irpin ukrainian literature retains a documentary impulse that run ring around our self centered autofiction artem chekh the soldier author of absolute zero volunteered for the armed force again and kept writing electronic music especially ha led the charge for ukrainian defiance at home and abroad the young composer oleh shudeiko who performs a heinali livestreamed from a lviv bomb shelter his gossamer adaptation of medieval polyphony for modular synthesizer on from ukraine for ukraine a darkly brilliant new omnibus album by the cutting edge kyiv label standard deviation grief and rage melt into impudently beautiful contemporary threnody gasoline radio a noncommercial station launched in kyiv just this year ha kept ukrainian house techno and even folk music streaming worldwide even amid the power cut repair together a volunteer initiative brings club kid to liberated town clearing the wreckage at beat per minute all over kyiv outside saint sophia cathedral and at gas station by the highway there s a government billboard campaign with a one word slogan overlaid on image of soldier firefighter grandpa dog walker the word is bravery a quality we honor in others but have grown lazy in asking of ourselves david too wa an artist propagandist who put bravery at the core of civic life and revisiting radical draftsman after the russian invasion i found that his hard line had taken on the force of a commandment his horatii triplet arm raised a they pledge to fight to the death for the roman cause his sabine woman stepping between two army risking their life and their child s to stop the fighting his spartan at thermopylae who refused to surrender to a vastly larger invading army and whom the zelensky administration invoked after the siege of mariupol which it styled the thermopylae of the st century is art worth dying for no i don t think so but art can summon u to perceive what we cannot live without through form and chronicle that might in the word of one unnamed revolutionary critic looking at david s drawing of the oath of the tennis court in exude a love of country of virtue and of liberty on my desk now there s a glass vial containing a single ear of wheat each spikelet charred black at it edge it wa a gift from a ukrainian curator now a refugee in paris and it came from a field near kherson that the occupier burned a collective punishment thousand of these burnt wheat stalk lay underfoot in an exhibition of painting and ceramic made since feb the show wa called terre libre free land bakhmut ukraine in the embattled eastern ukrainian city of bakhmut there is no such thing a silence day are measured not so much by time but by volume yesterday wa quieter the morning wa loud but the afternoon when the russian like to increase their shelling in the city s south and east will certainly be louder so go the thinking of many of bakhmut s remaining resident it s louder than usual said valeriy a bakhmut resident who declined to give his last name a the crescendo of artillery reverberated off his apartment block on tuesday but they re shooting every day in recent month russian force have made bakhmut one of the focal point in their quest to capture the eastern donbas region the city s altered acoustic are one result of near constant bombardment since the summer and by far the most present the thud and blast echo for mile with a pre war population of around bakhmut once had a far different feeling with child playing tourist visiting the city s renowned winery and walking path bustling with resident on tuesday the sound in the city center were howling dog sheared strip of damaged roofing clattering and a singing older woman who wa otherwise drowned out by the diesel engine of a ukrainian tank lumbering toward the front line beyond the ruined multistory building and the soviet wide road is the seemingly unending back and forth of artillery some people refer to it sarcastically a rocket tennis the shelling is background noise until it isn t it seriousness is deciphered by determining distance direction and volume distant tapping machine gun fire loud bang nearby outgoing mortar muffled bang further away outgoing howitzer salvo of distant thud outgoing rocket whistle overhead artillery shell in flight loud whistle followed by loud crump incoming fire ear shattering blast that break window and set off car alarm run to the basement throw yourself to the ground do whatever it take to live further outside bakhmut the sound merge together in the distant hill sharp crack of ukrainian artillery break through the thud in the city irina a retired nurse with a home on bakhmut s outskirt stood in her living room a artillery rattled the window and the door those are our boy firing she exclaimed god protect them i am in constant contact with the former mayor of chita who left for the svo read today the mayor tomorrow is a private the head of chita sapozhnikov who went to the front honestly told about the russian army i will not quote here all the correspondence senior lieutenant with senior warrant officer i will cite only our recent sm dialogue hello our material wa read only on the kp website almost half a million it s a record alexander mikhailovich we are waiting for the continuation thanks in advance hello i received a text reply sure yesterday the send off wa filmed by the press service of the district i gave them your phone and on monday december the editor received two video material at once both of you right now and will see in the first the speech of the chief of staff of the district training center of the eastern military district vladimir kozlov today we are escorting fellow far easterner to the zone of the special military operation native of buryatia yakutia sakhalin and amur region chukotka primorsky kamchatka and trans baikal territory nachshtaba also said that the preparation lasted two month on this score the press service for the first time gave the following explanation combat coordination wa carried out by the newly formed crew of infantry fighting vehicle ifvs armoured personnel carrier tank and artillery piece by the way please note several ifvs can be seen in the video and the second synchronicity in the background a march performed by a military band is a monologue by senior warrant officer sapozhnikov i will give only a small but impressive fragment a more complete video here on our website alexander sapozhnikov the feeling is you know that we are going to the zone of a special military operation a part of not only a formed but also a cohesive regiment i believe that we will stand shoulder to shoulder back to back we re ready i am confident in my comrade in arm i am sure that victory will be ours we have been given a combat task and we will fulfill it one hundred percent therefore for russia for the motherland for our president wait for u all alive and well and god willing in the near future serviceman a part of the unit will be sent by air and grid in kherson a in so many other ukrainian city ha been relentlessly pounded by russian missile an attempt to bring this country to it knee and people are burning log to heat their home almost all store are shut one of the few that remained open monday advertised everything percent off inside natasha sekeresh the shopkeeper leaned forlornly against the counter in other part of the world people are beginning to celebrate the holiday she said here there is nothing to be glad about she listed the woe no electricity no running water no heat she also ha no customer soon she said she will have no job her bos the shop s owner plan to close down a soon a the remaining item the handful of plastic lighter the half full box of picnic candy bar the little pyramid of evaporated milk tin and a few other thing are sold then what for me she asked a she wa talking a man wrapped in a huge parka popped in need some bread he asked he worked at a shop across the street no she said i don t have anybody to sell it to me neither he said this city is empty many people left right after liberation more have evacuated since russian shelling ha intensified with attack in the past two week the russian are blasting mortar rocket artillery even tank fire against civilian this is our great pain said yaroslav yanushevych the head of kherson s military administration the russian are gone he said but they re still taking life the ukrainian military is trying to push them farther away to get kherson out of artillery range it wa occupied by russian troop for more than eight month but it won t be truly liberated official say until the territory around kherson is liberated a well near the main square two year old boy played a game where they sprinted across a patch of ice and then slid a far a they could their eye shone glassy in the cold it dropped to degree fahrenheit on monday it wa the first day of snow i haven t been in a classroom for three year said liosha counting the time off since the covid pandemic and then the war i actually want to be in school he and his buddy kyryl kill time by hanging around the square waiting to shake soldier hand and maybe get a velcro military patch off them we tried to talk to the russian liosha said but they didn t really interact with u but these soldier he tipped his head toward a squad of ukrainian filing past with their assault rifle they re cool just about every day since liberation another person here is killed russian troop often fire on the town at night when people are sleeping people here feel especially vulnerable because there are not many bomb shelter or cellar a there are in most ukrainian city relic of the cold war the water table is too high to dig them we have no place to hide said olena yermolenko who life by the river if there were more people around the death toll from the shelling would surely be higher but in a city with a prewar population of around maybe a few thousand folk are left in the center of town the other day a shell slammed into a bank building so close to me a i wa waiting at a coffee shop across the street for a bowl of soup that i could feel the shock wave blast into my ear for several second afterward i heard a strange ringing sound then silence on seniavyna street on sunday afternoon a shell hit a story apartment building tetiana roshchyna wa in her kitchen making meatball soup the explosion shook the whole block the window exploded creating a blizzard of glass you have to understand this is purely a residential area she said no military no factory just apartment kherson used to be a major industrial hub home to one of ukraine s biggest port which shipped steel and grain to the world now the main port building is covered in graffiti it window are smashed snow blow inside i can t even describe to you what it s like to live through this she said it s like a really bad dream anatoliy makarenko a neighbor said that when he looked at the damaged building he wanted to grab an automatic weapon and fight the russian himself he is on monday a team of three woman who worked for the local government waited to help people who were trying to cross the river and come back to kherson military official announced over the weekend that they were allowing people to use the river to escape they had closed off access to it after liberation to make sure russian didn t try to sneak back in official said that perhaps a few hundred people mostly retiree live on the marshy island across from kherson in small summer home ukrainian call it a grey zone a space between the warring army but by monday afternoon official said none of the people in this grey zone had ventured onto the water no one had actually tried to cross except the one couple who lived farther away in a town still held by the russian and whose boat wa shot nobody is coming said one of the woman waiting for arrival they are too afraid the methodical destruction of the ukrainian military and energy infrastructure continues on december the russian army inflicted a massive blow on object in the depth of ukraine the goal is to make it a difficult a possible to deliver ammunition to the front the current blow wa perhaps the most powerful during the special operation the russian military department doe not officially report on it scale however the internet resource of ukraine write about air
