oleg tsarev why ha russia already inflicted several massive blow on the energy facility of ukraine because these are the object that are easiest to disable where the effectiveness of missile attack is maximum these are transformer substation such transformer are not produced in ukraine i myself once built a factory i know how much the network cost design manufacture order installation very long and expensive that s why the substation are being hit we beat the light go out and after a day or a week everything is already in order television work heat is supplied repair thanks to the ukrainian propaganda for the blissful picture we and ukrainian too see only a small part of what is happening in the energy sector of ukraine light in home is not the main thing most of the energy go to industrial facility and they suffer and it is more and more difficult to repair each time we know this in peaceful life a transformer broke down spare line were turned on electrician arrived new part were inserted and that s it but today these reserve are becoming le and le and they themselves say that a few more blow and the system will fall there will be no single energy system there will be only island throughout ukraine which will supply electricity sporadically no light everything will stand up i remember it well from lugansk donetsk crimea our civilization is based on electricity if it doesn t we re falling into the stone age mobile communication subway sewerage heating pump should pump water do not work there is no water business stand up there is no place to work to receive a salary will the train get up and the delivery of weapon from the west since the blessed soviet time we have a huge number of diesel locomotive that were in reserve at junction station they were kept specifically in case of war so ala they will provide a minimum cargo flow what do people think what are their mood of course life without light and without work doe not inspire optimism yes propaganda assures that this on the contrary will strengthen the resolve of ukrainian mobilize them it s not that my ukrainian friend perceive all this a a catastrophe that is approaching and it is unclear when territory how long can you wait there really are a lot of them i won t say the majority but they are that s for sure this is written by friend and just subscriber to my telegram channel and what are people in ukraine thinking about now about politics or how to keep warm when the light are turned off people begin to be interested in the simplest household thing how to eat where to charge the phone when to have time to collect water turning off heating in city is yet to come it s going to be a disaster but already now people pay le attention to front line report politics is not watched on tv and the tv itself is le likely to work i have no doubt that this worry zelensky s office what to expect in winter at the front i can only speculate but apparently the strategy is to strengthen the defense the fact that foreign intelligence closely monitor the entire theater of military operation and leak data on the movement of our troop to the press but for now they are silent the west took ukraine on this compared to the same afghanistan the war in which according to various estimate cost from a trillion to three trillion dollar so far the west ha spent only billion on ukraine and what doe for businessmen were arrested another billion compare the european union ha so far allocated only billion to ukraine this is even le than the interest on the capital seized from u such a conflict in highest tension of force in the donbas why do nato coin tactic not work against russia and what is the strategic importance of artemovsk bakhmut these question on the air of the radio komsomolskaya pravda were answered by a military expert ta observer retired colonel viktor litovkin when it come to bakhmut artemovsk hot news come from there kiev admits that this is a problem for them it s hard there but our military is moving forward why is this strategically important to u because bakhmut which is still under ukrainian control but in fact it is a russian territory and the city is more correctly called artemovsk is an important railway and road junction through it go train convoy carrying weapon and ammunition to the line of clash near artyomovsk there are salt mine where military equipment ammunition where ukrainian hospital are located and much more from there come the replenishment of the ukrainian army including although this replenishment is not always sufficiently prepared but this is a replenishment which is still led after all mainly not by ukrainian major and colonel but more often by american instructor and even more often by pole the enemy s loss in this area are great there are a lot of them dying it s just that ukraine in the donbas is plugging the gap of it defense with human flesh and that s also why it s quite difficult for u to advance we have fewer people in this area and this factor also matter but we have more artillery installation multiple launch rocket system and we of course continue to advance but we are advancing rather slowly because we are confronted by the enemy in well equipped position in several echelon with concreted underground structure it is difficult to overcome them without loss very difficult but possible our command always try to do without loss and doe everything to save the life of russian soldier why don t nato s advanced tactic work for ukrainian there s different training kiev often sends it soldier and officer abroad for training but we must understand that abroad they are now simply using a lot of money to train these people therefore they teach them their tactical program at an accelerated pace they rarely meet the immediate condition of battle against a serious and strong army such a the russian one two or three week in the uk do not make rambo out of ukrainian at the british german czech training ground the ukrainian military do not learn the practice of real combat well they shot cardboard target there well went on reconnaissance well they conducted several ambush where no one hurt anyone do they get the skill of real fighting modern tank there or whatever they are taught how to deal with cruise missile they don t teach of course not moreover kiev doe not have such air defense system that are capable of intercepting such missile and the ukrainian military is not trained to work on modern air defense system and the system that the west ha managed to supply to ukraine are not ukrainian but representative of those country that supplied these system there are already a lot of them so far a meager amount ha been supplied seven cheetah system cannot block the sky at a distance of a thousand kilometer ukraine is catastrophically losing people ursula von der leyen gave a figure of people but i think this figure wa sharply underestimated their loss are greater for every person killed in battle according to military statistic there are three to four death from wound not counting six or seven wounded or mutilated therefore it is possible to imagine how many people ukraine loses every day without even delving into the statistical data that certain politician cite read also the battle for the key border of donbas ha begun the armed force of ukraine throw soldier to the field of death to stop the offensive of russia voenkor dmitry steshin the situation of the armed force of ukraine near artemovsk is close to critical detail the best interviewer of celebrated it th anniversary with the jubilee smelting of pig iron the acting head of the donetsk people s republic denis pushilin also took part in the landmark event the th anniversary of the yenakiieve metallurgical plant testifies to how deep the root of the enterprise and the city are say the head of the region but the most important asset of this enterprise at all time of course were people for more than a century of history the yenakiieve plant ha gone through many test but the team coped with everything during the great patriotic war the enterprise wa taken to the urals but after the complete liberation of the city after day the first smelting took place at the plant the last eight year have also been difficult for yenakiieve steel during which hostility continue in the republic but despite all today s difficulty the enterprise is working developing and preserving tradition the manager of the plant alexander kovalenko said that for all the time of it existence the plant produced million ton of pig iron we calculated that if all this cast iron is turned into railway rail then this way you can twist the globe more than two and a half time and if you turn all this into a building profile then you can lay a line from the moon to the earth time he said it is difficult to imagine what physical effort had to be made to produce such an amount such a river of metal among the current employee of yenakiieve steel there are many who have devoted more than one decade to their native plant many who represent not the first generation of metallurgist devoted to the yenakiieve enterprise a lot of generation have worked and are working here we hope that our metallurgy will prosper say alexey velmozhin deputy head of the blast furnace shop there is such a film man of steel all our people are made of steel with a chic character with a good attitude with patriotism for their enterprise for their city and for their republic there were no metallurgist in the family of alexander titov he is the first in the family who decided to connect his life with this sphere and ha been working for yenakiieve steel for year now alexander is a master of production of the blast furnace shop engaged in hot area of work despite the fact that there were no metallurgist in my family my father wa a miner my mother wa a trade worker i wa very attracted to blast furnace production say alexander when i came to the enterprise i wa trained by the driver of the weighing car sergey golovko he wa my teacher and mentor a very competent specialist now he is on a well deserved rest there are also those who no longer work but do not forget the working family among them is the former head of the blast furnace shop with year of management experience alexander kuznetsov he is an honored metallurgist laureate of the state prize in every spark of cast iron that we will see is the work patience and feat of all generation of the glorious labor collective of the plant kuznetsov said before the start of the anniversary smelting of pig iron we wish that cast iron will be poured at our plant for more than one hundred year at the foundry yard of blast furnace no where the anniversary smelting took place the watch wa carried out by the master of the blast furnace dmitry zhuk senior shift master alexander sharafanenko gornovnye evgeny chikin ruslan ruchkin alexander rybachuk alexander dragnysh alexander galitsyn alexander karpunin alexander skiba and andrey nikiforenko reference kp yenakiieve iron and steel work wa founded in by the russian belgian metallurgical society one of the founder of the enterprise wa a well known engineer merchant and industrialist fedor yenakiev in whose honor the donbas city wa named it wa at yenakiieve steel that advanced technology were introduced here even in pre revolutionary time the largest blast furnace in europe appeared the first cast iron in russia on mineral fuel wa smelted here and it wa at this plant that the first soviet sinter plant and filling machine were launched to date yenakiieve iron and steel work remains one of the flagship of the donbas industry which ha a full cycle of metallurgical production from the production of agglomerate and cast iron to the manufacture of commercial cast and hot rolled square billet long product and wire rod yenakiieve steel transferred to the management of the southern mining and metallurgical complex symk of the russian investor evgeny yurchenko the company is increasing it industrial capacity and developing preserving century old tradition how the united state is ready to help the ukrainian energy sector according to the new york time washington is organizing a contact working group to help the independent energy system the same a the support group of ukraine in the field of defense for the supply of weapon the american want to urgently help kiev repair power equipment and also protect power plant and power grid earlier after russian will happen next kyiv ukraine le than a month after driving russian force from the city of kherson on the west bank of the dnipro river the ukrainian authority on saturday issued an urgent call for civilian to evacuate russian occupied area on the eastern bank suggesting that kyiv s military might press it offensive and try to establish a foothold across the waterway the evacuation is necessary due to the possible intensification of hostility in this area yaroslav yanushevych the head of the kherson regional military administration in ukraine s south said in an announcement to resident with all of the main river crossing having been destroyed the only way to gain the western shore would be on private boat and other vessel and it remains unclear how many people would be able to make it across the river or even try to a ban on river crossing is being lifted from saturday to monday to facilitate the evacuation mr yanushevych said noting that only one dock would be opened all those fleeing russian occupied territory must bring document certifying their identity and confirming their ukrainian citizenship he said the public call for evacuation while most likely intended to signal to russia that an assault might be coming could also be an element in the information war before ukraine launched it counteroffensive in the north this fall official issued several highly public warning about a coming counteroffensive in the kherson region that did eventually happen though well after russia had suffered grievous loss in the north ukrainian force are pushing on into the winter after those two sweeping counteroffensive in the northeast and south they are also once again stepping up strike on russian supply route command center and ammunition depot from new forward position in an effort to staunch it loss and regain momentum in the war the russian military ha been funneling newly drafted conscript with little training and mostly inadequate equipment along the front line in ukraine the institute for the study of war a washington research group said in a friday assessment but a the ground hardens and fighting intensifies russia remains mostly on the defensive and analyst said that the russian held area east of kherson city and the dnipro river wa not well defended russian force clearly do not expect to be able to prevent ukrainian force from getting across the river nor are the russian prioritizing defensive position to stop such a crossing the institute for the study of war said this past week after analyzing publicly available satellite photo of the russian defensive position the russian withdrawal from kherson wa both an embarrassment for the kremlin which had only recently declared the region to be a part of russia and a strategic setback a it put the ukrainian in a better position to threaten supply line from crimea with long range precision weapon provided by the west since their retreat russian force have continued to shell the region and the city of kherson the local ukrainian authority said on saturday that russian troop had opened fire time the previous day striking a number of target including residential building and an oncology center those detail could not be independently verified after being driven across the dnipro russian force set about fortifying defensive position about to mile from the eastern bank according to the ukrainian military and satellite image but the river divide ukrainian and russian force along a route that stretch more than mile and russian force are spread thin farther to the northeast where the river widens into a vast reservoir held back by a vital dam in nova kakhovka ukrainian official and resident said that the russian occupation administration this past week began to flee farther east the ukrainian military ha noted that it wa seeing a decrease in the number of russian troop in the town and village along the river a minimal number of occupier remain in the city the military said last month the account wa supported by local resident reached by telephone in recent day north of the dam speculation continued to swirl around russian intention at the zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant which ha been occupied by russian force since early in the war and where ukrainian intelligence ha estimated that at least russian soldier are garrisoned rafael mariano grossi the head of the international atomic energy agency said at a news conference in rome on friday that the agency wa almost there in brokering a deal for russian troop to pull out of the plant and to create a demilitarized zone around the facility which ha been at the center of frequent shelling we have a proposal on the table which simply put is aiming to stop the folly of bombing the largest nuclear power plant in europe he said although the kremlin ha pushed back on ukrainian suggestion that it force were preparing to leave the nuclear plant alexei likhachev the head of russia s nuclear energy agency confirmed that negotiation were continuing with the international atomic energy agency the united nation nuclear watchdog group kherson ukraine on the night of march illia karamalikov received an unexpected phone call a a nightclub owner and member of kherson s city council he had been running a volunteer neighborhood watch in this southern ukrainian city that had just been invaded by thousand of russian troop the soldier had taken kherson with little resistance xadbut then largely kept going racing toward other territory and showing no interest in administering the city looting and chaos followed until mr karamalikov and others organized neighborhood patrol of local men they weren t working with the russian but had their permission on the phone that night one of mr karamalikov s watch leader reported that a team of guard had encountered someone stumbling toward a checkpoint in a strange green uniform slathered in mud looking shellshocked he wasn t a looter he wa a lost russian pilot and they had disarmed him and were keeping him in a school classroom it wa a highly unusual prisoner of war situation a band of civilian capturing an enemy officer in a city that the enemy control nobody knew what to do said mr karamalikov s lawyer mykhailo velychko they couldn t hand him over to ukrainian force there were no ukrainian force in the city at that time and there wa no red cross and the russian were everywhere what followed over the next few hour and continues to play out in court month later reveals the blurred line between complicity and survival that many ukrainian had to navigate after the russian invaded their country and that pose vexing problem for the authority now a they decide whom to punish mr karamalikov brought the captured pilot back to his house and locked him in a utility room later that night he arranged to return the soldier to the russian he saw no other option the ukrainian authority saw thing differently they later arrested mr karamalikov a a collaborator and charged him with treason he is awaiting trial and face life in prison in the area of ukraine that russia ha seized more than a fifth of the country million of civilian have had to coexist with an occupying army that wields all the power the ukrainian have recently clawed back chunk of their territory like kherson which wa liberated in mid november and almost immediately the hunt wa on for collaborator people are now being judged by the choice they made during very stressful occupied time a page indictment accuses mr karamalikov of helping an enemy soldier escape and resume aggression against ukraine but in interview with more than a dozen people in kherson including those who expressed reservation about mr karamalikov s reputation a a domineering businessman all of them said he had done the right thing a head of the neighborhood patrol his supporter said he had to make a decision that would carry grave consequence for him and his community handing the soldier back to the russian seemed to go against the basic principle of war if he had told his people to keep the soldier in captivity in a city controlled by russian troop it could have put everyone involved in danger a for a third option mr karamalikov would not contemplate that his rabbi said with a life in his hand i can t imagine illia ever killing anyone said rabbi yossef itzhak wolff what he did wa the most humane decision he could make rabbi wolff wa speaking by phone from berlin and sounded pained he said he wa not sure when or even if he ll return to ukraine like mr karamalikov he said that some people in town suspect him of collaborating with the russian for what he view a a benign act allowing a few jewish russian officer from the occupying force to join prayer at his temple the rabbi said that the russian officer whom he described a the men who ran the city had showed up at the synagogue with armed guard and that there had been no way to refuse them he said that he and his family could have left kherson at the beginning of the war and avoided all this a so many police officer and politician did but that they had stayed and the wall of their house shook from shelling all these people who ran away are judging u he said these are cruel time the russian stormed into kherson on feb the first day of the war thundering up from the crimean peninsula with an ease that raised suspicion of local complicity the ukrainian government is now investigating several intelligence officer suspected of leaking critical information on kherson s defense to the russian the security service fled the army disappeared police officer vanished from the street it wa a city without a head rabbi wolff said many resident said they were in a state of shock they felt abandoned by ukrainian force and wondered why they didn t put up more of a fight right now we support zelensky but after the war we will come back to him and ask him about this said valentyn yermolenko a retired fisherman who lived through the occupation and provided snack and hot coffee to the neighborhood watchman life in kherson got harder and harder supply couldn t get across the front line and the city with a prewar population of about began to run out of food the looting became so bad resident said that thief rolled freezer stocked with the last frozen chicken in town out of the supermarket and down the main road it wa insane said oleksandr samoylenko a politician and head of kherson s regional council who left when the russian invaded kherson wa under russian occupation but the russian weren t interested in taking over the administration the water the sale thing the market they didn t want the headache mr karamalikov stepped in along with some other city leader he organized the citizen patrol men mostly unarmed some with stick who prowled kherson s street after dark they arrested curfew violator and petty criminal sometimes making them pick up garbage or perform other community service it wa a short lived grass root criminal justice system mr karamalikov had something of a godfather reputation in his city at nearly six foot tall stocky and well connected across business and politics he owned two popular nightclub amigo and shade and several grocery store he wa known a a man who would engage anyone in the interest of doing business and he rubbed some people the wrong way i don t think he s honest or altruistic and i ll say it to his face said mr samoylenko but in kherson s small jewish community the remnant of what wa once a major strand in this city s fabric mr karamalikov wa widely respected before the holocaust rabbi wolff said kherson had temple now there is only one left kherson s chabad synagogue and mr karamalikov regularly allowed it to use his nightclub space for free he never said no rabbi wolff said mr karamalikov wa busy during those first chaotic week of the war his lawyer said rushing around kherson in his white audi checking on neighborhood patrol stopping by the synagogue and turning his business into de facto aid depot where he handed out carton of supply this brought him face to face with russian officer in particular a colonel who dressed in all black and went by the code name alpha mr karamalikov had little choice his lawyer said jumpy russian troop were spread across the city and mr karamalikov needed to talk to russian commander like alpha to make sure they didn t shoot any of the volunteer around p m on march a plumber a carpenter and the carpenter s son were standing at a checkpoint when they saw the silhouette of someone flitting in and out of the shadow a voice then yelled out i m one of you and out stepped the russian soldier who had mistaken the neighborhood watchman for fellow russian andriy skvortsov the carpenter s son said the soldier wa bewildered and barely able to string a sentence together when he realized the men in front of him were ukrainian he looked extremely frightened mr skvortsov said he wa childlike and helpless mr skvortsov said and he wa heavily armed when they patted him down they found one short barreled ak one makarov officer s pistol and five ammunition magazine they also found his military identification card showing he wa lieutenant dmitrii pavlovich savchenko a combat helicopter pilot from his discombobulated speech they pieced together that he had walked nearly mile from kherson s airport which the ukrainian had just shelled killing many russian the watchman took the soldier to a school and called mr karamalikov there wa no easy solution the red cross which handle prisoner issue wa not operating in kherson at the time and there wa no way to get the captured pilot to ukrainian force who were mile away despite all the anti russian feeling coursing through kherson the civilian guard did not mistreat the soldier a small crowd curious gathered around him and some took selfies mr karamalikov s lawyer said that his client wa determined to treat the soldier humanely and what he ultimately did wa in accord with the geneva convention mr karamalikov called alpha and they arranged to meet in the morning until then the soldier would stay at his house at daybreak mr karamalikov met alpha and handed over the russian soldier what mr karamalikov didn t know his lawyer said wa that ukrainian intelligence agent had tapped alpha s phone and heard the whole discussion by mid april the russian had imported hundred of intelligence agent and other security officer into kherson who arrested many civilian and tortured some of them at the same time ukrainian security service had their own network of informant in the city and were keeping tab on anyone suspected of collaborating with the russian mr karamalikov decided it wa time to go on april he packed his wife his mother in law and three of his five child into two car to drive mile to odesa a ukrainian controlled city a soon a they crossed into ukrainian territory they were stopped ukrainian intelligence agent pulled mr karamalikov out of his car and took him away his family and lawyer said he wa brought to an interrogation center in kryvyi rih beaten all over his body cut with sharp object on his leg and injected with drug and forced to talk official in kherson declined to comment on the allegation of torture but acknowledged that at least two of the agent involved in the treatment of mr karamalikov have been placed under investigation it s hard to believe that our own country which is committed to democracy and ha it own law would do this his son artem said in a phone interview in the indictment prosecutor said that by releasing the soldier mr karamalikov organized the further participation of a russian serviceman in aggression against ukraine they also charged him with leaking personnel data on military veteran and pro ukrainian political figure his lawyer said he didn t do that and that the information wa already publicly available prosecutor also accused him of producing a positive image of russia by distributing russian humanitarian aid and helping make russian propaganda video which his lawyer denied but the crux of the case his lawyer said wa the captured soldier and to this day we have asked a question that no one can answer what else in those circumstance in that city at that time wa he supposed to do the kherson prosecutor s office declined to respond to that shane darcy an international law professor at the irish center for human right of the university of galway ha been following medium report on collaborator investigation in ukraine including the karamalikov case it sound like a collaboration this wa a particularly innocuous example handing over a dazed and confused soldier mr darcy said but he added it s not for me to define for the ukrainian what they consider collaboration mr samoylenko the local politician said that despite his misgiving about mr karamalikov s analysis about the conflict million of ukrainian are bracing for a winter of worsening hardship russian airstrikes have knocked out power and other utility depriving household of electricity heating and water the attack are raising fear about a collapse of ukraine s energy grid which would push many vulnerable ukrainian to the brink for more insight on the crisis i spoke to denise brown the u n s resident coordinator in ukraine who is responsible for overseeing the international humanitarian response denise took up her position in august and ha since been traveling around the country to see how people are coping our conversation ha been condensed and edited denise let s start with your recent travel where have you been and what is the situation there in the past two week i ve been to kherson twice mykolaiv and the sumy region in kherson two week ago i saw empty grocery store there wa nothing not a crumb supply chain were disrupted many older people were still there and were very happy to see u you could sense their relief when i wa back there this past sunday it wa different first of all it wa much colder they are re establishing the power line but because of the mine progress is slow electricity is linked to water which is linked to heating so it wa cold there were three grocery store open and the one that wa empty two week ago wa full and there were people waiting to get into the grocery store i felt that after the hope and relief two week earlier people were worried extremely worried what is the biggest humanitarian concern heading into winter what i worry about is the damage to the energy infrastructure we knew that winter wa coming in our humanitarian response plan there s a very specific component dedicated to winter we planned for that but it s the damage to the energy infrastructure which is the new dimension which is overwhelming and which give all of u cause to worry the humanitarian community ha been reaching million people since the war started a the energy infrastructure damage grows if at some point it all disappears what then that s the question the generator are super super important how many generator can we bring in to run the hospital to run the heating center to run everything how many can everybody bring in from our humanitarian community we believe we can bring in and the spare part that have been requested that have to come from outside the country to keep the system up and running it s an absolute primary objective to keep people safe you need electricity water and heating that s the biggest worry everybody s biggest worry where are the most vulnerable i think right now it is the kherson kharkiv and zaporizhzhia region the data that we have suggests that which is why i spend most of my time going back and forth to these area when we go to these area we see a lot of elderly people who didn t have the mean to move or didn t want to leave their home behind we also worry about woman alone with child we worry a lot about people with disability who may be on their own we tend to focus a lot on those group to provide them with support not just materially but also psychologically people have been living in community under temporary russian control on the face of people i see stress and anxiety i ve been greeted by scream and cry in some place moving forward there will be huge gap if the energy structure collapse the worst case scenario from my point of view is people left on their own the elderly woman with child people with disability we need to make sure we know where they are if we don t that s a big problem the linkage to local organization is key because they are present in those area are you seeing any sign of a possible exodus a new wave of refugee we haven t noticed any movement across the border i don t think ukrainian want to leave i think they want to stay they have been through a lot already i think they want to see this through how long do you think the war will last are you planning for a long war i m only thinking about humanitarian assistance and ensuring that we are meeting the need created by this war follow our coverage of the war on the nytimes channel in ukraine around the world we also recommend thanks for reading adam pasick will be here on monday carole over the past few week resident of the kherson region have had a hard time but the russian military and volunteer support and help every day so in the new territory humanitarian headquarters of the russian child s ombudsman child in the hand are already working through them the coordination of search operation of the missing guy will go the commissioner for child s right under the president of the russian federation maria lvova belova assured that she would assist in finding child in the donetsk and lugansk people s republic zaporozhye and kherson region together with her the volunteer search and rescue team lisa alert will work it chairman grigory sergeyev said that application for the search for missing resident of these territory including minor are received regularly but the squad sometimes ha a hard time due to the lack of contact and a clear algorithm of work new region are still only being integrated into russia they have a different administrative structure and the search process debugged over a decade doe not always work here it is difficult to establish the necessary contact on the fly lvova belova said according to sergeyev the rescue team is already receiving application to search for missing resident from all four new region among the missing are small child skadovsk alexandrovskaya str phone more than ten year ago in russia in order to reduce the burden on state body where citizen appeal are continuously received a service of multifunctional center mfcs wa created which later received the name my document the center have made the life of russian easier saving them from wasting time in queue for some certificate document or public service in russia everyone know that through the employee of the mfc office on the principle of one window you can submit document to social protection the pension fund city department and many other department moreover already percent of service are available in any my document center regardless of the place of registration in the near future this system will fully include new region the dpr lpr kherson and zaporozhye region moreover the beginning ha already been laid on november the first such center opened in kherson henichesk center are on the way in the lpr at least one will open before the end of the year in the zaporozhye region and in the dpr the unified registration center working here began to be transformed into mfcs in the spring of this year to date there are such center in the republic their specialist can help to order a medical policy make state registration of right to real estate conduct a technical inventory get confirmation of civil status record permit for the division of property legalize title document issue duplicate of various document and certificate from the notarial archive and so on but in order for the service provided to resident to be of higher quality the employee of the new center should have the same set of competency a their colleague in other region of the country by the way the mechanism for selecting future specialist in the mfc system is quite strict this is the study of resume interview and the approved procedure for test test ranging from primary test to as the general cultural level and erudition of applicant they pa test in the russian language and speech literacy test on knowledge of information technology and the use of office program test on knowledge of the basic of relevant legislation there is also a test on communicative ability which allows you to as the ability of a future specialist to communicate with people listen and hear any interlocutor the staff of the mfc is selected in such a way that it includes both established specialist and young people that the life and professional experience of some combined with creativity and the ability to new idea of others give the best result the center have a system of continuous professional development of employee they constantly monitor change in legislation the regulatory framework the emergence of new service etc because mfc specialist must equally competently provide all type of service on november in the capital of the chernozem region voronezh with the support of the all russian popular front onf the first shift of the training program for specialist of the mfc of the ldnr one window of a big country wa launched the program wa developed by social activist and the ministry of economic development med of the russian federation with the support of the presidential grant foundation a the governor of the voronezh region alexander gusev noted it is especially important for the presidential movement to interact with the employee of the mfc since they work with the population on a daily basis the all russia people s front in turn monitor the integration of territory into the legal space of the russian federation it is important for u to be in constant contact with the employee of the mfc due to this we receive important feedback see what decision are stalled and we can timely draw the attention of the russian government enterprise in the world say the director of the plant gleb tersky we mine ore with an iron content of up to percent for comparison there is usually up to percent iron in the ore since the company ha by the year s end caitlin mcfall is a reporter at fox news digital covering politics u s and world news kyiv ukraine elevator across ukraine s capital are stocked with emergency supply in case the power fails bank have sent message to customer to assure them their money is safe in the event of prolonged blackout the national philharmonic played on tuesday night on a stage lit by battery powered lantern and doctor last week performed surgery by flashlight this is kyiv a modern thriving european capital of million people and now a war torn city struggling with shortage of electricity running water cellphone service central heating and the internet one popular cafe ha created two menu one featuring heated food like homemade pasta for when it ha power a second offering cold dish like greek yogurt with granola and applesauce when it doesn t at another restaurant a chef cooked on a sidewalk grill a two young men warmed their hand over the coal the sun set early before the school day is done so child hold flashlight while waiting for their parent to arrive in total darkness to pick them up generator of all size rattle and roar across the city where municipal official estimate that million people are still without power for more than hour a day kyiv which had been relatively unscathed since last spring ha in recent month become a target again a russia sent wave of missile targeting ukraine s energy grid after nine month of war nothing is so new a to be shocking but the attack on power have left resident of kyiv exasperated and exhausted with temperature in the city often below freezing extended power outage are also potentially deadly threatening health care service raising the risk of people suffering hypothermia and leading to a rise in accident even a crew work around the clock to repair damage from the latest barrage one last week that temporarily knocked every nuclear power plant in the country offline the ukrainian authority issued urgent warning that another wave of missile could be on it way you go to bed knowing today wa bad and tomorrow could be worse vlad medyk a year old musician said on monday he ha moved his bed away from the window in case a russian missile explodes nearby and he try to make sure his phone is fully charged before he fall asleep so he can hear an air raid alarm a he spoke he wa busy improvising a covering from cardboard box to protect a new generator from the falling snow outside the music shop where he work last week the sky above kyiv thundered a russian missile were shot down over the capital roughly a dozen more found a target part of a fusillade of the more than that russia ha aimed at infrastructure across ukraine since october the damage from the last assault ha so far proven the most difficult to recover from a week later most resident still do not know when they will have power herman halushchenko the country s energy minister said on wednesday that the stability of electricity supply wa improving every day if this is key there will be no further attack on the power system then in the near future we will be able to stabilize and reduce the time of the outage he said but the hardship of the past week have already changed mr medyk s outlook one of the missile destroyed a music studio in an industrial park on the city s outskirt where he play with his band onaway killing two security guard and a woman who were there at the time planning for the future is a luxury he said he doe not have he is simply trying to get through the present you don t think about entertainment about work that really brings you pleasure he said you think about banal life thing for survival it all come down to this for the most vulnerable older resident struggling to walk up darkened stairway in high rise apartment the sick who need urgent care traumatized child who crave routine the hardship can be dire for many more it is a strange and wearing life through all the stress and danger though kyiv resident grind on showing up for work caring for family chipping in to help others in need and even allowing themselves a few indulgence maryna musat a masseuse who work in central kyiv said she wa surprised that not a single client had canceled recently we all carry on despite the darkness she said even on the day last week when strike were bursting in the air a regular client managed to reach her for a booking so i took my bag and went to work she said it s a bit depressing when you work in total darkness for hour but i learned to massage with closed eye in the podil neighborhood the capital s old trading district generator were providing power to pharmacy restaurant health clinic hotel and sporting good store a business seemed determined to keep their door open if the molotov cocktail wa the symbol of defiance for the citizen army of baristas janitor and accountant that sprang up after russia invaded nine month ago the generator is now the weapon of choice you are alone in darkness he said unpredictability ha led to improvisation we created this menu that say kitchen with no light and kitchen with generator so everyone will still have some food and realized i am going to miss it if i go somewhere she said so i decided to stay here and support the economy somehow antonina kharchenko said she no longer try to take the metro to work since fewer now provide bright light and stable voltage in the home of kirov resident in the old transformer there is no level of voltage regulation at the output and the modern one allows it that is if there is issue of food security of the zaporizhzhya region remains a priority for the authority the work is aimed at providing the region with product of local producer and at delivering to it territory a sufficient number of good from the rostov region the dpr of course local enterprise that are concerned about the need to export their product also receive assistance for example a new route for the movement of heavy truck through the dpr to rostov wa recently established just to organize the sale of agricultural product and after the restoration of the highway odessa melitopol novoazovsk logistics will become even easier and more profitable rural fair which are held regularly also help to find buyer it wa thanks to them that agreement were concluded on the supply of product of local farmer to the dpr kherson and rostov region and at producer price processing enterprise work without interruption also buying raw material from farmer and then selling their product in local store i am grateful to agricultural producer for the fact that in difficult condition they continue to work and supply quality product not only to our region but also to neighboring one i want to assure you that at present there is no shortage of food product in the market of the zaporizhzhya region said the acting governor of the region yevhen balitsky the guarantor of food security in the region remains small business those people who are most interested in the success of their work on the production and sale of consumer good they have question every day on the new taxation system the formation of the ruble exchange rate against the hryvnia work with buyer representative of authority relevant department and the tax service help to solve emerging difficulty recently a round table for entrepreneur on topical issue wa held in melitopol it wa attended by director of trading platform local market individual entrepreneur it turned out for example that the issue of the exchange rate of monetary unit is still relevant after the hryvnia exchange rate against the ruble fell from to many complaint are received from buyer representative of the ministry of tariff and price regulation explained that now the rate for everyone is the same and a similar multiplier should be applied everywhere regardless of the site you can tell about the problem with price in the chatbot in the telegram patrulcen bot employee of the department are constantly conducting inspection so recently they checked the wholesale base on polevoy street special attention is always paid to the price of socially significant food and non food product also at the same time inspector look at the storage condition of product in warehouse and the quality of the storage place themselves in order for people to have fewer question more information is needed special leaflet with explanation are placed in market and store another topical issue is work in the condition of the transition period restructuring under the new regulatory framework especially entrepreneur are interested in taxation issue since january the russian tax system will operate in the region but now everyone is working according to the previously adopted regulatory act a simplified taxation system ha been introduced for all entrepreneur in fact they pay turnover tax from january it will be necessary to switch to new rail and it will be necessary for entrepreneur to register a subject of russian territory already now you can learn all about the transition to the new rule in the local tax office which serve a center for business registration registration of business in new subject is free of charge without paying the state fee for both the existing and the business being created important for farmer subsidy in the zaporozhye region there are benefit for entrepreneur who themselves grow winter wheat barley and rapeseed a well a produce milk document for obtaining a subsidy can be issued in the ministry of agriculture and food policy of the zaporizhzhya region or in the territorial administration at the location of the agricultural enterprise they will provide a list of document that need to be collected who can get help individual and legal entity except for personal subsidiary plot working in zaporozhye region registered with the tax and tax authority of the region have no tax arrears who have not previously received fund from the budget of the zaporizhzhya region specifically how to contact the federal tax service of zaporizhzhya region address of the branch melitopol belyaeva str a heroiv ukrainyi st ready to send any supporting document at the request of the school mikhail rodikov assured a child is enrolled in school on the basis of an application by a parent legal representative if a child arrives accompanied by a relative or other person who doe not have the legal right to represent the interest of a particular child or is unaccompanied he will be admitted to school on the basis of a statement by a relative another person or on the basis of a personal statement by a child who ha reached the age of year if there are document on training the child is enrolled in the class corresponding to the class in which he studied earlier if there are no document an intermediate certification without assessment will be carried out to determine the class of training the authority specified to register in a kindergarten parent need to contact the municipal education authority at the place of their location at the same time take an identity document with you the child s birth certificate a document of registration or a document confirming the fact of residence in the territory of the municipality kstat professional examination of child are carried out in all four new civilian have been killed in the past week including four men whose fatal mistake resident said wa to stand together outside and share some coffee along kherson s riverbank people dart behind wall villager said so he started collaborating with the russian and made up a story that vlad and the other security guard were spying on the russian one morning in mid april anatoliy sikoza a neighbor said he s a hunter and know a thing or two about death and i could tell it wasn t the explosion that killed them he said he stepped closer he saw that several of the men had their hand tied behind their back and that their eye were blindfolded the girl he said looked a if she had been strangled such discovery have been a recurring horror in ukraine in april after the russian withdrew from the called dragon s teeth anti tank defense on the east bank of the dnipro river across from kherson city the russian defensive position suggest that the russian military leadership view the prospect of a analyst have speculated that rather than attempt a dangerous river crossing near kherson ukraine s military might instead attempt a new offensive starting far upstream where it already control land on the east bank of the dnipro ukraine s river have proved a formidable obstacle for both side in the conflict with attempt to cross them often putting troop in vulnerable position analyst say that any concerted attempt by ukrainian force to cross the dnipro would most likely involve extensive preparation the ukrainian authority have declined to give detail of military operation in the south since front line the russian are mostly digging in for winter to entrench and conserve resource in summer after russian force captured the neighboring province of luhansk seizing bakhmut might have looked like a natural progression in russia s campaign to conquer the east a step toward two more important city sloviansk and kramatorsk but now analyst said given the degradation of russian force and their ammunition shortage after a series of setback that goal seems improbable especially after the loss of their foothold in the northeast the russian military is still dealing with unrealistic political demand to show progress said michael kofman the director of russian study at c n a a research institute in arlington va but given poor quality of available force and decreasing stock of artillery ammunition they are unlikely to be successful because once again the russian military appears to be feeding unit piecemeal without adequate support in recent week moscow s need for any type of military victory ha made itself felt in pocket elsewhere along the front line small village near the russian controlled city of donetsk have turned into flash point but a the temperature plummet bakhmut ha quickly evolved into moscow s main effort where mass of their force including recently mobilized troop according to ukrainian soldier are trying to strangle the city from the east and south russia s strategy in bakhmut is reminiscent of it seizure of the eastern city of sievierodonetsk and lysychansk in june there russian troop relied on superior artillery fire to overpower ukrainian force and gain ground but the ukrainian force they faced then were short of both shell and western supplied artillery something that is no longer a pressing especially in bakhmut in the six month that i ve been in bakhmut i have never seen our artillery working like this said a ukrainian soldier in the city referring to the volume of ukrainian shell fired he spoke on the condition of anonymity the ukrainian are firing ammunition at an unsustainable rate especially in place like bakhmut under the false assumption that the west s supply of ordnance is unlimited said the u s defense official and kherson region this is a law that will simply allow person from four new subject on the territory of the russian federation to conduct normal business activity explains andrei klishas one of the initiator of the law the head of the federation council committee on constitutional legislation and state construction so according to the document the information that wa contained in the relevant register of the dpr lpr zaporozhye and kherson region that is data on the name address and head must be entered into the unified state register of legal entity unified state register of legal entity until december a for the constituent documentation for those legal entity that are located on the territory of the donbas republic it must be brought into line with russian legislation by december for entrepreneur and organization of zaporizhzhya and kherson region this period ha been extended until june organization that do not comply with the requirement for constituent document will be excluded from the register and this is a complete ban on activity legal entity whose information about them is not in the register of the lpr dpr zaporozhye and kherson region can bring their constituent document in line with russian legislation and apply for entering information about them in the register or acquire the status of a branch representative office of a foreign legal entity the deadline for such organization is june if they work on the territory of the dpr and lpr and december for legal entity from zaporozhye and kherson region if they do not bring the document in line with russian legislation within the designated period and do not receive the status of a branch of a foreign legal entity they will be forbidden to work in russia the law also state that individual entrepreneur included in the relevant territorial register can continue to do business until june without mandatory re registration but in order to stay in service after this date they will need to register a an individual entrepreneur in the manner prescribed by law by the way the document signed by the president also clarifies the status of treaty and unilateral transaction concluded in new territory before their entry into the russian federation according to the law the term of such contract will remain in force except in case established by federal law it is noted that the rule introduced by the law apply to bank and non bank financial institution taking into account the feature established by federal law and presidential decree reference kp how to re register a business and which special regime of the pest that turned off musk s satellite over the special operation zone is already known this is the russian ew complex tirada s it wa created to jam enemy communication satellite he is helped by a system that warns of a missile attack having received data from her tirada jam musk s satellite with pulse of the desired frequency the result is that the connection between space and ground terminal is cut off after that the multi star british general michael wigston said that in the future due to the stunning development of russian electronic warfare not only the american starlink and it english colleague oneweb would work poorly the general wa wrong in his prediction the future ha already come although the year history of the creation of tirade is complex and dramatic there were period when the design work on the project lost it pulse there wa no money there were scientific and technological dead end and customer have already preferred a different system but the specialist of the moscow research radio engineering institute and progress jsc were able to save defend and bring it to mind vladislav korolev a member of the project told me tirada s is capable of interrupting any satellite communication within a radius of ten of kilometer completely making the spacecraft inactive it main weapon is a narrow beam aimed at the frequency of the satellite communication channel and creating special interference that interferes with the transmission of the signal to the addressee no matter how incredible noise immunity the satellite ha it will still spend all it energy on desperate attempt to break through the electromagnetic curtain but he will not be able to bypass the tirade victorious doubt in no le dramatic scientific and technical torment our laser gun peresvet wa born which today is also on the battlefield how many time did the highbrow luminary sentence him to death russian academician yevgeny alexandrov stated that theoretically such a laser could be built in mean of countering enemy air defense caliber doe not fly in a straight trajectory but change it depending on the terrain and the observed enemy anti aircraft system if the kalibr electronics detect the radiation of someone else s air defense or electronic warfare the missile instantly change the trajectory and rebuilds the flight route gloomy is a nugget not so long ago a unique weapon citizen of the russian federation new support measure are now available in the region for example family with child will have the right to maternity capital at the birth of child and will receive it when the state service and the mfc begin to work business can take advantage of the benefit now in russia you can get a loan at a minimum interest grant are issued to young entrepreneur subsidy are allocated for the employment of young people and much more everyone who ha registered in accordance with the procedure established by law can take advantage of these opportunity there is a transition period in the region thus information on the name address and head of legal entity which were contained in the relevant register of the zaporizhzhya region must be entered into the unified state register of legal entity by june legal entity that do not bring their constituent document in line with the legislation of the russian federation will be excluded from the register at the same time entrepreneur have the right to continue their activity without re registration until june without the necessary registration after the specified date they will not be able to legally conduct business it is noted that contract and unilateral transaction made in the zaporozhye region before joining the russian federation will remain in force except for case established by federal law in addition without registration in the unified state register of legal entity it will not be possible to issue permit or license for licensed activity for example transportation of passenger educational activity medical activity and others for doing business without the necessary permission significant fine are threatened in the zaporizhzhya region state subsidy are available to agricultural producer agrarians can take advantage of support for the production of winter crop such a wheat rapeseed barley and assistance in the production and processing of milk is also available agricultural producer in the region are helped in the sale of their own product for each ton of barley rye oat and wheat you can get a subsidy said the representative of the ministry of agriculture and food policy of the zaporozhye region sergey lesnevsky document for payment can be submitted until december at the address melitopol ivan alekseev street nd floor work continues in the region to regulate price and stabilize the range of good local resident help in this they say which good are in short supply and which item have become unaffordable there wa a wave like rise in price in the region price for food and household chemical have been raised several time since the beginning of the special operation now special commission go shopping they communicate with entrepreneur keep report conduct survey among loitering ammunition drone and shell in one bottle we told about the work of one of them at the very beginning it is possible that the destruction of that hidden radar wa the result of the work of one of the first reconnaissance and strike unmanned system information on the development of such a system wa distributed by the ria novosti agency it essence is that the reconnaissance drone having detected the target immediately transmits the coordinate to the strike flying brother they collapse after a few minute there is no time to relocate with the enemy the strike system can include reconnaissance drone for example zala e or conventional army orlan and the striking force can be loitering ammunition cube geranium or one of the type of uav lancet all these weapon received a baptism of fire during a special military operation the task of destroying the target however can be performed by any strike mean starting from artillery and ending with hurricane and iskander the russian ministry of defense distributes a lot of video evidence of the successful operation of these complex on the network weapon depot artillery battery armored vehicle and entire fortified area fly into the air yes such combat work is not always noticeable not everyone follows the report of the russian defense ministry but those who know know that the russian troop have small victory almost every day most often the shooting of a video in which the enemy is destroyed come from the same reconnaissance drone from a height but there are also those where the result of the blow are visible on one of them the russian military walk past an armored personnel carrier with traditional polish cross in white paint on the side around and inside are dead mercenary pole are say the voice over look it s clear from the cross and clothes well for these polish warrior safari on the russian did not work out at all kstat a breakthrough in military medicine russian military doctor have achieved tremendous success in treating wounded fighter in the main military clinical hospital named after n n burdenko the ministry of defense of russia introduced a new method of d modeling of implant for the full restoration of limb in severe mine explosive and gunshot wound previously such wound often led to amputation now the bone is being recreated in a so called titanium case perfectly repeating the missing fragment a leonid brizhan deputy head of the burdenko state veterinary hospital for research deputy chief traumatologist of the ministry of defense of russia told reporter an individual three dimensional implant is created for each patient which is installed in the defect area and filled with element of bone tissue specially grown using stem cell of the wounded with the addition of the patient s muscle tissue according to doctor the first patient with a tibia of the leg grown in a case ha already returned to combat position in the svo zone shelling of the left bank ha become more pravda after the evacuation of civilian of the kherson region to the left bank of the dnieper and to other region of the country many are concerned about how to continue to build life but russia is not abandoning it own the authority quickly introduced social support measure the head of the ministry of labor of the regional administration alla barkhatova told about how to get help what difficulty kherson resident face after evacuation and about the situation in the komsomolka region alla viktorovna how wa the evacuation from kherson these were very difficult day i ve seen it in my staff they communicated with family persuaded them to leave someone left parent and loved one without exception everyone discussed what to do next we evacuated people with limited mobility pensioner and the lonely they took out an orphanage geriatric institution bedridden patient from hospital patient of a psychiatric hospital are there any statistic on how many people have been evacuated since the beginning of the evacuation from the right bank more than thousand kherson resident have already left their home and apartment the evacuation of pensioner wa the most difficult yes because they didn t always have a mean of communication and we went to them only through relative including those who live in russia for example this wa the case with the evacuation of a year old woman by some miracle her son found my phone number and i together with the military commandant of kherson began to search for a pensioner what is the situation now on the left bank there are temporary accommodation point for evacuee people can get advice food clothes take a shower we have created all the necessary condition for temporary residence then people decide where to go next or they can stay on the left bank of the kherson region in general the left bank continues to live a normal life with the exception of the kilometer zone we have educational institution all service health care shop and market are open you can buy almost all product and basic necessity is there humanitarian aid for them a humanitarian center wa created on the left bank he s literally on the front line the supervising deputy of our ministry is engaged in the evacuation of the population and the distribution of humanitarian aid the guy in the warehouse of henichesk and skadovsk form food package for the population on average more than ton of humanitarian aid are issued per week alla viktorovna what support measure in general can now be received by kherson resident people who have reached retirement age or old age pension year for men and woman ed are entitled to payment in the amount of thousand ruble in addition pensioner who have reached the age of are paid another thousand ruble you can get a pension in any municipal district of the region for example if you lived in kherson but evacuated then you can easily get your money in skadovsk or henichesk the same convenient procedure is provided for those who moved to u from the zaporozhye region the lpr or the dpr what about other category of the population social payment are also due to family with child under year of age for each child single mother receive benefit there is a payment for pregnancy and separately at the birth of a child also any woman in labor will receive maternity capital i note that if a child study full time at a university with state accreditation then until the age of he is entitled to an allowance we also took care of the veteran of the great patriotic war guardian and many others from kherson resident there are many question about obtaining lifting thousand ruble and certificate for the purchase of housing yes these support measure are due to those evacuee who have moved to a permanent place of residence in other region of the russian federation you can arrange them in any multifunctional center the certificate is issued on the basis of the norm of living space per person and the average cost of one square meter of housing in the russian market for single square are due for a family of two people square for family of three or more people square for each the demand is probably great a of november we received more than thousand application for housing certificate from kherson resident the record holder are the krasnodar territory and the crimea where resident of the region are actively moving specifically all up to date information on payment can be obtained on the hotlines administration pension fund ministry of labour and social protection for question regarding certificate and lifting payment you can call the single hotline in addition evacuated kherson resident are entitled to a one time payment of thousand ruble according to the ministry of labor and social policy of the kherson region resident have already begun to receive both the algorithm is simple it is necessary to come to any mfc in henichesk and skadovsk where temporary accommodation center also operate the mfcs are also open the applicant must present a set of document and consent to the processing of personal data for document drawn up in ukrainian you will need a translation in a simple written form specialist will review the document within five day a for the issuance of a certificate a person can look after housing from to month the only condition is that he must choose a home in the subject of the russian federation in which he submitted the application then the contract of sale shall be registered in the federal service for state registration of cadastre and cartography the last stage is the transfer of money to the seller after checking the document provided mother of six child irina kachur became one of the first recipient of the housing certificate the woman ha now settled in anapa he also want to buy a house there i am glad that we came to russia it is calm here the air is fresh where we used to live in the kherson region in the village of kliny it is restless constantly shooting missile are flying thank god i got to russia i dreamed of it and now i know for sure that dream come true she said what document are required application for a one time payment of thousand ruble and a certificate identity document of the applicant detail for a current account opened with an authorized bank to obtain a housing certificate it is also necessary to confirm the fact of permanent residence in the kherson region need passport of the russian federation with a residence permit in the kherson region in it absence you can provide a document confirming the ownership of real estate and a citizen s assurance of the fact of permanent residence in the region a document confirming the right of ownership if such a document is not available it is necessary to write an application with your own hand informing about the presence of a house or apartment in the territory of the kherson region in this case the situation is considered by a special interdepartmental commission and decides on the issuance of a certificate reference kp the nominal value of the housing certificate is determined on the basis of the average cost of square meter meter of housing in russia ruble the established norm of area per person is also taken into account for single square meter meter for a family of two square meter meter for a family of three or more people square meter meter for each family member the restoration and construction of housing and social infrastructure in the donetsk people s republic by russian specialist is not going according to plan said deputy prime minister of the russian federation marat khusnullin what ha already been restored chuck the high thigh were helplessly plunged into the wet dirty slurry a soon a i jumped out of the like that icebreaker volunteered to pave the way to the forest thicket where we came to visit the god of war and at the same time get acquainted with the crew which consist entirely of those mobilized at the front in ukraine recently relative of those called up to the special operation zone often complain to me in telegram about the difficult condition at the front water is in the trench it rain they sleep in dugout on the one hand civilian can be understood they are worried about their husband brother son and it is difficult for a person purely peaceful to immediately accept that the same donbas ha been fighting in these condition for the th year on the other hand after all the charter say that the soldier is obliged to endure all the hardship and deprivation of service although this doe not mean that it can be plowed like on a draft horse with the third a i warned at the beginning of the mobilization no one will run after the fighter and equip his life you will have to work with your own hand and i have long noticed that first of all everything depends on the commander where a competent officer is able to organize the work of subordinate a a rule there are no serious problem and where the fighter are left to their own device and the complaint begin so what is the news about the special operation on november well yes dirt and where do you go from it she doesn t help anyone on the civilian side okay we cope with a poorly concealed smile he examined u from head to toe mobilized with the call sign eagle after a short trip through the forest we completely merged with the local landscape smeared on the sideburn oryol from kotovsk tambov region in the past life a builder built shopping center wa engaged in decoration he say that when the summons wa handed there were not year old the other is he named his car a slaughter weapon actually the eagle look respectfully at the multi ton colossus often you get in and you think why we called her jeweler wink the partner of the eagle with the call sign golden in the world a welder i remember a goal in particular we were working in the kharkov direction then in the area of cossack lopan reconnaissance gave target there the enemy wa seriously strengthened concreted well in short break them the scout then thanked u by communication you work closely with them well of course they give u the coordinate this is an example a they say of working online the special force of the western military district in the course of reconnaissance identify target and immediately bypassing the complex system of hierarchy and subordination transmit data to artilleryman who are ready to strike in two minute we have a tulip crew the largest mortar in the world caliber millimeter from the mobilized which is preparing to fire three time faster than the standard the accompanying officer lead u around the camp there is an opportunity to see how the fighter live in the condition of autumn rasputitsa tent barrack are scattered pouring rain the washed form is dried it look infernal i remember how for many year i wa engaged in military archeology at the site of the battle of the great patriotic war in the novgorod region there in the swamp where the second shock army perished i wa always amazed at how our grandfather managed to fight in such unbearable condition constant dampness cold all the charm of forest life from gnat to chuckle under your foot which is trying to suck your boot and you stand in the midst of all this splendor look at ordinary russian men who have become real soldier a an extern and understand what gene are in their practical expression and here is the same record breaking crew zhenk is a modest man from the village of verkhny shibryay also in the tambov region he wa a farm labourer and now possible there is a desire you would see how happy they are when they are informed that target have been hit really like child admits the attendant and in term of professional quality they can no longer be distinguished from personnel calculation sometimes they can give a head start at that moment something wa noisy outside the wall of the caf it wa a if someone abruptly turned on the sound of the waterfall increased rain broke through a small dam somewhere and stream of water flowed throughout the camp well we ll rearrange the tent again one of the fighter standing next to him shrugged and he said it a if he wa going to go to the next house for bread so if we did it a second time or a third time we do not stay in one place for a long time we have had so many of these move that one more one le guy are standing a they say on a breakthrough direction the svatovsky frontier ha become a new serif line in front of the territory of the lugansk people s republic which the enemy ha been
